Title: The Transformers:Call of the Future
Description: a Japanese game based on the Transformers.

Title: Sly 2: Band of Thieves
Description: Sly 2: Band of Thieves follows the Cooper Gang as they attempt to recover the dismantled parts of Clockwerk from an international criminal and spice dealing organization known as the Klaww Gang.

Title: Shadow Man: 2econd Coming
Description: PlayStation 2 exclusive follow-up to the 1999 game based on the comic books of the same name.

Title: Piglet's Big Game
Description: A pair of games based on the Disney Winnie the Pooh film 'Piglet's Big Movie', putting the timid side-character Piglet front-and-center.

Title: Dragon Quest VIII: Journey of the Cursed King
Description: The eighth main entry in the Dragon Quest franchise. It was the first game in the series to utilize a full 3D environment and featured a cel-shaded graphics style which would become standard in the main series until the release of Dragon Quest X.

Title: Garfield
Description: Based on the syndicated comic strip of the same name, Garfield follows the curmudgeonly cat as he tries to clean up the house before his owner returns home.

Title: Spirits and Spells
Description: Action platformer

Title: Triggerheart Exelica
Description: Take control of cute "Triggerheart" gynoids as they defend Earth from the alien race Ver'mith in Warashi's final shoot-'em-up.

Title: Contra
Description: A Konami run-and-gun famous for its fast-paced, gritty, old-school action.

Title: Final Fantasy XI Online
Description: Players from across the globe enter the world of Vana'diel for a Final Fantasy adventure in the series' first foray into the MMORPG genre.

Title: Beyond Good & Evil
Description: The story of a young, curious, and green-loving photojournalist named Jade, out to unravel an alien conspiracy on her home planet of Hillys.

Title: Jak and Daxter: The Precursor Legacy
Description: Take on the role of Jak, and embark on a long journey to change Daxter back from his ottsel form.

Title: Cybernator
Description: Side-scrolling mech action in space and on Earth. The game is known as Assault Suits Valken in Japan and is the second game in Masaya's Assault Suits series of mech run-and-gun shooters.

Title: Maze Action
Description: In this game you face off foes in a maze, a high on action maze.

Title: Alien Hominid
Description: A yellow, bug-like alien has crash-landed, and he must blast a lot of agents to get his confiscated ship back in this comedic side-scrolling run-'n'-gun platformer from some of Newgrounds's finest.

Title: Astro Boy
Description: An action-adventure game by Sonic Team, based on the 2003-2004 revival of the classic sci-fi superhero anime Astro Boy.

Title: Castle Shikigami 2
Description: Alfa System's paranormal shoot-'em-up returns with two-player co-operative play, as well as new characters and play styles. Its often known for its humorously poor localization.

Title: Puchi Copter 2
Description: A sequel to Aqua System's R/C helicopter flying game.

Title: RC Helicopter Indoor Adventure
Description: Take control of one of several toy R/C helicopters and fly around various indoor home environments in this flight simulation game from Japanese developer Aqua System.

Title: Billy the Wizard: Rocket Broomstick Racing
Description: A spoof of the Harry Potter series, with several mini-games involving student wizards riding their broomsticks around their wizarding school.

Title: Kya: Dark Lineage
Description: After falling through a portal she discovered in her house, Kya is transported into a strange world. There, she encounters the Nativs, a tribe that is fighting against the evil Brazul and his minions. Can she help the Nativs in their fight and return safe to her world?

Title: Final Fantasy X
Description: The first Final Fantasy game for the PlayStation 2 brought cinematic quality to the series with voice acting and fully 3D environments. The story follows Tidus, a young man transported one thousand years into the future to find a world quite unlike his own.

Title: M&M's Adventure
Description: Save the M&M's candy factory yet again in this 3D platformer starring the main trio of M&M's "spokescandies".

Title: Fuuraiki
Description: A romantic adventure game by FOG about a photographer traveling to Hokkaido Japan to take pictures for a writing assignment. During his journey he will meet various people, travel to places on his motorcycle as well as interact with several different heroines.

Title: Ever17: The Out of Infinity
Description: A visual novel game released in 2002 that focuses on a group of people who are trapped in an undersea theme park. Mysterious happenings are abound and time is running out so the group must band together to escape alive.

Title: K-1 World Grand Prix: The Beast Attack!
Description: K-1 World Grand Prix: The Beast Attack! is a Kickboxing game, published by Konami, which was released in Japan in 2003.

Title: Neopets: The Darkest Faerie
Description: The Darkest Faerie has returned to take over Meridell and Brightvale in this RPG/Platformer Neopets Game

Title: Kamaitachi no Yoru Triple: Mikazukishima Jiken no Shinsou
Description: The third entry in the Kamaitachi no Yoru series of sound novels by Chunsoft.

Title: Disney's Extreme Skate Adventure
Description: A kids-focused spin-off of the Tony Hawk's Pro Skater series, featuring characters and locales from three Disney films (Toy Story, The Lion King, and Tarzan).

Title: Dream Mix TV World Fighters
Description: A crossover party fighting game in the vein of Smash Bros., Dream Mix TV World Fighters brings together characters from a diverse assortment of Konami, Hudson, and Takara franchises.

Title: Myst III: Exile
Description: Exile is the third game in the Myst series in which you play the Stranger, a friend of Atrus. In Exile, you must once again clean up a monumental mess created by Atrus' unruly sons.

Title: MotoGP 4
Description: Namco's street bike franchise goes online with 16 tracks and real riders exclusively for PS2.

Title: The Sopranos: Road to Respect
Description: The Sopranos: Road to Respect is a licensed game based on the hit TV show The Sopranos. The game puts players in the shoes of petty mobster Joey LaRocca as you "whack" your way to becoming a made man in Tony Soprano's crew.

Title: Otostaz
Description: A Japan-only action-puzzle game for the PS2.

Title: King of Colosseum Red
Description: King of Colosseum Red is a Japanese pro wrestling game featuring the All Japan Pro Wrestling, New Japan Pro Wrestling and MMA org, Pancrase Hybrid Wrestling.

Title: J-League Winning Eleven 8 Asia Championship
Description: J.League Winning Eleven 8 Asia Championship, also known as K-League Winning Eleven 8 Asia Championship in South Korea, and World Soccer Winning Eleven 8 Asia Championship in China, was the first game on the Asia Championship series, an updated version of PES 4 that is developed and published by Konami. The game was released only on PlayStation 2.

Title: AC/DC Live: Rock Band
Description: AC/DC Live is a standalone expansion for the Rock Band platform. It features 18 of the classic rock band's most popular songs, recorded live during concert. New 360 and PS3 versions contain a code that allows the songs to be imported into other Rock Band titles as DLC.

Title: Ys III: Wanderers from Ys
Description: The third game in the Ys series developed by Nihon Falcom that introduced a new side-scrolling perspective and allowed the player to directly control Adol's ability to attack and jump for the first time.

Title: GANTZ: The Game
Description: Based on the popular anime and manga that focuses on dead people fighting aliens in a survival game.

Title: Disney/Pixar's Monsters Inc.
Description: A action adventure game based around the classic Pixar movie, in which you help Sulley and Mike get Boo back to her world before the CDA catches up with you.

Title: Tiger Woods PGA Tour 2001
Description: Tiger Woods PGA Tour 2001 (also known as Tiger Woods PGA Tour Golf for the PlayStation version) is a sports video game developed by Headgate Studios for the Microsoft Windows version, Stormfront Studios for the PlayStation version, and EA Redwood Shores for the PlayStation 2 version, and published by EA Sports for Windows and PlayStation in 2000 and PlayStation 2 in 2001. The latter console version was ported to Japan and published by Electronic Arts Square on June 21, 2001.

Title: Street Golfer
Description: Tee off on Japanese streets in this over-the-top PS2 golf game.

Title: K-1 World Max 2005
Description: K-1 World Max 2005 is a Kickboxing game, developed and published by D3, which was released in Japan in 2005.

Title: Yu-Gi-Oh! Capsule Monster Coliseum
Description: A turn-based strategy game set in the Yu-Gi-Oh! universe, based on the in-universe monster figurine board game Capsule Monster Chess.

Title: Wild Arms Alter Code: F
Description: A remake of the classic Playstation title. Return to the legendary realm of Filgaia where an evil force from ancient prophecies threatens to destroy all life on the planet.

Title: Gokuraku Jongg
Description: A sequel to Enterbrain's falling-block puzzle game about forming mahjong hands.

Title: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 4
Description: The fourth installment of Tony Hawk's skateboarding series features a new free-roaming Career mode and a new assortment of tricks, challenges, and mini-games.

Title: Alpine Racer 3
Description: Alpine Racer 3 is a Skiing game by Namco.

Title: Super Trucks Racing
Description: Race trucks at speeds over 150 mph.  Race them around 15 tracks and in 6 different modes.

Title: MXrider
Description: . It was the first title released under Infogrames' newly reinvented Atari brand, which Infogrames used alongside their own branding until 2003. MX Rider features over 10 real Grand Prix riders and includes all the tracks from the 2000 world motocross GP championship.

Title: Siren
Description: A stealth-based horror game that takes place in the small village of Hanuda, Japan. The main enemies are zombie-like creatures known as Shibitos.

Title: Mortal Kombat: Deception
Description: The sixth installment in the violent fighting game franchise, introducing a manual "Combo Breaker" system and online multiplayer while adding a more in-depth Konquest Mode.

Title: Yanya Caballista: City Skater
Description: Cell-shaded action skateboarding game, in which performing tricks kills invasive aliens, called "Gawoo."  Includes a fingerboard-style controller that attaches to analog sticks.

Title: Return to Castle Wolfenstein
Description: B.J. Blazkowicz returns to fight elite Nazi troopers, supernatural creatures, and mechanized super soldiers in this reboot of the original 1991 classic Wolfenstein 3D.

Title: Neo Contra
Description: Nearly two thousand years since his last act of combat, Bill Rizer returns to deal with the new "Neo Contra" threat in this 3D top-down shooter for the PlayStation 2.

Title: BCV: Battle Construction Vehicles
Description: Fighting game but with construction vehicles.

Title: Sega Rally 2006
Description: The third entry in the Sega Rally series of rally racing games, only released in Japan and Korea.

Title: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3
Description: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3 brings new levels, new skaters, new tricks (such as hidden trick variations and the Revert), and online multiplayer.

Title: Final Fight
Description: Final Fight is a classic beat-em-up game developed by Capcom featuring a memorable cast of characters, including Guy, Cody, and the first and only mustachioed ex-pro-wrestler turned mayor, Mike Haggar. Released for the CPS arcade system in 1989 and then ported to the SNES and other home systems.

Title: K-1 World GP 2006
Description: K-1 World GP 2006 is a Kickboxing game, developed and published by D3, which was released in Japan in 2006.

Title: Tom and Jerry: War of the Whiskers
Description: A sequel to the cartoon slapstick fighter Tom and Jerry in Fists of Furry, featuring new friends to battle with and crazy four-player combat.

Title: Alone in the Dark
Description: A reboot of the Alone in the Dark series, once again following Edward Carnby in his fight against the vile creatures of the darkness.

Title: Tony Hawk's American Wasteland
Description: Skate throughout a virtual Los Angeles in the seventh installment of the Tony Hawk series of skateboarding games.

Title: Tony Hawk's Underground 2
Description: Join Tony Hawk and his pro skater team as they try to beat Bam Margera's group of misfits in the over-the-top World Destruction Tour.

Title: Tony  Hawk's Underground
Description: Go from a local unknown to a superstar skater in the fifth installment of the Tony Hawk series of skateboarding games.

Title: WWE SmackDown! Shut Your Mouth
Description: Shut Your Mouth! is the fourth game in the Smackdown! Series and its second outing on the Playstation 2. It features the usual roster updates, tweaks to the control scheme, as well as a brand new season mode that improves greatly on the previous offering in the last game.

Title: WWE SmackDown! vs. RAW 2010
Description: The eleventh game of the SmackDown! games developed by Yuke's Co.

Title: LEGO Island: Xtreme Stunts
Description: Pizza delivery boy Pepper Roni becomes an action movie stuntman in the third and final installment of the Lego Island series of open-world games based on the Lego toyline.

Title: Taito Memories Gekan
Description: Taito Memories Gekan (Vol. 2) compiles 25 Taito arcade games and was released in Japan for the PS2.

Title: Tokyo Xtreme Racer Drift
Description: A spin-off of the Tokyo Xtreme Racer series, focused on drifting-heavy touge racing.

Title: Kaidō Battle 2: Chain Reaction
Description: A drifting focused racing game for the PS2, featuring mountain courses around Japan.

Title: Tokyo Xtreme Racer Drift 2
Description: The third and final game in the touge-based "Kaidou Battle" sub-series of Genki's street racing series Tokyo Xtreme Racer.

Title: The Simpsons Game
Description: One of America's favorite animated families find themselves with video game powers in this spoof-heavy action-adventure platformer based on The Simpsons.

Title: SVC Chaos: SNK vs. Capcom
Description: After over a decade of rivalry, SNK brings its fight with Capcom into its home turf: the Neo Geo.

Title: Premier Manager 09
Description: A soccer management simulation game.

Title: R:Racing Evolution
Description: A sim-style car racing game from the studio behind the Ridge Racer series, featuring multiple racing styles (GT, rally, and drag) and a dedicated story mode.

Title: Premier Manager 2003-04
Description: A soccer management simulation game.

Title: UFC: Sudden Impact
Description: UFC: Sudden Impact is the second game released on the Playstation 2 based on the popular mixed martial arts organization.

Title: Pro Evolution Soccer 6
Description: Pro Evolution Soccer 6 (also known as World Soccer: Winning Eleven 10 and World Soccer: Winning Eleven X for Xbox 360 in Japan and South Korea, Winning Eleven: Pro Evolution Soccer 2007 in the United States) is a video game developed and published by Konami.

Title: FIFA World Cup: Germany 2006
Description: Challenge as your favourite national squad for the World Cup.

Title: Kowloon High-School Chronicle
Description: A dungeon crawler RPG with adventure game segments where the player can increase their relationship with other characters.

Title: Star Wars: Bounty Hunter
Description: The game follows the life of Jango Fett as he tries to hunt down the dark jedi Komari Vosa and collect the bounty on her head.

Title: SkyGunner
Description: An whimsical arcade shooter for the PlayStation 2 with surprising depth that rewards multiple playthroughs.

Title: Monster Bass
Description: A Japanese-exclusive fishing game from Konami.

Title: UFC: Throwdown
Description: Build the best fighter, and destroy the rest.

Title: An American Tail
Description: A budget 3D platformer and an adaptation of the 1986 animated film of the same name.

Title: Casper's Scare School
Description: A 3D platformer based on the 2006 CGI television film of the same name.

Title: Casper and the Ghostly Trio
Description: A Europe-exclusive platformer based on the cartoon ghost child Casper the Friendly Ghost.

Title: The Thing
Description: The semi-sequel to the 1982 sci-fi horror film.

Title: Myth Makers: Trixie in Toyland
Description: A budget platformer nearly-identical to Ninjabread Man, starring a pajama-garbed girl in a land of toys.

Title: Anubis II
Description: A budget platformer nearly identical to Ninjabread Man, starring an anthropomorphic version of the ancient Egyptian god Anubis. Despite the numeral in its title, it is not a sequel.

Title: Ninjabread Man
Description: Candy Land is invaded by bees and mutant sweets. Are you a bad enough gingerbread man to save the once sweet and tasty land?

Title: The Shadow of Zorro
Description: The Shadow of Zorro allows players to take the legendary hero on an adventure on PlayStation 2 and PC.

Title: Downhill Domination
Description: Downhill Domination is a mountain biking game that focuses on fast and dangerous downhill descents, on-bike combat and gigantic jumps and tricks. The game is from the same team that brought us Twisted Metal: Black.

Title: Resident Evil 4
Description: Special agent Leon S. Kennedy travels to rural Spain to rescue the U.S. President's kidnapped daughter in Resident Evil's sixth canonical installment. It is notable for a lengthy development cycle which involved a complete overhaul of the series' established gameplay mechanics.

Title: Backyard Wrestling 2: There Goes the Neighborhood
Description: Backyard Wrestling 2: There Goes the Neighborhood is an arcade style fighting game loosely based on no holds barred wrestling.

Title: X-Treme Express: World Grand Prix
Description: Train driving gets over-the-top in this arcade-style high-speed train racing game for the PS2.

Title: King of Colosseum II
Description: A Japanese wrestling game developed by Spike. Features many real promotions and real licensed Japanese wrestlers.

Title: The Urbz: Sims in the City
Description: The Urbz is a console-oriented spin-off of the Sims series. Unlike other Sims titles it focuses less on building and furnishing homes and more on social interactions.

Title: The Sims
Description: The Sims is the console version of the computer game of the same name. Using a different engine as its computer-counterpart, these games are considered different.

Title: The Sims
Description: Construct and furnish a home, and then influence the day-to-day lives of its occupants (called Sims) in an isometrical "people simulator" by Will Wright.

Title: Ben 10: Protector of Earth
Description: The second Ben 10 made to tie-in with the TV series.

Title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Phantom Blood
Description: An action game based on the first arc of the JJBA manga.

Title: Tetris Worlds
Description: The alien "Minos" must colonize six distant worlds before their homeworld is destroyed, each of which require mastery of six different variations of the classic falling-blocks puzzle game Tetris.

Title: Sega Ages 2500 Series Vol. 28: Tetris Collection
Description: A Japan-only PS2 compilation of Sega's earlier arcade adaptations of the puzzle game Tetris, along with a new remix that's built on the modern Tetris specifications.

Title: Wangan Midnight
Description: The first video game adaptation of the street racing manga of the same name, developed by the studio behind the Tokyo Xtreme Racer series.

Title: Fallout: Brotherhood of Steel
Description: Fallout: Brotherhood of Steel is a top-down Action RPG game set in the post-apocalyptic Fallout universe using a modified version of Snowblind's Baldur's Gate: Dark Alliance engine. Players explore dungeons, complete quests, kill monsters and gather loot in single-player or two-player cooperative gameplay.

Title: Racing Battle: C1 Grand Prix
Description: A Japan-only spin-off of the Tokyo Xtreme Racer series of racing games and a spiritual successor to the other circuit-based "car tuning RPG" spin-off Kattobi Tune.

Title: MotorStorm: Arctic Edge
Description: Take trucks to the tundra as MotorStorm debuts on the PSP and PS2.

Title: Star Wars: The Force Unleashed
Description: Set before the events of the original Star Wars trilogy, The Force Unleashed casts the player as Darth Vader's secret apprentice tasked with hunting down the last of the Jedi Order.

Title: Shin Megami Tensei: Nocturne
Description: As the world comes to an end through the acts of a cult's sacrifice, a teenage boy is transformed into the Demi-Fiend, neither fully human nor demon.  With opposing forces fighting to shape a new world, he has the power to guide the path of its creation.

Title: Graffiti Kingdom
Description: Graffiti Kingdom is an Action-RPG in which the player can draw his own characters to defeat the many creatures in the game.

Title: Magic Pengel: The Quest for Color
Description: Create unique monsters by drawing, and then use them to challenge the King Of All Doodles in this take on the monster battle genre.

Title: Avatar: The Last Airbender - The Burning Earth
Description: A direct sequel to the first Avatar game, The Burning Earth takes place during the second book of the Avatar series. The game has gained notoriety for having the easiest achievements on the XBOX 360.

Title: Spider-Man: Friend or Foe
Description: Friend or Foe is a beat 'em up where Spider-Man teams up with his enemies to save the day and stop an unknown nemesis.

Title: Star Ocean: Till the End of Time
Description: Star Ocean: Till the End of Time is the fourth game in the Star Ocean series. The game takes place 400 years after the third game, Star Ocean: Blue Sphere.

Title: Golden Knight GARO
Description: Golden Knight GARO is a hack & slash video game based on a Japanese tokusatsu drama. It is published by Bandai and was released in 2006 in Japan only.

Title: The Bard's Tale
Description: A comedic parody of RPG games, The Bard's Tale picks on the original Bard's Tale and Baldur's Gate considerably.  The ragamuffin Bard was voiced by veteran actor Cary Elwes.

Title: Baldur's Gate: Dark Alliance
Description: Baldur's Gate: Dark Alliance is an Action RPG adventure set in Dungeons and Dragons' Forgotten Realms universe.

Title: Red Baron
Description: Red Baron

Title: New Jinsei Game
Description: The third and final PS2 adaptation of the Japanese version of The Game of Life.

Title: EX Jinsei Game II
Description: The second PS2 adaptation of the Japanese version of The Game of Life.

Title: EX Jinsei Game
Description: The first PS2 adaptation of the Japanese version of the board game The Game of Life.

Title: EX Okuman Chouja Game
Description: A PS2 adaptation of the Japanese Monopoly-like board game Okuman Chouja Game.

Title: Arena Football: Road to Glory
Description: Rise through the ranks of either the Arena Football League or its "af2" minor league, both in their 2007 seasons, in this arena football game from EA Sports.

Title: Arena Football
Description: An arena football game from the studio behind the Madden NFL series. Officially licensed by the AFL, it is the first game to accurately simulate the sport.

Title: Guitar Hero III: Legends of Rock
Description: The fourth installment of the series (Guitar Hero: Rock the 80's being the 3rd) that single handedly revitalized the music-game genre, Guitar Hero III retains the core gameplay of its predecessors while delivering a more challenging experience.

Title: Kengo: Master of Bushido
Description: A 3D fighting game focusing on period-accurate kenjutsu in Genroku-era Japan. Train your swordsman using a variety of techniques and fight to become your dojo's champion.

Title: Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon
Description: An action-adventure video game adaptation of the award-winning wuxia film of the same name, following three martial artists in 19th century China as they seek the fabled sword "Green Destiny".

Title: Way of the Samurai
Description: It is the beginning of Japan's Meiji Restoration, and a lone ronin gets caught in a feud between two samurai clans fighting over a small rural village in this action-adventure game from the studio behind the Tenchu series.

Title: Samurai Western
Description: A spin-off of the Way of the Samurai series of samurai-themed action games, pitting a lone swordsman against gunslinging outlaws of the American Wild West.

Title: Dokapon Kingdom
Description: A hybrid RPG/board game that allows players to move around on a board more freely and battle other players.

Title: Homerun
Description: The third and final baseball title in the Magical Sports series

Title: Simple 2000 Series Ultimate Vol. 14: Touhai! Dramatic Mahjong - Ten: Tenhou-douri no Kaidanji
Description: A video game adaptation of the mahjong manga Ten: Tenhou-douri no Kaidanji, following the manga's story with special rules and character abilities.

Title: Billiards Xciting
Description: A pool game for the PS2, featuring six game modes and a trick shot mode. It was released as part of the Simple series in Japan and as part of the Xciting series in Europe.

Title: Toukon Inoki Michi: Puzzle de Daa!
Aqua Aqua
Description: A sequel to the 1998 isometric falling-block puzzle game Wetrix.

Title: Bombastic
Description: In this sequel to Devil Dice, players use explosive dice to clear the board and solve puzzles.

Title: Cool Shot
Description: A PS2 billiards game by DigiCube.

Title: Marvel Ultimate Alliance
Description: Take control of some of the most iconic superheroes of the Marvel Universe in this squad-based RPG. Form a well known group such as the Fantastic Four or create your own custom group of heroes to battle Dr. Doom and the Masters of Evil.

Title: Marvel Ultimate Alliance 2
Description: Beginning with the events of Marvel's Secret War and going into Civil War, players will take control of several Marvel characters in this follow up to the first Ultimate Alliance game.

Title: Battlefield 2: Modern Combat
Description: The Battlefield series' first foray into console gaming, bringing its larger-scale modern-military combat to the PS2 and Xbox.

Title: Killzone
Description: Fight back against the Helghast invasion with your four man squad to save the Vektan colony.

Title: Tokimeki Memorial 3
Description: The third entry in the Tokimeki Memorial series that shifted from the franchise's usual 2D character portraits to fully polygonal models.

Title: Mortal Kombat
Description: By combining digitized character graphics and extreme violence, Midway's 1992 fighter revolutionized the U.S. fighting game genre, spawned a long-running series, and helped create controversy regarding video game violence.

Title: Hard Hitter Tennis
Description: A tennis game by Magical Company and part of their Magical Sports series.

Title: Hard Hitter 2
Description: The sequel to Magical Company's tennis game Hard Hitter.

Title: Burnout Revenge
Description: The fourth installment of the Burnout series of high-octane street racing games, focusing more on aggressive racing with new forms of car combat, including the ability to ram same-way traffic into other racers.

Title: Burnout 2: Point of Impact
Description: The second installment of Criterion's Burnout series of street racing games, building on the high-octane racing while including a new puzzle mode where players stage spectacular car crashes.

Title: Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons of Liberty
Description: The follow-up to the 1998 blockbuster, Metal Gear Solid 2 blends tactical stealth and action. This sequel takes the action to an offshore oil cleanup facility seized by terrorists who are holding the President hostage. It helped sell the PS2, featuring advanced AI, physics and cover mechanics for its time, and one of the first postmodern narratives in gaming.

Title: Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater
Description: The third installment in the Metal Gear Solid franchise is swathed in the Cold War, and it's up to a strangely familiar soldier codenamed Naked Snake to keep the Soviet Union and the United States from all-out nuclear war.

Title: Metal Gear Solid 3: Subsistence
Description: An updated version of Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater containing several new features, most notably a third-person camera and an online mode.

Title: Metal Gear Solid 2: Substance
Description: Metal Gear Solid 2: Substance is an updated version of Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons of Liberty containing the original game while adding hundreds of VR missions, a theatre mode and more. It was originally released on the Xbox and later made it onto PS2 and PC.

Title: Fatal Fury: Battle Archives Volume 1
Description: This compilation includes the first 4 games in the Fatal Fury series.

Title: World Championship Paintball
Description: A first-person paintball game for the PS2, published by THQ.

Title: Greg Hastings' Tournament Paintball MAX'D
Description: A sequel to the 2004 first-person paintball game Greg Hastings' Tournament Paintball, featuring new tactical abilities and a map layout editor.

Title: NPPL Championship Paintball 2009
Description: A first-person paintball game and a successor to the Greg Hastings' Tournament Paintball series. It is the first paintball game released for seventh-generation consoles.

Title: MX Superfly Featuring Ricky Carmichael
Description: An entry in THQs MX series.

Title: Cabela's Dangerous Hunts 2
Description: A hunting game and sequel to the original Cabela's Dangerous Hunts.

Title: Top Spin
Description: Top Spin is a realistic tennis simulator available for the Xbox, Playstation 2, and the PC.

Title: Hitman: Contracts
Description: Hitman: Contracts is the third entry in the Hitman series. A wounded 47 seeks refuge in a shoddy apartment. As he floats in and out of consciousness, he recalls a number of his past missions.

Title: Enthusia Professional Racing
Description: Enthusia is Konami's only attempt at a Gran Turismo and Forza Motorsport-like racing sim so far, and one that has remained somewhat obscure due to being released just after Gran Turismo 4 and Forza Motorsport (2005).

Title: Rule of Rose
Description: Rule of Rose is a survival horror game set in 1930s England aboard an abandoned zeppelin. It is known for its controversial content, such as abusive violence and implied sexual themes towards its underage cast of characters.

Title: Dirge of Cerberus: Final Fantasy VII
Description: Dirge Of Cerberus delves into the mysterious past of Vincent Valentine, with plenty of explosions.

Title: Quantum of Solace
Description: Quantum of Solace is a first-person/third-person shooter based on the James Bond films Casino Royale and its sequel, Quantum of Solace.

Title: Fight Night 2004
Description: Fight Night 2004 is a boxing game. It includes a career, exibition, and create a fighter modes. It also includes former and current fight in all weight divisions.

Title: Bully: Scholarship Edition
Description: 'Bully: Scholarship Edition' takes place at the fictional New England boarding school Bullworth Academy, and tells the story of mischievous 15-year-old Jimmy Hopkins as he goes through the hilarity and awkwardness of adolescence. Beat the jocks at dodge ball, play pranks on the preppies, save the nerds, kiss the girl.

Title: NCAA College Basketball 2K3
Description: NCAA College Basketball 2K3 is an American college basketball video game released by Sega in December 2002 for the Xbox, PlayStation 2, and GameCube. It is the only game in the series that uses the "College Basketball" designation rather than "College Hoops". Former Duke Blue Devils guard Jay Williams is on the cover. NCAA College Basketball 2K3 is the only game in the series to appear on the GameCube.

Title: Pinball
Description: Originally released in Japan as "American Arcade", Pinball is a PS2 game that simulates older electro-mechanical pinball tables with a nostalgic "Americana" theme.

Title: El Tigre: The Adventures of Manny Rivera
Description: Four level, side scrolling platformer for PS2, based on the Nickelodeon cartoon, "El Tigre"

Title: Simple 2000 Series Vol. 113: The Tairyou Jigoku
Mystic Nights
Description: Mystic Nights is a survival horror game with similar gameplay elements to Resident Evil. This was a Korean exclusive for the PS2. The game never had an official release as it was later canceled by Sony

Title: Monkey Turn V
Description: A third-person hydroplane racing game based on the Monkey Turn manga and anime series.

Title: The Seed: War Zone
Description: The Seed: War Zone was an early Japanese PlayStation 2 sci-fi strategy RPG which took place in space, and featured battling spaceships. Released in 2001, it was later saw a 2003 release in Europe.

Title: Neo Atlas III
Description: Artdink's voyaging simulator makes its way to the PS2 in the third edition of the "Neo" update series of The Atlas.

Title: WWE SmackDown! vs. RAW 2007
Description: Smackdown Vs. Raw 2007 is the third installment in the Smackdown Vs. Raw series.

Title: Astro Boy: The Video Game
Description: D3 published this game version of the 2009 Astro Boy movie.

Title: Driv3r
Description: Driv3r is a 2004 action game released by Atari SA and Reflections Interactive. You play as undercover police detective Tanner, as he intercepts a worldwide car-smuggling operation and vows to take down their mysterious buyer.

Title: Twisted Metal: Black
Description: The fifth game of the Twisted Metal franchise. It occurs outside of the "normal" continuity and has a much darker tone than the previous games.

Title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
Description: Krome Studios's PS2/Wii action game released to coincide with the film of the same name. Savage Entertainment's PSP adaptation is based off this game.

Title: Pochi and Nyaa
Description: A cutesy falling-block puzzle arcade game in the style of Puyo Puyo, made by a team of ex-Compile developers. It is notable for being the last third-party game released for Neo Geo arcade hardware prior to its official discontinuation.

Title: Xenosaga Freaks
Description: A side-entry in the Xenosaga franchise. Never released outside Japan.

Title: Wacky Races
Description: Wacky Races is a racing game adaptation of the Hanna-Barbara cartoon series.

Title: Steel Dragon EX
Description: Along with the Warashi shoot-'em-up Steel Dragon (Shienryu), this package includes a new 2.5D sequel known as Steel Dragon Evolution (Shienryu Explosion).

Title: Street Fighter III: 3rd Strike
Description: The third and final iteration of Street Fighter III, including a wealth of gameplay and design revisions while introducing several new combatants.

Title: Street Fighter Alpha 3
Description: The last and largest installment of the Street Fighter Alpha trilogy adds even more characters while adding three unique "fighting styles" (each with special abilities and traits). GO FOR BROKE!

Title: Mary-Kate and Ashley: Sweet 16: Licensed to Drive
Description: Like Mario Party but bad (and with an inappropriate name)!

Title: Dai Senryaku VII: Modern Military Tactics
Description: A turn-based modern military tactics game released for the Japanese Xbox in 2003 and in the US in early 2005. It was later released for PS2 and PSP.

Title: Donkey Xote
Description: Donkey Xote is a multi-platform game.

Title: The Table Game
Description: This collection of board games is the first installment in the Simple 2000 series.

Title: Driver: Parallel Lines
Description: A standalone game in the Driver series set in New York City between two time periods, an up-and-coming wheelman is released from prison and enacts revenge on those who framed him several years ago.

Title: GoldenEye: Rogue Agent
Description: Going where no previous James Bond game has been, GoldenEye: Rogue Agent lets players experience life as a high-rolling, cold-hearted villain and live on the dark side of the Bond universe. It bears no relation to the 1997 game GoldenEye 007.

Title: Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines
Description: Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines is a first-person shooter video game based on the film of the same title, with elements of hand-to-hand combat in the third-person perspective. It was developed by Black Ops Entertainment, with assistance work done by other Atari-owned subsidiaries. The game was published by Atari for PlayStation 2 and Xbox in 2003.

Title: Crazy Frog Racer
Description: A racing game centering around the Crazy Frog character.

Title: Zombie Hunters 2
Description: An upgraded version of The OneeChanbara 2, featuring more playable characters. Known as The OneeChampon ~ The Oneechan 2 Special Chapter ~ in Japan.

Title: Curry House CoCo Ichibanya: Kyō mo Genki da! Curry ga Umai!!
Description: Curry House CoCo Ichibanya: Kyō mo Genki da! Curry ga Umai!! is a restaurant management simulator, set in the Japanese curry restaurant chain CoCo Ichibanya.

Title: The Fairly OddParents: Shadow Showdown
Description: Shadow Showdown is a game based off of the Nicktoons animated television show The Fairly OddParents, and the sequel to Breakin' Da Rules.

Title: The Sword of Etheria
Description: The Sword of Etheria is a hack-and-slash action RPG game for the PlayStation 2, released in Japan in 2005 and 2006 in Europe.

Title: Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon 2 - 2007: First Contact
Description: Sequel to Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon; part one of the Ghost Recon 2 "trilogy".

Title: Vietcong: Purple Haze
Description: Purple Haze takes you into the violence and danger that was Vietnam. Choose from six new weapons, attach bayonets to your rifle, and be on the lookout for attacks from fighter jets & B-52 bombers.

Title: Peter Jackson's King Kong: The Official Game of the Movie
Description: When the beautiful Ann Darrow is kidnapped by the inhabitants of Skull Island, Jack and his team must fight their way through the island's prehistoric inhabitants and hostile environments, solving puzzles and fending off attackers, all in search of her. But unfortunately for them, so is a giant ape.

Title: Need for Speed: Most Wanted
Description: Cruise the streets of Rockport City, keep away from the cops, and defeat the wily Razor Callahan in this open-street racing game from EA Black Box.

Title: FantaVision
Description: FantaVision is a PlayStation 2 launch title that is a puzzle game based on quick color recognition.

Title: Metal Slug 3
Description: The third game in the Metal Slug series, first released to arcades in 2000 and later ported to many home consoles, PCs, and mobile devices.

Title: Panic!
Description: Fight a computer virus by hitting various switches.

Title: Ratatouille
Description: Ratatouille is a game based on the film of the same name.

Title: Rhapsody III: Memories of Marl Kingdom
Description: The third game in the Marl Oukoku series.

Title: Maken Shao: Demon Sword
Description: Maken Shao is a Playstation 2 remake of Maken X, a game released on the Dreamcast. Both games were developed in-house by Atlus.

Title: The Lord of the Rings: Aragorn's Quest
Description: Family friendly Lord of the Rings game focusing on Aragorn.

Title: Super Shanghai 2005
Description: One of the few entries in the long-running mahjong solitaire series to not be published by Activision nor SUNSOFT, Super Shanghai 2005 includes three unique variants of the traditional game and a unique dual-analog control scheme.

Title: Cool Boarders: Code Alien
Description: The final entry in the Cool Boarders series developed for Playstation 2.

Title: Energy Airforce: aimStrike!
Description: The second title in Taito's military flight sim series.

Title: Energy Airforce
Description: A realistic flight simulator where the player can pilot many real-life military aircraft.

Title: The Space Sheriff Spirits
Description: Metal Hero crossover action game.

Title: Cubix: Robots for Everyone Showdown
Description: A futuristic themed 3D action adventure game based on the Cubix: Robots for Everyone TV series.

Title: Gambler Densetsu Tetsuya
Description: A riichi mahjong game for the PS2, based on the anime of the same name. Following the main story, it features an elaborate system for cheating against your opponents.

Title: The Sims 2: Pets
Description: Players can get to know new animal pals in this expansion pack for the PC, or stand-alone title for the console and handheld systems.

Title: The Sims 2: Pets
Description: The Sims 2: Pets is the standalone console version of The Sims 2: Pets.

Title: Tales of Symphonia
Description: Tales of Symphonia is a cel-shaded action RPG and is another game in Namco's Tales series. It expands upon the series' battle system and emphasizes on relationships with other characters by the decisions you make throughout the game.

Title: Alone in the Dark: The New Nightmare
Description: Alone in the Dark: The New Nightmare is a survival horror game developed by Darkworks studios and published by Infogrames. The game takes place on 'Shadow Island', and features two main protagonists: Aline Cedrac and Edward Carnby.

Title: Metal Slug
Description: This is the 3D version of Metal Slug, confusingly called Metal Slug.

Title: Predator: Concrete Jungle
Description: In the game you play as a Predator in 3rd person perspective. The Scarface hunter is disgraced because humans have stolen his technology and you must hunt them down and regain your gear and honor.

Title: Guitar Hero: Van Halen
Description: The third band-specific Guitar Hero offering from Activision, Guitar Hero: Van Halen allows you to play as America's greatest hard rock band.

Title: Spy Hunter: Nowhere to Run
Description: Spy Hunter: Nowhere to Run is the third game in the vehicle-combat franchise. Nowhere to Run is the first game to add on-foot missions to the series.

Title: The Grim Adventures of Billy & Mandy
Description: The Grim Adventures of Billy & Mandy is a 3D arena fighting game featuring the characters of the Cartoon Network television show.

Title: SSX 3
Description: The third game of the SSX franchise continues the tradition of over-the-top Uber Tricks, super stylistic characters, and introduces the "One Mountain" concept.

Title: RTL Skispringen 2003
Description: A german made ski-jumping game.

Title: Puzzle Quest: Challenge of the Warlords
Description: Combining the addictive casual gameplay of puzzle game Bejeweled with a fantasy role-playing game, Puzzle Quest was an unexpected hit on every platform it touched.

Title: Everblue
Description: Everblue is the a diving simulation game that follows a man named leo as he explores the ocean depths and discovers marine life. It was released only in Europe and Japan, it never saw a NA release.

Title: Jonny Moseley Mad Trix
Description: A skiing game for both the Playstation 2 and Game Boy Advance.

Title: VeggieTales: LarryBoy and the Bad Apple
Description: An action-platformer based on the VeggieTales video of the same name.

Title: Just Cause
Description: Just Cause is an open-world action game that has you play as Rico Rodriguez, a black-ops agent helping guerrillas and cartels to overthrow the government of San Esperito.

Title: Mercenaries 2: World in Flames
Description: The sequel to the critically acclaimed Mercenaries: Playground of Destruction. Now set in war-torn Venezuela, the player again takes on contracts for various warring factions on a quest for payback.

Title: Rollercoaster World
Description: Create, test and ride seven types of roller coasters in Rollercoaster World.

Title: Finny the Fish & the Seven Waters
Description: Finny the Fish & the Seven Waters is a PS2 game where the player plays as Finny the Fish and must help him save the land from great danger. Player will make their way through perilous waters, fight enemies, dodge fishermen and eat up lots of fish food to succeed!

Title: Disney's Chicken Little: Ace in Action
Description: Disney's Chicken Little: Ace in Action is a follow-up adventure game to Chicken Little movie.

Title: Ide Yosuke no Mahjong Kazoku 2
Description: A sequel to the 1995 PS1 mahjong game Ide Yosuke no Mahjong Kazoku.

Title: The Polar Express
Description: A game adaptation of the 2004 animation film about a magical train that takes its guests to the North Pole every Christmas Eve.

Title: Cheggers Party Quiz
Description: Get the family together and take part in Cheggers Party Quiz, loaded with thousands of questions on entertainment subjects.

Title: Ouran High School Host Club
Description: Visual novel based on the manga/anime series of the same name. Released for PlayStation 2 and for Nintendo DS.

Title: Marie & Elie no Atelier: Salberg no Renkinjutsushi 1-2
Description: Enhanced ports of both Atelier Marie and Elie released by Kool Kizz for the Dreamcast and later a reworked version for the PlayStation 2 by Gust themselves.

Title: Mortal Kombat: Deadly Alliance
Description: The fifth installment in the violent fighting game franchise and the first "revival" of the series, introducing multiple fighting styles for each character.

Title: Mahjong Sangokushi
Description: A riichi mahjong game based on the Three Kingdoms period of ancient China, with a game engine and "battle royale" mode based on those from the Mahjong Haoh series.

Title: Mahjong Haoh: Battle Royale
Description: The fifth Mahjong Haoh game.

Title: Mahjong Haoh: Dan-kyuu Battle II
Description: The sixth entry in the Mahjong Haoh series.

Title: Mahjong Haoh: Jansō Battle
Description: The first game in the Mahjong Haoh series.

Title: Mahjong Haoh: Kaikyū Battle
Description: The second Mahjong Haoh game.

Title: Hai-Shin 3
Description: The third and final installment of the Hai-Shin trilogy of riichi mahjong games. Along with moving up to the PS2, this sequel features a game mode where you tour Japan, earn money in tournaments, and collect ekiben.

Title: Typing Shinken Shoubu: Musashi no Ken
Garouden Breakblow
Description: A 3D fighting game based on the martial arts manga Garouden.

Title: Otometeki Koi Kakumei Love Revo!!
Description: An otome dating sim about losing weight.

Title: Sea Monsters: A Prehistoric Adventure
Description: Sea Monsters: A Prehistoric Adventure is a 3rd person underwater action adventure game where players assume the role of various extinct sea creatures based on the National Geographic 3d movie of the same name.

Title: Guitar Hero 5
Description: The fifth game in the core Guitar Hero franchise, and the third in the series from Activision and Neversoft.  Though the game goes by the Guitar Hero moniker, it features full-band gameplay like its predecessor, Guitar Hero World Tour.

Title: Band Hero
Description: Band Hero is a spinoff game of the Guitar Hero series by Activision released for the Xbox 360 Playstation 3, Wii and Nintendo DS.

Title: Guitar Hero: Metallica
Description: Guitar Hero: Metallica is the second band-specific game in the Guitar Hero franchise. It features 28 songs from the world famous heavy-metal band Metallica, as well as 21 guest acts - picked by Metallica themselves.

Title: Romancing SaGa
Description: An RPG with eight characters whose stories are played sequentially (instead of simultaneously and together like other RPGs) and where one character's play will alter subsequent story and play.

Title: Heavenly Guardian
Description: A spiritual successor to the Pocky & Rocky games of the 16-bit era, Heavenly Guardian is a shooter that follows the story of the snow maiden Sayuki in a quest to rid a curse from a human boy she loves.

Title: American Idol
Description: A video game based on the popular singing competition show.

Title: To Heart 2
Description: To Heart 2 is a visual novel by Aquaplus.

Title: 3-Nen B-Gumi Kinpachi Sensei: Densetsu no Kyoudan ni Tate!
Description: A Chunsoft developed adventure game based off the Japanese TV drama "3 Nen B Gumi Kinpachi Sensei" (Third Year, B Class Teacher Kinpachi).

Title: The Warriors
Description: The Warriors is an action adventure 3D brawler that covers and expands the events depicted in the movie of the same name.

Title: Simple 2000 Series Vol. 116: The Neko-Mura no Hitobito: Pagu Daikan no Akugyou Sanmai
Sega Soccer Slam
Description: Sega Soccer Slam is a no-holds-barred Soccer game that is available for the Xbox, PS2, and GameCube.  It was also released as an Xbox Original for the Xbox 360 on December 15, 2008.

Title: Kamiwaza: Way of the Thief
Description: Assassins are replaced with thieves, in this stealth-action game from the developers of Shinobido: Way of the Ninja and Way of the Samurai.

Title: Fight Night Round 2
Description: The sequel to Fight Night 2004. The game would focus on knockouts by adding Haymakers to the total punch control setup. The GameCube version had the SNES game Super Punch-Out!! playable. In addition, you could unlock Little Mac as a playable character in the main game.

Title: Baldur's Gate: Dark Alliance II
Description: In Baldur's Gate: Dark Alliance II, five new heroes battle through hordes of enemies and venture forth to rescue the protagonists of the first game.

Title: Kamaitachi no Yoru 2: Kangokujima no Warabe Uta
Description: The second entry in the Kamaitachi no Yoru series of sound novels by Chunsoft.

Title: Beverly Hills Cop
Description: A game based on the movie franchise of the same name. Only released in PAL territories despite being based on an American series with an American setting, due to such egregious errors as depicting Axel Foley, originally played by Eddie Murphy, as a white man.

Title: Ikuze! Onsen Takkyuu!!
Description: A 3D table tennis game by Psikyo, featuring a comical cast of characters in hot spring locales.

Title: Summer Heat Beach Volleyball
Description: Summer Heat Beach Volleyball is a PlayStation 2 exclusive volleyball game.

Title: Little Britain: The Video Game
Description: Little Britain: The Video Game is a compilation of minigames based on the BBC sketch comedy series of the same name.

Title: Killer7
Description: Killer7 follows Harman Smith, a wheelchair-bound assassin with multiple personalities that manifest as seven seemingly supernatural killers. And the premise is the least weird thing about the game.

Title: Lara Croft Tomb Raider: Anniversary
Description: Anniversary is a remake of the original Tomb Raider game, running in the engine from Tomb Raider: Legend. Join Lara Croft as she travels the world on her very first adventure all over again!

Title: Gambler Densetsu Tetsuya Digest
Description: The third and final PS2 riichi mahjong adaptation of the mahjong anime Gambler Densetsu Tetsuya.

Title: Gambler Densetsu Tetsuya 2: Kurouto Choujou Kessen
Description: The second PS2 riichi mahjong adaptation of the mahjong anime Gambler Densetsu Tetsuya.

Title: Hokuto no Ken: Shinpan no Sousousei - Kengou Retsuden
Description: Developed by the team behind the Guilty Gear series, Fist of the North Star is a fighting game adaptation of the hyper-violent post-apocalyptic manga and anime of the same name.

Title: La Pucelle: Tactics
Description: La Pucelle Tactics is a tactical role-playing game from the makers of Disgaea and Phantom Brave.

Title: Death Crimson OX
Description: The third and final game in the obscure and infamous Death Crimson series. It is the only game in the series that both had an arcade release and a worldwide release.

Title: Digimon World 4
Description: A dungeon crawler ARPG made as a tie-in game to the movie "Digital Monsters X-Evolution".

Title: Horsez
Description: Horsez is a virtual pet published by Ubisoft where players raise and train 5 different kinds of horses. For the most part though it is a horse-themed mini-game collection with a storyline carrying it along.

Title: AirForce Delta Strike
Description: AirForce Delta Strike is a jet sim game by KCE Studios.

Title: Simple 2000 Series Ultimate Vol. 22: Stylish Mahjong - Usagi: Yasei no Tōhai & Usagi: Yasei no Tōhai The Arcade - Double Pack
Description: A compilation of two mahjong games on one disc.

Title: Internet Mahjong: Tonpuusou de Asobo - Tonpuusou Server
Description: A riichi mahjong game by Success for the PlayStation 2, supporting connectivity with the online mahjong service Tonpuusou for cross-platform multiplayer.

Title: Metal Slug 4
Description: Utilizing similar gameplay mechanics as previous Metal Slug games, Metal Slug 4 stays true to the series, but also manages to keep things fresh with new bosses, weapons, vehicles, and a combo system.

Title: Cyber Jong-so: Tonpuusou-hen
Description: A riichi mahjong game by Konami for the PlayStation 2, supporting connectivity with the online mahjong service Tonpuusou for cross-platform multiplayer.

Title: Bistro Cupid 2
Description: A sequel to Bistro Cupid.

Title: Chuukana Janshi Tenhoo Painyan Remix
Description: A spin-off of the Idol Janshi Suchie-Pai series of erotic mahjong games.

Title: The Sims 2
Description: The Sims 2 on console was vastly different from the PC version it was derived from. The Sims 2 console allowed direct control over Sims, as well as a story mode.

Title: The Sims 2
Description: Sequel to one of the most famous games of all time, The Sims 2 introduces a new engine and many new gameplay features to the franchise.

Title: Makai Kingdom: Chronicles of the Sacred Tome
Description: A demon overlord who's soul is bound to a book tries to restore his lost powers in this comedy JRPG.

Title: Go Go Golf
Description: A golf simulation game released in Japan and Europe.

Title: Kelly Slater's Pro Surfer
Description: A spin off of the Tony Hawk Pro Skater series and part of Activision's O2 line of extreme sports games, Kelly Slater's Pro Surfer is a surfing game in which allows players experience the thrill of riding the waves from the comfort of their living room.

Title: Plarail: Yume ga Ippai! Plarail de Ikou!
Description: Based on Tomy's Plarail line of electric toy train sets, Plarail lets you construct a play world with an extensive line of toy tracks and scenery, and then lets you drive on it!

Title: Johnny Bravo: The Hukka-Mega-Mighty-Ultra-Extreme Date-O-Rama!
Description: Play the part of Johnny Bravo and compete against rival studs over a number of events to win a date with the chick on the Hukka-Mega-Mighty-Ultra-Extreme Date-O-Rama TV show!

Title: NHL 09
Description: NHL 09 adds major improvements to the franchise, such as the defense skill stick and the highly praised Be A Pro Mode, to make this sports game one of the best of 2008.

Title: Tokyo Bus Guide 2
Description: A Japanese commuter bus driving simulator and the sequel to the 1999 game Tokyo Bus Guide, featuring a new set of three Toei Bus routes and various game improvements.

Title: Tokyo Bus Guide
Description: A Japanese bus driving simulation game for the Dreamcast (later the arcade and PS2), tasking players with driving real metropolitan bus routes through Tokyo.

Title: Sengoku Blade: Sengoku Ace Episode II
Description: The sequel to the bizarre historical-fantasy shoot-'em-up Samurai Aces, switching it from aircrafts in a vertical perspective to superpowered character combat in a horizontal perspective.

Title: Growlanser IV: Wayfarer of Time Return
Description: A side-story to Growlanser: Wayfarer of Time that features no combat.

Title: X-FIRE
Description: X-FIRE is a TPS-type gun action shooting game released by Electronic Arts Square on August 3, 2000.

Title: Shadow the Hedgehog
Description: A darker, grittier, and edgier spin-off of the Sonic the Hedgehog series starring the mysterious amnesiac antihero Shadow the Hedgehog. It is one of the series's more controversial games due to it's edgier themes (including use of slight amount of profanity and gunplay).

Title: Raiden III
Description: After a 10-year wait, the original Raiden shoot-'em-up series gets revived with new 3D graphics.

Title: Kou Rate Ura Mahjong Retsuden Mukoubuchi: Goburei, Last desu ne
Description: A gambling mahjong game based on a manga.

Title: Jissen Pachi-Slot Hisshouhou! Aladdin II Evolution
Description: A virtual slots game for the PlayStation 2 that simulates the 2005 pachi-slot machine Aladdin II Evolution. It also received handheld ports for the PSP and DS.

Title: Cabela's Legendary Adventures
Description: Cabela's Legendary Adventures is a hunting game for the PSP, PS2, and Wii

Title: Get Ride! AMDriver: Soukoku no sinjitsu
Description: A 3D strategic action game released by Konami in Japan based on the Get Ride! AMDriver anime series.

Title: Suikoden III
Description: Fifteen years after the events of Suikoden II, the stories of Hugo (the son of a village chief), Chris (the virtuous Knight of Zexen), and Geddoe (the rebellious unit commander) intertwine as they gather the 108 Stars of Destiny.

Title: Blazing Souls
Description: Blazing Souls is a SRPG from developer Neverland.

Title: Anime Eikaiwa: Tottoi
Description: An English-dubbed release of the anime movie Tottoi for the PlayStation 2.

Title: Train Simulator: Kyushu Shinkansen
Description: The 27th installment of the Train Simulator series and the sixth on the PS2, focusing on Tsubame train service after the completion of the titular Kyushu Shinkansen.

Title: Train Simulator: Keisei, Toei Asakusa, and Keikyu Lines
Description: The 26th installment of the Train Simulator series and the fifth on the PS2, focusing on three separate rail lines that together link Haneda Airport with Narita Airport.

Title: Train Simulator + Densha de Go!: Tōkyō Kyūkō-hen
Description: A collaboration between the Train Simulator and Densha de Go series, featuring three routes from the Tokyu Railways Company.

Title: Train Simulator: Midosuji Line
Description: The 24th installment of the Train Simulator series and the third on the PS2, focusing on the Midosuji Line through Osaka.

Title: Train Simulator Real: The Keihin Kyuko
Description: The 23rd installment of the Train Simulator series and the second on the PS2, revisiting the Keihin Electric Express Railway Main Line and some of its transfers.

Title: Train Simulator Real: The Yamanote Line
Description: The 21st installment of the Train Simulator series and the first on the PS2, revisiting the Yamanote Line in Tokyo (this time through its outer loop) with much higher video fidelity and a new user interface.

Title: Kaena
Description: Kaena is a Japan-only release, based on the French-Canadian CGI film "Kaena: La Prophétie"

Title: Densha de Go! Shinkansen Sanyou Shinkansen-hen
Description: A spin-off of Taito's popular electric train simulation series, focusing on the San'yō Shinkansen high-speed railway line.

Title: BurgerTime
Description: Play as  chef Peter Pepper, climbing ladders and running over burger ingredients to assemble giant burgers, whilst avoiding dastardly hot dogs, pickles and fried eggs trying to end our culinary adventures!

Title: Interlude
Description: A NEC Interchannel published visual novel released first on the Dreamcast and then later on the PlayStation 2 in Japan

Title: Mar Heaven: Arm Fight Dream
Description: A Konami developed PlayStation 2 exclusive 2D fighting game that never left Japan.

Title: Summoner 2
Description: Summoner 2 is a fantasy Action RPG where you take the role of Maia, a queen and goddess reborn, as you try to save the world from impending doom.

Title: Gauntlet: Seven Sorrows
Description: Gauntlet: Seven Sorrows continues the Gauntlet franchise, in this darker soft reboot of the series.

Title: Dynasty Warriors 4
Description: Dynasty Warriors 4 is a hack and slash video game and the fourth installment in the popular Dynasty Warriors series. Dynasty Warriors 4 was developed by Omega Force and published by Koei. The game is available on PlayStation 2 (PS2) and Xbox and is based on a series of books called Romance of the Three Kingdoms, written by Luo Guanzhong

Title: Dynasty Warriors 3
Description: Dynasty Warriors 3 builds on the foundation of Dynasty Warriors 2's hack-n-slash mechanics, with the player's chosen officer squaring off against thousands of foes.

Title: Dynasty Warriors 2
Description: Dynasty Warriors 2 is a historical hack-and-slash game based on Luo Guanzhong's novel, "The Romance of The Three Kingdoms". It is unusual in being a different genre from the original Dynasty Warriors, which was a fighting game.

Title: Dragon's Lair
Description: Known as the granddaddy of the "Quick Time Event", Dragon's Lair is an interactive cartoon that lets players help guide the actions of brave knight Dirk the Daring, as he ventures through the dangerous castle of Singe the Dragon in order to rescue his beloved princess Daphne.

Title: Golden Axe
Description: A classic, side-scrolling hack and slash game, Golden Axe was ported to many platforms, including the Sega Genesis/Mega Drive.

Title: Shadow Hearts: Covenant
Description: Harmonixer Yuri Hyuga returns in this direct sequel to the 2001 RPG game Shadow Hearts with real historical elements. Yuri and his friends set on a journey across the world to combat the evil Rasputin and new evil entities that may well change the course of the 20th century.

Title: Lumines: Puzzle Fusion
Description: This music-based puzzle game from Q Entertainment and Tetsuya Mizuguchi features contributions from numerous Japanese electronic musicians.

Title: FlatOut
Description: FlatOut is a demolition derby-style racing game with destructible cars and environments.

Title: The X-Files: Resist or Serve
Description: Play as Mulder and Scully in Resist or Serve, a 2004 game featuring an original story, several voices from the show, and a whole lotta kickin'.

Title: Guitar Hero: Aerosmith
Description: Guitar Hero: Aerosmith puts the player in the shoes of the rock group as they evolve from unknowns to rock superstars. In a guitar hero game dedicated to the band that is Aerosmith!

Title: Trio The Punch – Never Forget Me...
Description: A goofy Japanese-exclusive side-scrolling brawler game by Data East for arcades. Control tough guy Santos, ninja Kamakura-kun, or swordsman Rose Sub as they battle numerous comical enemies throughout the world.

Title: Tenchu: Fatal Shadows
Description: Ayame, while patrolling the border of Ghoda territory, suddenly stumbles upon a ruined village; its only survivor being a young assassin by the name of Rin. Together, the two work to uncover the plot behind the village's destruction, and the annihilation of Rin's clan.

Title: Robotech: Battlecry
Description: Robotech: Battlecry is an action game based on the Robotech universe.

Title: Robotech: Invasion
Description: A Robotech themed game based on the Third Robotech War.  It was a shooter that allowed the player to take on a human form or transform into a motorcycle to fight the invading Invid on all fronts.

Title: Mission: Impossible - Operation Surma
Description: It's not mission difficult, it's Mission: Impossible.

Title: Disney's Meet the Robinsons
Description: Movie tie-in game released for numerous platforms in 2007. Basic 3-D adventure game.

Title: Red Faction
Description: Set on Mars in the near future, Red Faction is a first-person shooter developed by Volition. It follows the fight of miners against the oppressive Ultor corporation and features dynamic destructible environments.

Title: Mortal Kombat: Shaolin Monks
Description: The third main spin-off of the Mortal Kombat series, retelling the events of Mortal Kombat II through the eyes (and fists) of Shaolin warriors Liu Kang and Kung Lao.

Title: Onimusha: Blade Warriors
Description: Multiplayer fighting game that supports up to 4 different players. Uses characters from the Onimusha Blade series and pits them against each other.

Title: Suzumiya Haruhi no Tomadoi
Description: A visual novel based on the Haruhi Suzumiya franchise where you take the role of Kyon who has been tasked to organize the development SOS Brigade's first video game.

Title: Meitantei Evangelion
Description: Strange things are happening and Shinji Ikari is tasked to investigate and stop the mysterious murders and odd occurrences throughout Tokyo-3. Using keywords found through conversation as clues, Shinji must uncover the culprits and stop them.

Title: World Snooker Championship 2007
Description: The official game of World Snooker for 2007 now includes World Pool Championships as well.

Title: High School Musical: Sing It!
Description: High School Musical: Sing It! is a karaoke game based on Disney's smash hit High School Musical franchise, allowing players to sing their way through over 2 dozens tracks from or related to the movies.

Title: D.N. Angel: Crimson Wings
Description: A PS2 game based on the DN Angel anime series.

Title: Katamari Damacy
Description: In this quirky Japanese game, the tiny Prince must roll up anything and everything in his path to rebuild the heavens after the King of All Cosmos destroys all the stars in the universe during a drunken bender.

Title: Forbidden Siren 2
Description: Sequel to Forbidden Siren. Released in 2006.

Title: Garou: Mark of the Wolves
Description: The final game in the Fatal Fury franchise, Garou is set ten years after the death of Geese Howard, and features eleven brand new characters for the player to take control over.

Title: The Last Blade 2
Description: The second and final chapter of the 19th-century Bakumatsu-era tale of swords and myths, adding some new warriors and techniques.

Title: BloodRayne
Description: A half-human, half-vampire secret agent in a tight leather outfit uses guns and razor-sharp tonfa blades to wreak bloody havoc against Nazis seeking supernatural artifacts. Best premise ever? Perhaps.

Title: BloodRayne 2
Description: Set 60 years after the original BloodRayne, this sequel pits the dhampir Rayne against her vampire half-siblings, who have banded together to create a new era of demonic supremacy.

Title: The King of Fighters 2002 Unlimited Match
Description: The King of Fighters 2002 Unlimited Match is an enhanced remake of the original KOF2002 that includes every character from the "NESTS Saga."

Title: The King of Fighters '98 Ultimate Match
Description: The King of Fighters '98 Ultimate Match is a rebalanced version of The King of Fighters '98 with new characters.

Title: Ōkami
Description: Ōkami is an action-adventure game in which the goddess Amaterasu restores life and beauty to a world that has been taken over by malevolent beings through the power of celestial calligraphy techniques.

Title: Super Bust-A-Move 2
Description: The sequel to Super Bust A Move and part of the long running Bust a Move franchise.

Title: Super Bust-A-Move
Description: Taito's signature puzzle game makes its way to the PlayStation 2, complete with a new stylized toon art style.

Title: Rayman Arena
Description: Rayman Arena is a racing game featuring Rayman. Up to four players can run through race tracks or compete in an arena.

Title: Yie Ar Kung-Fu
Description: Considered one of the progenitors of the fighting game genre, Yie Ar Kung-Fu is a Konami arcade game that puts players in the role of a martial artist as he fights the masters of various weaponry to become the Grand Master.

Title: Nogizaka Haruka no Himitsu Cosplay, Hajime Mashita
World Heroes Perfect
Description: All of the competitors of the previous World Heroes tournaments come together for one final time-traveling contest to determine who is the strongest warrior in history.

Title: SingStar Pop Hits
Description: The eighth installment of the SingStar franchise, featuring songs from the top of the charts by Nelly Furtado, Norah Jones, Lily Allen, Corinne Baily Rae and more.

Title: Super Fantasy Zone
Description: A Genesis-only sequel in the Fantasy Zone series. It never received a US release on its original platform, but would eventually become available via Virtual Console in 2008.

Title: Croket! Ban-Ō no Kiki o Sukue
Description: An action title based on the Croket! anime

Title: Shiju Hachi (Kari)
Description: An infamous sound novel published by Banpresto for the PlayStation 2.

Title: Game ni Nattayo! Dokuro-chan
Description: A game based on the light novel Bokusatsu Tenshi Dokuro-chan.

Title: Gendai Daisenryaku: Isshoku Sokuhatsu - Gunji Balance Houkai
Rapala Pro Bass Fishing
Description: Featuring full motion controls, players will be able to cast, reel, jig, set the hook and more as if they had an actual fishing rod in their hands.

Title: Tenkuu Danzai Skelter Heaven
Description: Skelter Heaven is a rhythm game/visual novel following a group of mecha pilots in the year 2030. The game is mostly remembered for its infamously poorly-received anime adaptation.

Title: Disney's Bolt
Description: Game based on the Disney movie by the same name.

Title: Hulk
Description: The game continues after the movie with some Hulk smashing action and some stealth elements.

Title: Samurai Champloo: Sidetracked
Description: Samurai Champloo: Sidetracked is an action game based on the anime series of the same name, developed by Grasshopper Manufacture and published by Namco Bandai Games in April 2006.

Title: Marvel Super Hero Squad
Description: It's like Muppet Babies with claws! THQ is turning this animated series into a game for DS, Wii, PSP, and PS2.

Title: Marc Ecko's Getting Up: Contents Under Pressure
Description: Getting Up is a video game created by Atari and the Collective. It revolves around the main character, a punk named Trane, as he tries to take back the city of New Radius through the medium of vandalism.

Title: Fantastic 4
Description: Fantastic Four is an action adventure game based on the 2005 film Fantastic Four. Players play as the characters of the Fantastic Four using combos and special attacks to fight their way through hordes of enemies and bosses.

Title: Xiaolin Showdown
Description: Get all the Shen Gong Wu as your favorite Xiaolin Showdown characters based on the Kids WB Cartoon of the same name!

Title: Giants: Citizen Kabuto
Description: Take control of one of three radically different factions and lay waste to your enemies with advanced technology, powerful magic, or raw brute strength.

Title: The Matrix: Path of Neo
Description: Play through the events of all three Matrix films as Neo, with an alternate ending written by the Wachowski sisters.

Title: Scooby-Doo!: Night of 100 Frights
Description: Scooby-Doo!: Night of 100 Frights is the first Scooby-Doo video game on sixth generation consoles.

Title: Portal Runner
Description: A spin-off of the Army Men franchise starring Vikki Grimm.

Title: Shadow of Rome
Description: Caesar has been murdered within the Roman Senate and everywhere looms conspiracy. Only Agrippa and his close friend Octavianus dare to search for the truth in this hybrid stealth-action/hack & slash title from Capcom.

Title: Gladiator: Sword of Vengeance
Description: Invictus Thrax a Warrior Slave is chosen by the Gods to save the Roman Empire.

Title: Kamen Rider Hibiki
Description: A Bandai developed PlayStation 2 fighting game entry into the long-running series of Kamen Rider video games

Title: Eragon
Description: Based on the Movie and Book. The story of the young farm boy named Eragon who stumbles upon a dragon egg, leading to adventure.

Title: Pirates of the Caribbean: The Legend of Jack Sparrow
Description: An action game based on the events of the movie "Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl."

Title: Evil Dead: Regeneration
Description: Evil Dead: Regeneration puts Ash into a non-canon world in which he never went back in time after Evil Dead II.  He also gets a half deadite sidekick.

Title: Evil Dead: A Fistful of Boomstick
Description: In this terrible game in the Evil Dead franchise, Ash Williams has to once again stop the forces of evil from taking over the world. Hail to the king baby!

Title: Turok: Evolution
Description: Turok:  Evolution is a re-imagining of the acclaimed first person shooter series for Xbox, PS2 and GCN.  Many fans say this entry, however, fails to live up to the standard set by its predecessors.

Title: Baroque
Description: In a world distorted by a cataclysm, an amnesiac, mute young man must explore the halls of the Neuro-Tower to unearth what caused the disaster and how his own past ties into the events. Originally released in 1998, it wasn't released outside of Japan until 2008.

Title: Kamen Rider Blade
Description: A Bandai published fighting game for PlayStation 2 based on the longrunning Kamen Rider series

Title: Syphon Filter: The Omega Strain
Description: Join Gabe Logan and others in an effort to take out the Syphon Filter once more in this online based shooter.

Title: Mega Man Anniversary Collection
Description: Mega Man Anniversary Collection contains the first 8 Mega Man entries in the franchise, along with many extra features and unlockable games.

Title: Total Overdose
Description: Total Overdose is an arguably racist action game that mixes gameplay elements of GTA and Max Payne in a Mexican-style cocktail.

Title: Agent Hugo
Description: An action-adventure game released only in Europe, developed by ITE Media.

Title: Grandia III
Description: The fourth game in the Grandia series, Grandia III concerns a young man who wants to fly more than anything else in the world.

Title: Kamen Rider: Seigi no Keifu
Description: Kamen Rider: Seigi no Keifu is an adventure-brawler with Kamen Rider from many different eras.

Title: Lupin the 3rd: Treasure of the Sorcerer King
Description: Based off the hit anime and manga series Lupin the 3rd, players play as Lupin and his partners in crime as they try to steal the vast fortune of The Sorcerer King while on the run from Inspector Zenigata.

Title: SpongeBob SquarePants: Revenge of the Flying Dutchman
Description: SpongeBob SquarePants: Revenge of the Flying Dutchman is a video game, inwich SpongeBob and Gary unleash a curse upon Bikini Bottom that brings The Flying Dutchman back from the grave.

Title: Crimson Sea 2
Description: Crimson Sea 2 is the Playstation 2 sequel to the the original Xbox game Crimson Sea. Once again you reprise the role of Sho, facing off against a new alien menace.

Title: Arc the Lad: Twilight of the Spirits
Description: Arc the Lad: Twilight of the Spirits revolves around saving the world by playing through two opposing, yet similar characters, Kharg and Darc. Save the Deimos, save the Humans.

Title: Mega Man X7
Description: The seventh installment brings the long-running Mega Man X series into full 3D, adding cel-shaded graphics, third-person platforming segments, and a new protagonist: Axl, a former vigilante (of a group that's now hunting him down) who can mimic the enemies he encounters.

Title: Ephemeral Fantasia
Description: A turn-based JRPG by Konami.

Title: Woody Woodpecker: Escape from Buzz Buzzard Park
Description: Help Woody Woodpecker rescue nephew Knothead and niece Splinter, then escape from Buzz Buzzard's park.

Title: SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.29: Monster World Complete Collection
Description: A compilation of the entire Monster World series.

Title: Power Rangers: Super Legends
Description: Power Rangers: Super Legends is an action video game designed to celebrate the 15th anniversary of Power Rangers. It was released for PlayStation 2, Nintendo DS, and PC; a Gamecube version was announced but never released.

Title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Description: A prisoner escapes from the wizard prison Azkaban, and he goes after Harry.

Title: The Golden Compass
Description: Play as Lyra in attempt to save her father in this game based on the novel adapted movie of the same name.

Title: Monster House
Description: Based on the animated movie of the same name with variations in gameplay depending on the platform version

Title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
Description: An adaption of the novel-adapted movie of the same name. It consists of many levels, and 4 playable characters - Peter, Edmund, Susan and Lucy.

Title: Scooby-Doo! Unmasked
Description: Scooby-Doo must brave his fears and help collect clues for Velma, Scooby can also change customs to give him more abilities, such as kung-fu.

Title: Disney's Chicken Little
Description: An action adventure game based on the disney film Chicken Little where you control the likes of Chicken Little, Abby Mallard, Runt of the litter as you fight off an alien invasion. Along with a the core platforming elements, the game features unlockable mini-games and concept art.

Title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
Description: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles is a Beat'em Up from Konami, based on the 2003 animated series.

Title: Pirates: The Legend of Black Kat
Description: Pirates: The Legend of Black Kat is a game set in the pirate era where you play as the protagonist, Kat, a feisty and agile female pirate.

Title: Rogue Ops
Description: Rogue Ops is a multi platform, third-person stealth game.

Title: Berserk: Millennium Falcon Hen Seima Senki no Shou
Description: Berserk: Millennium Falcon Hen Seima Senki no Shou (Record of the Holy Demon War) is a PlayStation 2 game based on the Berserk Manga.

Title: Altered Beast
Description: A third-person action game pitched as a reboot of the Altered Beast franchise. It was only released in Europe and Japan, as the North American release was cancelled.

Title: Crime Life: Gang Wars
Description: Take control of Tre, a member of a gang called "The Outlawz", who are trying to rise to the top of the criminal underworld.

Title: Buccaneer
Description: A budget action title released for Playstation 2 and published by D3 (under the alias of Essential Games in Europe)

Title: Malice
Description: Malice, a goddess with help from The Metal Guardian, must stop the Dog God from destroying her world and the Universe. Armed with a giant club, she must find eight logic keys to track the Dog God down.

Title: Looney Tunes: Back in Action
Description: Looney Tunes Back in Action is an action game based on the Loony Tunes franchise.

Title: Shinobi
Description: Shinobi for the Playstation 2 is the 3-D debut of the classic franchise. In it you play as the ninja Hotsuma, with a cursed sword and an amazing scarf you defend Tokyo from evil.

Title: Ben 10 Alien Force: Vilgax Attacks
Description: D3 is publishing this Ben 10 Alien Force game on multiple platforms.

Title: Shadow Tower Abyss
Description: The Japan-exclusive sequel to Shadow Tower.

Title: The Hobbit
Description: The Hobbit is a 3D action-adventure platformer based on J. R. R. Tolkien's prequel to The Lord of the Rings.

Title: I-Ninja
Description: Cute but challenging, I-Ninja is a third-person adventure that mixes in all kinds of gameplay.

Title: Prince of Persia: The Two Thrones
Description: The Two Thrones is the third game and supposed end for the Sands Of Time saga. It follows the Prince's quest to finish the corrupted, power-hungry Vizier and his negative parts of his mind.

Title: Cyber Troopers Virtual-On Marz
Description: Virtual-On Marz is currently the latest game in the Virtual-On series, and it is the only game that is exclusive to consoles. It is based on Virtual-On Force.

Title: Fullmetal Alchemist and the Broken Angel
Description: The game takes place between episodes 17 and 18, while Ed and Al are being escorted by Major Armstrong to the Central City by train. Then things go wrong.

Title: Fullmetal Alchemist 2: Curse of the Crimson Elixir
Description: Fullmetal Alchemist 2: Curse of the Crimson Elixir is the second console role-playing game for the PlayStation 2 based on the series.

Title: Zombie Hunters
Description: A specially upgraded version of the first Oneechanbara, trying to hide its embarrassingly juvenile premise behind a more generic title.

Title: Simple Series 2000 Vol. 90: The Oneechanbara 2
Description: The second full game in the Oneechanbara franchise created by Tamsoft. Features the gunwielding Reiko as a new playable character.

Title: The King of Fighters 2002: Challenge to Ultimate Battle
Description: The ninth installment of the King of Fighters series and the second "Dream Match" entry, removing the "Striker" system entirely for traditional 3-on-3 matches.
