Title: Ultraman Fighting Evolution 3
Description: The third installment in the Ultraman fighting evolution series of fighting games based on the popular tokusatsu super hero TV show.

Title: Knights of the Temple: Infernal Crusade
Description: An action game from the developers that would develop Chronicles of Riddick and The Darkness. The game was never released outside Europe.

Title: Ultraman Fighting Evolution Rebirth
Description: The fourth installment in the Ultraman Fighting Evolution series based on the popular tokusatsu super hero t.v. show.

Title: Free Running
Description: Free Running is the first extreme sports game that focuses on parkour. Players can race, perform tricks or work to reach a difficult spot in the various urban arenas, all the while trying to keep up the flow of their movements.

Title: Stolen
Description: Set in the near future, Stolen stars a cat burglar named Anya who stumbles upon a conspiracy that threatens the entire city.

Title: Valkyrie Profile 2: Silmeria
Description: Playstation 2 sequel to the cult classic Playstation JRPG, Valkyrie Profile.

Title: Let's Bravo Music
Description: One of the first games to get a CERO rating.

Title: Forgotten Realms: Demon Stone
Description: Three adventurers that have met by chance find the Demon Stone, an ancient prison, just as it breaks before their eyes. The contained evil is unleashed and the wicked spirits of a Githyanki general and a Slaad lord once again threaten the world.

Title: Taz: Wanted
Description: Platformer where Taz escapes from Yosemite Sam's zoo, and must destroy all the wanted posters while avoiding capture.

Title: Blade II
Description: Blade II is a 2002 action game based on the vampire/comic book movie of the same name, starring Wesley Snipes.

Title: Minority Report: Everybody Runs
Description: Follow the story of John Anderton in this action game loosely based on the events of the feature film.

Title: Batman: Vengeance
Description: The Dark Knight returns to stop a series of seemingly unrelated crimes in this 3D action platformer based on The New Batman Adventures animated TV series.

Title: Maximo vs Army of Zin
Description: Maximo vs Army of Zin is an action-adventure game developed and published by Capcom in 2003 for the PlayStation 2.  It is a direct sequel to Maximo: Ghosts to Glory.

Title: Maximo: Ghosts to Glory
Description: A spiritual successor to the Ghosts N' Goblins games, Maximo is an extremely challenging 3-D action platformer.

Title: Masters of the Universe: He-Man: Defender of Grayskull
Description: Play as He-Man, on foot and astride Battle Cat, in an adventure to master the universe and defend Grayskull

Title: Puyo Puyo Fever 2
Description: The first main Puyo Puyo game to not be released in the arcades.

Title: Blood Plus: One Night Kiss
Description: An action/adventure game by Grasshopper Manufacture based on the Blood Plus anime series.

Title: The Legend of Spyro: The Eternal Night
Description: The Legend of Spyro: The Eternal Night is the second part of the Legend of Spyro trilogy. Cynder has been rescued from the power of the Dark Master. The Ape King, Gaul, has now risen to power and is intent on resurrecting the Dark Master.

Title: The Legend of Spyro: A New Beginning
Description: A New Beginning is the first of the Legend of Spyro trilogy. The dragons are at war with the Malefor. The fate of the dragons lies in the hopes of the prophecy of the purple dragon. Spyro must fight the forces of Malefor and a black dragon named Cynder.

Title: Jak and Daxter: The Lost Frontier
Description: The dynamic duo returns to resolve an Eco shortage in this High Impact-developed sequel to Naughty Dog's popular platformer franchise.

Title: JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken: Ougon no Kaze
Description: Japan-exclusive Beat-'Em-Up video game released by Capcom in 2002.

Title: The Operative: No One Lives Forever
Description: Super-spy Cate Archer battles against the global terrorist organization known as H.A.R.M. in this groovy 1960s first-person shooter.

Title: Virtua Quest
Description: Virtua Quest is a 3rd person Action RPG set in the Virtua Fighter universe.

Title: King Arthur
Description: A hack and slash game based on the 2005 movie of the same name.

Title: X-Men: Legends II - Rise of Apocalypse
Description: When Apocalypse and his Four Horsemen threaten the safety of the world, and Magneto's position of power, the X-Men and the Brotherhood of Mutants must team-up in order to combat this threat and ultimately save the world.

Title: Hidden Invasion
Description: Hidden Invasion is a action/adventure game for the PS2 and GameCube.

Title: Puyo Puyo 15th Anniversary
Description: Puyo Puyo's 15th anniversary game. Came out for PS2, PSP Wii and DS

Title: Scooby-Doo! First Frights
Description: Scooby-Doo! First Frights is an action platformer that features Scooby-Doo and the Gang as kids.

Title: Commandos 2: Men of Courage
Description: Commandos 2 is a historically based stealth-action game Developed  by Pyro Studios in 2001.  You control a variety of elite commandos in an attempt to thwart the Axis powers throughout WW2.

Title: Ninja Assault
Description: Become a gun wielding ninja in a fight against an army of demonic soldiers!

Title: Monster Attack
Description: The first-game in Sandlot's Earth Defence Force series, sees the player adorn the-role of a  Storm-1 unit deployed with the sole-purpose of stopping the menacing 'ravengers', who have launched a full-scale invasion of Earth with the-intent of annihilating-it, utterly.

Title: Rise to Honor
Description: Jet Li stars as police officer Kit Yun as he fights his way from Hong Kong to San Francisco to fulfill a dead man's wish.

Title: Phantom Brave
Description: Phantom Brave is a strategy RPG for the PlayStation 2, and the first game to be published by NIS America.

Title: Spider-Man: The Movie
Description: A game based on Marvel's superhero and on the first movie of the Spider-Man franchise. It also featured many villains that did not appear in the movie.

Title: Tales of Destiny 2
Description: The true sequel to Tales of Destiny.

Title: Disney's Peter Pan - The Legend Of Never Land
Description: Captain Hook has discovered the island's magical secret and plots to rid Never Land of its enchanting Pixie dust.  This spells danger for Peter Pan in this all-new adventure.

Title: One Piece: Grand Adventure
Description: One Piece: Grand Adventure is a video game for the PlayStation 2 and the GameCube, based on the popular manga and anime series One Piece. Unlike other games in the series, Grand Adventure was developed specifically for the United States.

Title: Demon Chaos
Description: Demon Chaos is a 2005 action game in the vein of Dynasty Warriors published by Konami for the PlayStation 2.

Title: Dynasty Warriors 5
Description: Dynasty Warriors 5 is a hack and slash video game set in China and the fifth installment in the Dynasty Warriors series. It is based on the Chinese novel "Romance of the Three Kingdoms" by Luo Guanzhong.

Title: Barnyard
Description: A game based on the children's movie of the same name.  Nothing really more to say on this one, except why the heck do the male cows have udders? That is just WRONG.

Title: Power Rangers: Dino Thunder
Description: Power Rangers game set in the Dino Thunder time period.

Title: Magna Carta: Tears of Blood
Description: Magna Carta: Tears of blood is a Korean RPG that was released for Sony's Playstation 2.

Title: Bionicle Heroes
Description: Bionicle Heroes is a third-person shooter based off the popular line of toys from Lego.

Title: Disney's Kim Possible: What's the Switch?
Description: In Kim Possible "What's the switch", Drakken, Ron, Kim, and Shego are all trading places. That's right Shego is the teenage hero and her sidekick is Drakken. Ron is a evil scientist and Kim is his henchman. Join this exciting adventure with your favorite KP characters.

Title: Swashbucklers: Blue vs Grey
Description: Naval action/rpg set in the time of the american civil war from 1C and Akella. Looks a bit like a Pirates game, with several different 'modes' of play-- ship to ship combat, third person adventuring, 1 on 1 fighting.

Title: SpongeBob SquarePants: Creature From the Krusty Krab
Description: Guide Spongebob, Patrick, and Plankton through their Krabby Patty-induced nightmares and help them escape.

Title: Wall-E
Description: Based on the Pixar animated film taking place seven hundred years into the future, Wall-e is about the last functioning robot on Earth in this adventure platformer.

Title: Avatar - The Last Airbender: Into the Inferno
Description: Avatar -The Last Airbender: Into the Inferno takes place in the third and final season of the show where Aang must take on the Fire lord.

Title: Devil Summoner: Kuzunoha Raidou tai Abaddon Ou Plus
Description: A compilation of Devil Summoner: Raidou Kuzunoha versus King Abaddon and Shin Megami Tensei III: Nocturne Maniacs Chronicle Edition, an enhanced version of Nocturne Maniacs, which itself was an enhanced version of the original game.

Title: Kingdom Hearts Re:Chain of Memories
Description: A 3D PS2 remake of the GBA action RPG Kingdom Hearts: Chain of Memories.

Title: The Red Star
Description: The Red Star is an action game based on a series of graphic novels. A blend of Contra-style shooting with close-quarters melee combat, The Red Star is a unique blend of the old and the new. Features co-operative play and three different characters to choose from.

Title: 7 Blades
Description: 7 Blades is an Action-Adventure game created by Konami.

Title: Disney's PK: Out of the Shadows
Description: Based on an Italian comic series where Donald Duck becomes a crime-fighting vigilante called Paperinik, PK: Out of the Shadows sees him donning a mask and tights, as well as an array of gadgets, to stop an invasion of murderous aliens called the Evroniani.

Title: Chronicles of Narnia: Prince Caspian
Description: The Chronicles of Narnia: Prince Caspian is adapted from the novel-adapted movie of the same name.

Title: The Spiderwick Chronicles
Description: Based loosely on the events of the motion picture, The Spiderwick Chronicles puts you in control as Jared, Simon and Mallory.

Title: Hugo: Magic in the Trollwood
Description: Also known as Hugo: Zauberei im Trollwad

Title: Klonoa 2: Lunatea's Veil
Description: Klonoa 2 Is the sequel to the 2.5D platformer Klonoa: Door to Phantomile.

Title: Samurai Jack: The Shadow of Aku
Description: A game based on the cartoon Samurai Jack.

Title: The Punisher
Description: Crime is everywhere on the streets of New York City. As Frank "the Punisher" Castle, it is your job to clean them up. However, there seem to be bigger things at hand...

Title: Oookuki
Description: A PS2 adventure game notorious for its poor quality.

Title: Devil May Cry 2
Description: Devil May Cry 2 is the sequel to the 2001 critically-acclaimed Devil May Cry from Capcom. The game follows returning protagonist Dante and new playable character Lucia as they hack and slash their way through hordes of demons. Fans consider this to be the weakest in the series.

Title: Looney Tunes: Acme Arsenal
Description: Looney Tunes: Acme Arsenal is a third-person action title featuring popular characters from the Looney Tunes featurettes.

Title: Warriors of Might and Magic
Description: Warriors of Might and Magic is an action role-playing game developed by 3DO. Step into the shoes of Alleron, a soldier framed for a crime he didn't commit, and seek to discover the truth behind this conspiracy.

Title: Spider-Man 3
Description: The web-slinging, joke cracking, Spider-Man is back. The third game in the movie tie-in series sees Spider-Man battle more foes than ever and even get a new makeover, and of course,  it offers plenty of swinging around the city.

Title: Haven: Call of the King
Description: An action-adventure for the PlayStation 2 about a young man named Haven. Intended to be the first part of a trilogy, the game's poor sales left the story incomplete.

Title: Aria the Natural
Description: A "what do you call them, press O alot, read japanese and make choises ocationaly" game based on ARIA.

Title: Legacy of Kain: Blood Omen 2
Description: Released in 2002 for Xbox and Playstation 2, Blood Omen 2 answered many questions about Kain's rise to power while asking a few new ones.

Title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
Description: Take control of Rick O'Conell in this third episode based on the 2008 Mummy film.

Title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
Description: Return to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and wizardry in Harry Potter's fourth year, this time based directly on the film

Title: The Mark of Kri
Description: The Mark of Kri is a mash-up of American artwork styles like Disney and Don Bluth with a combination of Polynesian, Asian, and European cultures, and the kind of over the top, brutal violence of the Conan series, all swirled up into one unique if linear, game.

Title: Grand Theft Auto: Vice City Stories
Description: Rockstar's most recognizable franchise returns to Vice City, boasting a new plot, a new cast of characters (and some old favorites), more vehicles and a multiplayer mode.

Title: Godzilla: Unleashed
Description: Taking place 20 years after Godzilla: Save the Earth, Godzilla returns to brawl in Godzilla: Unleashed.

Title: Bratz: Girlz Really Rock!
Description: Music related minigames featuring the Bratz license.

Title: Rise of the Kasai
Description: Rise of the Kasai is the sequel to The Mark of Kri.

Title: Genji: Dawn of the Samurai
Description: Genji tells the story of Yoshitsune and Benkei, who take on the forces of the Heishi to prevent them from acquiring mysterious crystals known as the Amahagane to fulfill their evil ambition.

Title: LEGO Star Wars: The Complete Saga
Description: This family friendly game combines Lego Star Wars, and Lego Star Wars: The Original Trilogy, into one adventure spanning the entire Star Wars universe.

Title: Kamen Rider: Climax Heroes
Description: Kamen Rider: Climax Heroes is the first in a series of Kamen Rider fighting games that spans many of the series' generations.

Title: The Incredibles: Rise of the Underminer
Description: The Incredibles: Rise of the Underminer is a follow-up to THQ's action game starring Disney and Pixar's animated family of superheroes.

Title: Boogie
Description: Boogie is a karaoke and dancing game originally released on the Wii. The game features nearly forty songs from the 1970s through the 2000s.

Title: Tekken Tag Tournament
Description: The fourth main installment of the Tekken franchise compiles nearly every character featured in the series' three previous games. It also adds a "tag team" mechanic for two-on-two battles.

Title: Grandia Xtreme
Description: A spinoff from the Grandia series, Grandia Xtreme is a tough RPG with an emphasis on dungeon crawling.

Title: Digimon Rumble Arena 2
Description: Digimon Rumble Arena 2 (Digimon Battle Chronicle in Japan) is a Digimon fighting game released in 2004 by Bandai Games for the GameCube, PlayStation 2, and the Xbox.

Title: YuYu Hakusho: Dark Tournament
Description: Yu Yu Hakusho: Dark Tournament was released for the PlayStation 2. The game is based on the Dark Tournament arc of the anime.

Title: Rumble Roses
Description: Rumble Roses is an all female wrestling game made by Konami.

Title: The King of Fighters '94 Re-bout
Description: A graphical update of King of Fighters 94 released only in Japan.

Title: NFL Street 3
Description: The third installment of the NFL Street series.

Title: Neon Genesis Evangelion: Battle Orchestra
Description: Select your Eva unit and battle the Angels in this 2D side-scrolling fighting game, stylistically similar to the Super Smash Bros. series.

Title: Garouden Breakblow: Fist or Twist
Description: The sequel to realistic fighting game Garouden Breakblow.

Title: Æon  Flux
Description: Æon Flux is a game based on the 2005 film, which is based on the cartoon series of the same name. You play as Æon Flux, the top operative of a government rebellion, on her mission to kill a government leader.

Title: Robots
Description: The player took on the role of the main character from the movie Rodney Copperbottom. The GBA version should not be confused with the console versions which were heavily inspired by two excellent titles at the time, namely 'Jak and Daxter' and 'Ratchet and Clank'.

Title: Disney/Pixar's Finding Nemo
Description: Finding Nemo is a game based on the film of the same name.

Title: Shrek Super Party
Description: In this party game, players traverse a board game representation of five different realms, all which are locations from the film. Players then take turns battling it out in different mini games all in the pursuit of "Precious Drops," the winning factor of the game.

Title: Bionicle
Description: A third-person action-adventure game set in the Bionicle universe. It is based on the 2002-2003 events of the Bionicle franchise but is considered non-canonical.

Title: Catwoman
Description: Based after the film of the same name, which was named after, but not based on, the comic book character of the same name, this tie-in game sees Patience Phillips gain a set of feline superpowers and use them to defeat an evil makeup designer.

Title: Marvel Nemesis: Rise of the Imperfects
Description: Marvel Nemesis: Rise of the Imperfects is a third person fighting game from Marvel and EA. The game features original characters from the Marvel Universe as well as new characters made by EA.

Title: Scarface: The World is Yours
Description: Scarface: The World is yours, puts you in the shoes of Tony Montana as you try to re-establish your Cocaine Empire and get back the glory days of the past.

Title: Castlevania: Curse of Darkness
Description: A sequel to the events of Castlevania III:  Dracula's Curse.  Hector, a devil forgemaster that fled Dracula's service, seeks revenge and must stop Isaac, another forgemaster still loyal to Dracula.

Title: McFarlane's Evil Prophecy
Description: McFarlane's Evil Prophecy is a game for PC and Play Station 2.

Title: Onimusha: Dawn of Dreams
Description: Onimusha: Dawn of Dreams slashes its way back onto the PlayStation 2, in this 2 disc epic adventure.

Title: EOE: Eve of Extinction
Description: Eve of Extinction (EOE) is a 3D beat-’em-up action game developed by Yuke's Co. and published by Eidos.

Title: Underworld: The Eternal War
Description: Underworld: The Eternal War is an action game released on the PS2, which takes place in the same world established in the films.

Title: NadePro!! Kisama mo Seiyuu Yattemiro!
Description: An Otome Game about voice acting. Yes, really!

Title: Gran Turismo 3 A-Spec
Description: Gran Turismo 3: A-Spec is a driving simulator released for the Playstation 2 which garnered critical acclaim upon its release in 2001.

Title: Samurai Shodown Anthology
Description: This compilation includes 6 Samurai Shodown games on one disc.

Title: Star Wars: Jedi Starfighter
Description: Star Wars: Jedi Starfighter is an arcade style air combat game, featuring a nimble Jedi starfighter with force powers, and a high tech bomber.

Title: Ratchet & Clank: Size Matters
Description: Ratchet & Clank: Size Matters was a PSP iteration in the series released in 2007, and the game was later ported to the PlayStation 2.

Title: Need for Speed: ProStreet
Description: The 2007 release of the Need for Speed series and the 11th installment of the popular racing game franchise.

Title: FIFA Soccer 08
Description: FIFA 08 is the 2008 installment of Electronic Arts' series of football video games. It was developed by EA Canada.

Title: Stella Deus: The Gate of Eternity
Description: A mysterious deadly mist is ravaging the land of Solum, and the Imperial Legion soldier Spero and his companions adventure the land to stop it.

Title: Spawn: Armageddon
Description: The war between Heaven and Hell has begun.  It's up to Spawn to save the world from certain destruction.

Title: Eve Burst Error Plus
Description: A remake of Eve Burst Error released for the PlayStation 2 in 2003.

Title: World Soccer Winning Eleven 9
Description: World Soccer Winning Eleven 9/Pro Evolution Soccer 5 was the game was the first game in the series to feature online network play.

Title: Pro Evolution Soccer
Description: With engaging gameplay and its deep Master League mode, Pro Evolution Soccer set the foundations for Konami Computer Entertainment Tokyo's successful soccer simulation franchise

Title: Simple 2000 Series Vol. 115 The Roomshare to Iu Seikatsu.
Description: A maid sim for the PS2.

Title: Driving Emotion Type-S
Description: Driving Emotion Type-S is Square's entry into the racing-simulation genre. It is greatly disliked in (at least) the West due to its high difficulty.

Title: Crimson Tears
Description: Crimson Tears is a cel-shaded beat-em'-up set in future Tokyo from Capcom for the PlayStation 2.

Title: Beast Master And Prince
Description: A visual novel about a beast tamer that buys 4 animals that turn out to be something more than what she expected.

Title: Quake III: Revolution
Description: Playstation2 version of Quake III: Arena including the add-on Quake III: Team Arena.

Title: World Series Baseball 2K3
Description: The 2003 season entry in the World Series Baseball franchise.

Title: Samurai Shodown V
Description: Created after Playmore's acquisition of SNK, this prequel to the entire Samurai Shodown series completely revamps the button layout again (adding a new Dodge button, bringing back the second game's maneuvers for good use) while adding a variety of new combatants.

Title: Samurai Shodown VI
Description: Originally released for the Atomiswave arcade system, Samurai Shodown VI is a "dream match" installment featuring all fighters from the main series and the ability to choose between a variety of different gameplay styles.

Title: Ready 2 Rumble Boxing: Round 2
Description: Ready 2 Rumble Boxing: Round 2 is a boxing video game developed and published by Midway, it is the sequel to Ready 2 Rumble Boxing.

Title: NASCAR 2001
Description: The 2001 edition of EA's NASCAR racing sim.

Title: Oni
Description: A heavily anime-inspired third person action game, Oni attempts to blend gun play and traditional brawler gameplay together.

Title: Wreckless: The Yakuza Missions
Description: Wreckless: The Yakuza Missions is a driving/car combat game that involves two unique storylines in which you play as two female cops and two male spies, both duos enemies of the Yakuza.

Title: Room Zoom: Race for Impact
Description: A racing game that occurs on miniature level with tracks that can be found within the home.

Title: Ty the Tasmanian Tiger
Description: Ty the Tasmanian Tiger is a 3D platformer made by Krome Studios. In it, Ty travels around the Australian outback in search of five mystical talismans that will not only save his family from the Dreamworld, but his entire species from the wrath of Boss Cass.

Title: Conflict: Desert Storm
Description: Conflict: Desert Storm places you in the shoes of four SAS or Delta Force specialists as you are tasked with spearheading the assault on Iraq as they invade Kuwait.

Title: SRS: Street Racing Syndicate
Description: Street Racing Syndicate is an Import Tuner racing game that focuses on wowing the ladies

Title: Star Wars: Battlefront
Description: A team-based multiplayer-focused first-person/third-person shooter focusing on large-scale infantry battles in the Star Wars universe.

Title: Star Wars: Battlefront II
Description: The sequel to Star Wars: Battlefront, adding new game modes, new playable classes and abilities, revamped single-player modes, and huge space battles.

Title: Black
Description: Described as "Gun Porn" by its creators, Black is an explosion-filled first-person shooter from Criterion, the development house responsible for the Burnout series, which focuses on destructible environments.

Title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles 2: Battle Nexus
Description: This is the second game based on the 2003 TMNT series.

Title: TMNT
Description: TMNT is based on the 2007 CGI movie, and features action-platforming with some teamwork-based gameplay elements.

Title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles 3: Mutant Nightmare
Description:
This game is based on the third season of the 2003 TMNT series.

In the PS2 and Xbox-versions the TMNT: Turtles in Time Arcade-game is unlocked after completing the first level.

Title: 2002 FIFA World Cup
Description: An entry in EA's soccer franchise released to coincide with the 2002 World Cup. It is very similar to the previously-released FIFA 2002, with a few additions and tweaks.

Title: Gachinko Pro Yakyuu
Description: A super deformed baseball game by Now Production.

Title: Spy Hunter
Description: Released originally in 2001, Spy Hunter is a remake of the 1983 classic arcade game.

Title: Ty the Tasmanian Tiger 2: Bush Rescue
Description: Ty the Tasmanian Tiger 2: Bush Rescue expands on the game play of the first game, but features new elements, such as driving sequences, mech battles, and an expanded world. In Ty 2, Ty must fight Boss Cass once again to save the Australian outback.

Title: Futurama
Description: Futurama is a game based on the award winning television show, and features many of the original cast members and creative writing.

Title: Roommania #203
Description: A game where you take control of god and play mind games on a Japanese school boy living alone in his apartment.

Title: Cold Winter
Description: Join former SAS soldier Andrew Sterling as he takes on a group of arms dealers with access to a missle guidance system.

Title: Taito Memories II Gekan
Description: The second volume of Taito Memories II released for Playstation 2 in Japan.  Includes 25 Taito arcade games.

Title: Taito Memories II Joukan
Description: Taito Memories II Joukan (Vol. 1) is a compilation of 25 Taito arcade games for the Playstation 2.

Title: Taito Memories Joukan
Description: Taito Memories Joukan (Vol. 1) compiles 25 Taito arcade games and was released in Japan for the PS2.

Title: Taito Legends
Description: A collection of 29 of Taito's classic (and not-so-classic) games from the past including Space Invaders.

Title: Disney's Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End
Description: Play as Will Turner, Elizabeth Swann, and the infamous Captain Jack Sparrow in this video game adaptation of the third film in the Pirates of the Caribbean franchise.

Title: Dragon Sisters
Description: A budget sidscrolling beat 'em up published by D3 Games (under the alias of Essential Games) and developed by Tamsoft

Title: Madagascar
Description: A video game based on the hit 2005 DreamWorks Animation film.

Title: Dragon Ball Z: Budokai Tenkaichi
Description: An alternate fighting game take on the Dragon Ball manga and anime series, Budokai Tenkaichi utilizes a third-person perspective and unified movelists while adding a very large playable character roster.

Title: SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.5: Golden Axe
Description: A PS2 3D remake of the original Golden Axe title, the game was a simplistic title compared to other PS2 games due to being part of the AGES 2500 cheaper games made by the SEGA to the Japanese market.

Title: Resident Evil - Code: Veronica
Description: Resident Evil: Code: Veronica is a survival horror video game initially developed and published by Capcom for the SEGA Dreamcast. It was later released for Sony PlayStation 2 and GameCube with improved graphics.

Title: Zero no Tsukaima: Maigo no Period to Ikusen no Symphony
Description: The third game based on the Zero no Tsukaima anime.

Title: We Are*
Description: We Are* is a Playstation 2 game that was released only in Japan.

Title: Guilty Gear XX #Reload
Description: The first revision of Guitly Gear XX, rebalancing the character roster while adding Robo-Ky as a playable character from the start. Its console version also expands most game modes, with the Xbox version introducing online multiplayer.

Title: Guilty Gear XX Slash
Description: The Japan-exclusive second revision of Guilty Gear X2 adds two new characters (A.B.A and Order-Sol) while including new balance changes.

Title: Conflict: Vietnam
Description: This game takes the four-man squad dynamic of the Conflict: Desert Storm games and transplants it into the setting of the Vietnam war.

Title: Shijou Saikyou No Deshi Kenichi: Gekitou! Ragnarok Hachikengou
Description: This game was published by Capcom which was released in 2007 and it follows the anime: History's Greatest Disciple Kenichi up to the Ragnarok story.

Title: Guilty Gear XX Λ Core Plus
Description: An enhanced version of the console version of Guilty Gear XX Accent Core, re-adding previously-removed game modes and characters while including a brand new Story Mode set after the events of the previous Guilty Gear XX games.

Title: Guilty Gear X2
Description: The third installment of the Guilty Gear fighting game series, revising the gameplay from Guilty Gear X while adding new characters, the "Psych Burst" mechanic, and the Dust button.

Title: Guilty Gear XX Λ Core
Description: The third revision of Guilty Gear XX adds new gameplay mechanics and special moves while re-designing the game's aesthetics.

Title: Guilty Gear Isuka
Description: A spin-off version of Guilty Gear XX, featuring a chaotic system where four players can fight at the same time.

Title: Petz: Catz 2
Description: The second game in the Petz series to be themed around cats.

Title: Espgaluda
Description: Espgaluda is a vertical bullet hell shoot' em up developed by Cave.

Title: Mushihime-Sama
Description: Mushihime-sama is a bullet hell shoot 'em up developed by Cave.

Title: Charlie's Angels
Description: A widely-panned game themed on the film series of the same name, which sees the Angels hunting down missing national monuments.

Title: I"s Pure
Description: A PS2 visual novel based on the I"S Pure OVA anime.

Title: Ikki Tousen: Shining Dragon
Description: A video game based on the manga and anime series.

Title: Covert Command
Description: Covert Command (released as "Simple 2000 Series Vol. 102: The Fuhyou: Senjou no Inu Tachi" in Japan) is a action game made by Tamsoft and published by D3 for the Playstation 2 in 2006.

Title: Metal Gear
Description: Known as the first stealth-action game, Metal Gear tells the tale of Solid Snake, a rookie operative of the U.S. special forces unit FOXHOUND, as he infiltrates Outer Heaven, a fortified military compound, to destroy a mysterious superweapon known as "Metal Gear".

Title: SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.7: Columns
Description: The seventh installment of Sega's Japanese-exclusive PS2 series of classic game remakes, featuring an enhanced version of the 1990 game Columns (as well as a remake of Columns '97 and a bonus versus mode).

Title: Taiko Drum Master
Description: In Taiko Drum Master, play familiar songs to the beat of the titular Japanese instrument. Additional minigames are included which take advantage of the bundled drum peripheral.

Title: Yoake no Mariko 2nd Act
Description: Sequel to Yoake no Mariko on PlayStation 2.

Title: Monster Hunter 2
Description: Monster Hunter 2 (dos) is a Japanese-only entry in the Monster Hunter franchise, serving as the first second-generation title. It expands on everything from Monster Hunter Freedom and introduces new monsters, a season system, and locations.

Title: Arc the Lad: End of Darkness
Description: Arc the Lad: End of Darkness is drastically different from other Arc the Lad games, featuring a real-time battle system, card based power-ups, and boasting a cast of 24 playable characters.

Title: R-Type Final
Description: Originally planned as the last game in the R-Type series of shoot-'em-ups, Final has a lone ship investigating a crashed space colony to research a failed counter-attack against the Bydo Empire. It features 101 different ships to choose from, each with a unique combination of weaponry.

Title: Conan
Description: A third-person hack and slash game featuring Conan the Barbarian only released in Europe.

Title: Midnight Club II
Description: Going from being a no-name racer to a international street-racing legend, Midnight Club II is an open-world, checkpoint-based street racing game where you drive a wide variety of cars and bikes through the streets of Los Angeles, Paris and Tokyo.

Title: WRC: Rally Evolved
Description: The fifth and final game in this PS2 racing series. Released in 2005.

Title: Rune
Description: Rune is a third-person action-adventure game focused on melee fighting, developed by Human Head Studios and was released in late 2000.

Title: Rurouni Kenshin: Enjou! Kyoto Rinne
Description: Ruroni Kenshin: Enjou! Kyoto Rinne is a 3D action game based off the Ruroni Kenshin series which was released exclusively for the PlayStation 2 system

Title: TimeSplitters 2
Description: The sequel to the PS2 launch title TimeSplitters, TimeSplitters 2 follows two futuristic soldiers on a frantic rush through time and space to retrieve the the Time Crystals from the evil TimeSplitters.

Title: TimeSplitters: Future Perfect
Description: The third and final installment of the TimeSplitters trilogy, putting players back into the role of a futuristic soldier attempting to end humanity's war with the time-travelling "TimeSplitters".

Title: The Legend of Alon D'ar
Description: Play as a young hero named Jarik in this fantasy role-playing game from Stormfront Studios.

Title: Hot Shots Golf 2
Description: The game that put Hot Shots on the map.  Hot Shots Golf 2 is the sequel to Hot Shot Golf and made the series a staple with it's zany characters.

Title: Pro Race Driver
Description: Pro Race Driver is a racing video game that puts the player in the shoes of Ryan McKane, a race driver trying to make a name for himself in numerous car championships.

Title: Drakengard
Description: A warrior for the Union named Caim and the dragon Angelus form a pact, bonding their lives together so that they may fight their mutual enemy the Empire.

Title: Haunted Castle
Description: A horror-themed side-scrolling platformer for arcades, based on Konami's earlier platformer Castlevania. Control whip-bearer Simon Belmont as he faces numerous threats to rescue his beloved from the evil Count Dracula.

Title: Syphon Filter: Logan's Shadow
Description: The final Syphon Filter title, Logan's Shadow is the sequel to Syphon Filter: Dark Mirror, and introduces underwater combat to the series.

Title: James Pond 2: Codename: RoboCod
Description: A side-scrolling platform game released in 1991. It is the sequel to the original James Pond, and now parodies RoboCop as well as James Bond.

Title: Twisted Metal: Head-On
Description: Twisted Metal goes portable with Twisted Metal: Head-On for the PSP.

Title: Syphon Filter: Dark Mirror
Description: Syphon Filter: Dark Mirror is a third person shooter for the PSP, it takes place after Syphon Filter: The Omega Strain. It is also the series' first appearance on the PSP.

Title: Secret Agent Clank
Description: After being side-kick to Ratchet for so long, Clank takes matters into his own hands to save Ratchet and solve the crime of the century.

Title: Luxor: Pharaoh's Challenge
Description: Luxor: Pharaoh's Challenge is a puzlle game that was released on the Wii, PSP, PS2, and DS

Title: Ghostbusters: The Video Game
Description: With a script edited and approved by Dan Aykroyd and Harold Ramis, Ghostbusters: The Video Game is a sequel to the feature length films. Who ya gonna call? GHOSTBUSTERS!

Title: Crash Tag Team Racing
Description: The third racing game in the Crash Bandicoot franchise.  Play as eight characters from the Crash bandicoot series!

Title: Ben 10 Ultimate Alien: Cosmic Destruction
Description: Ben 10 Ultimate Alien: Cosmic Destruction is the latest Ben 10 video game set during the events of Ben 10: Ultimate Alien.

Title: Ben 10 Alien Force: The Game
Description: Ben 10 Alien Force is based in the world of the popular cartoon network show "Ben 10."

Title: Ghost Rider
Description: Ghost Rider is a movie tie-in action game that continues the story of the movie of the same name.

Title: Phantasy Star II
Description: 16-bit sci-fi RPG originally released on the Sega Genesis/Mega Drive in 1989.

Title: Shadow of Destiny
Description: Control Eike Kusch as he attempts to change the course of history and stop a mysterious figure from killing him.

Title: Justice League Heroes
Description: Justice League Heroes is an Action-RPG that allows you to play as members of the Justice League of America as they work together to take down the various villains in the game.

Title: Duel Masters: Birth of Super Dragon
Description: Also known as "Duel Masters: Jaafuuchouryuu Tensei", this Japanese console adaptation of the Duel Masters manga, anime, and trading card game features a new story drawn by the original manga artist and online multiplayer support.

Title: Sakigake!! Kuromati Koukou: Kore wa Hyottoshite Game Nanoka!? Hen
Description: An adventure game by Hudson based on the Sakigake!! Kuromati Koukou series.

Title: NBA 2K6
Description: NBA 2K6 is the seventh installment of the NBA 2K series of realistic basketball games, updating the roster to the 2005/2006 NBA season while adding new control mechanics.

Title: Hitman 2: Silent Assassin
Description: Agent 47 is forced out of retirement and takes up contracts again in order to find the whereabouts of his captured friend.

Title: Project Minerva Professional
Description: A tactical-action game developed by Flat-Out.

Title: Gekitou Pro Yakyuu: Mizushima Shinji Allstars vs Pro Yakyuu
Description: An arcade sim baseball game, featuring the teams and players of the NPB and an all-star of cel-shaded manga characters from the many works of the legendary baseball manga creator, Mizushima Shinji.

Title: Tengai Makyou II: Manjimaru
Description: The second game in the Japanese-exclusive Tengai Makyou role-playing franchise.

Title: Teen Titans
Description: Teen Titans game is the 2nd Teen Titans game made, and has the 5 main Teen Titans members from the TV Series which it is based on: Robin, Cyborg, Raven, Starfire, and Beast Boy.

Title: Showdown: Legends of Wrestling
Description: The third installment in the Legends of Wrestling series.

Title: Sakigake!! Kuromati Koukou
Description: A party/board game developed by Hudson Soft and published by DigiCube, featuring a wide array of mini-games for up to four players. Based on the anime/manga series of the same name (Known as Cromartie High School in the west).

Title: Ys: The Ark of Napishtim
Description: Starring the red-headed protagonist Adol Christin, Ys: The Ark of Napishtim is the sixth game in the long-running action RPG series.

Title: Dragon Ball Z: Sagas
Description: From the studio behind the Tak series of games comes a third-person action game adaptation of the Dragon Ball series released exclusively in North America. Up to two players can combo their way through the first two-thirds of the Dragon Ball Z storyline.

Title: Final Fight: Streetwise
Description: The Final Fight franchise makes a gritty return as a 3D beat 'em up for sixth-generation consoles.

Title: Appleseed EX
Description: Appleseed EX is a 3D Action-Adventure game created by DreamFactory.

Title: Spider-Man: Web of Shadows
Description: Spider-Man: Web Of Shadows sees Spider-Man facing off against nemesis Venom and his army of Symbiotes with the help of both Marvel heroes and villains.

Title: Disney's Treasure Planet
Description: A platformer based on the disney film of the same name.

Title: Everblue 2
Description: A scuba-diving exploration adventure game developed by Arika for the Sony PS2. It is the sequel to Everblue and the spiritual predecessor to the Endless Ocean games.

Title: Rygar: The Legendary Adventure
Description: A 3D action game for the PS2 that reimagines the 2D sidescroller Rygar.

Title: Champions: Return to Arms
Description: Champions: Return to Arms is a direct follow up to Champions of Norrath, a popular Action RPG for the Playstation 2.

Title: Shining Force: Neo
Description: In Shining Force: Neo, you play as a young fighter named Max who has finished his training that will make Him a Force. It is not a turn-based game at all, such as its predecessors for the previous gaming systems, opting for a more Diablo-style Action RPG game.

Title: ESPN NFL Football
Description: Sega's fifth NFL game and the first to use the ESPN license. Though it is a follow-up to NFL 2K3, the game's official title does not include "2K".

Title: Devil May Cry 3: Special Edition
Description: A re-release of Devil May Cry 3: Dante's Awakening, featuring a more accessible level of difficulty, a survival mode titled Bloody Palace, and the playable debut of Dante's twin brother, Vergil.

Title: Devil May Cry 3: Dante's Awakening
Description: The third game in Capcom's popular action adventure series. This is a prequel to the original Devil May Cry and the first game of the franchise's storyline chronologically. The game saw a re-release in Devil May Cry 3: Special Edition, which added a new character, among other things.

Title: Death by Degrees
Description: A third-person action game featuring Nina Williams from the Tekken series.

Title: NBA Hoopz
Description: A sequel to NBA Showtime: NBA on NBC that introduced a 3-on-3 format to the ubiquitous NBA Jam formula of Midway basketball games.

Title: Crash of the Titans
Description: Join Crash on his latest quest to stop Dr. Cortex from his nefarious plans and rescue his sister Coco. Crash of the Titans features all new graphics and some serious platforming fun.

Title: Hunter: The Reckoning - Wayward
Description: A sequel to the original Hunter: The Reckoning. This game picks up two years after the events of the previous game and brings similar gameplay, and two new characters, to the cursed town of Ashcroft.

Title: Summoner
Description: Summoner is an action role-playing game from Red Faction creators Volition.

Title: Vampire Princess Yui Senyasyo
Description: Adventure game spin-off to the manga Vampire Princess Yui, itself a spin-off of the Vampire Princess Miyu franchise.

Title: Onimusha: Warlords
Description: Killed in his attempt to unify Japan under his rule, Nobunaga Oda makes a pact with the demon king Fortinbras and returns with a vengeance. The Princess of Inabayama Castle is caught in the crossfire and kidnapped... but not before sending a plea for aid to her friend, the samurai Samanosuke Akechi. This man will fall and rise again as an Oni Musha - a demon warrior!

Title: beatmania
Description: The first and only console version of Konami's ground-breaking music game franchise, beatmania IIDX, to be released in the United States.

Title: Tales of Rebirth
Description: Tales of Rebirth is the sixth main entry of Namco's Tales series of video games.

Title: Splashdown
Description: Splashdown is a racing game for the Xbox and Playstation 2

Title: Ys I & II: Eternal Story
Description:
An enhanced port of Ys I and II for the PlayStation 2, that uses the Complete editions of the games as a base, developed by  	
Michael Soft.

Title: Shanghai: The Four Elements
Description: Success Corp. brings the mahjong solitaire series to the PlayStation 2, including four game modes based on the four classical elements (Earth, Fire, Water, and Air).

Title: Densha de Go! Final
Description: A home release of the Densha de Go! electric train simulation series intended to be the ultimate entry, featuring a grand visual and audio upgrade, revamped penalty and scoring mechanics, and a two-player mode where one player acts as the train conductor.

Title: Densha de Go! Professional 2
Description: Another home entry in Taito's train simulation franchise brings another graphics upgrade and new train routes.

Title: Crash: Mind Over Mutant
Description: This sequel to Crash of the Titans takes jacking enemies to the next level by allowing you to level up the monster under your control.

Title: Deus Ex: The Conspiracy
Description: Deus Ex: The Conspiracy was the 2002 PlayStation 2 port of the original PC Game from 2000.

Title: Sengoku Basara X
Description: A fighting game spin-off of Capcom's Sengoku Basara series of games, from the studio behind the Guilty Gear series.

Title: Naruto: Uzumaki Chronicles
Description: Naruto: Uzumaki Chronicles lets the player take control of Naruto and various other characters in the franchise to do missions to grow stronger and become hokkage.

Title: 12Riven: The Psi-Climinal of Integral
Description: A visual novel about a boy who must prevent a girl from being killed by a psychic.

Title: Fate/Unlimited Codes
Description: A traditional fighting game adaptation of Type-Moon's 2004 visual novel Fate/stay night.

Title: London Racer II
Description: London Racer 2 for playstation 2

Title: Autobahn Raser: Das Spiel zum Film
Description: A game based on the Autobahn Raser film which was in turn based on the Autobahn Raser games.

Title: USA Racer
Description: A street racing game featuring 11 tracks across the United States of America.

Title: Autobahn Raser IV
Description: The fourth iteraction of Davilex's German-themed racing title and one of the few to not be localized in other parts of Europe.

Title: Capcom Fighting Evolution
Description: The last original sprite-based fighting game made by Capcom, Capcom Fighting Evolution brings fighters from multiple Street Fighter series (as well as Darkstalkers and Red Earth) together for a crossover bash.

Title: Soulcalibur III
Description: The tale of Soul Calibur continues in the series's fourth entry, adding a variety of new game modes and features (including an in-depth character creation system).

Title: ExZeus
Description: Arcade flight shooter.

Title: NiGHTS into Dreams...
Description: "NiGHTS into Dreams..." is a 3D flying game made by Sonic Team for the Sega Saturn. You play as Nights in order to stop the evil Wizeman and his minions.

Title: Madden NFL 2003
Description: A football game from EA sports. With commentary from John Madden & Al Michaels and  St. Louis Rams running back Marshall Faulk on the cover.

Title: Wrestle Kingdom
Description: A Japanese wrestling game that was created by the makers of the Gamecube WWE Day of Reckoning series.  This game features freelance wrestlers and also includes top stars from the biggest promotions in Japan.

Title: Clannad
Description: An acclaimed visual novel developed by Key revolving around the themes of family that was also adapted into an equally acclaimed anime series.

Title: The King of Fighters: Neowave
Description: The first King of Fighters game to be built on arcade hardware other than the Neo Geo is a remake of King of Fighters 2002, complete with a new button and three gameplay styles for a variety of new techniques and strategies.

Title: Disney's Donald Duck: Goin' Quackers
Description: An action platform game starring Donald Duck.

Title: Yakuza
Description: Yakuza, known in Japan as Ryu ga Gotoku (Like a Dragon), is an open-world action-adventure game with RPG elements, developed and published by Sega, in which you play the role of a Yakuza gangster known as Kazuma Kiryu. It was released in 2005.

Title: Yakuza 2
Description: Yakuza 2 is a free-roaming action-adventure brawler which is a continuation of the original Yakuza game on the PlayStation 2. The game is set 1 year after the first game in Osaka,  Japan and follows the exploits of Kiryu Kazuma as he tries to settle a gang war.

Title: World Heroes 2 JET
Description: A new heavily-publicized martial arts tournament, known as the World Heroes Battle Fest, is taking place in modern times. Who among history's greatest warriors will prevail in this third entry to the World Heroes series? Athlete admitted!

Title: World Heroes Anthology
Description: This compilation includes all of the World Heroes games in one disc.

Title: Wild Arms 3
Description: Traditional role playing game with an Old West theme.

Title: Viewtiful Joe
Description: Take the role of Viewtiful Joe, and save your girlfriend Silvia from the horrible dangers of Movieland.

Title: Way of the Samurai 2
Description: Way of the Samurai 2 is an open-ended Samurai game, where your choices dictate the storyline.

Title: Devil May Cry
Description: Play as Dante, son of the legendary dark knight Sparda, as he takes on the emperor of the demon world, Mundus. With help from the lovely Trish, the Force Edge and his guns, Ebony and Ivory.

Title: Castlevania: Lament of Innocence
Description: The origins of Dracula and the Belmont clan are revealed for the first time in this 3-D action title of Castlevania for the PlayStation 2.

Title: Dark Cloud 2
Description: Control Max, a young inventor, and Monica, a warrior princess from the future, as they fight their way through dungeons and train rides to save the world.

Title: Contra: Shattered Soldier
Description: Be Bill Rizer and kick ass through a variety of intense levels by yourself or with a friend.

Title: Breath of Fire: Dragon Quarter
Description: The fifth game in the Breath of Fire series. It is a... major departure from the series' standard turn-based JRPG roots, to say the least.

Title: Art of Fighting Anthology
Description: Art of Fighting Anthology is a PlayStation 2 compilation of all three Art of Fighting games.

Title: Black Belt
Description: Beat up a variety of henchmen, big and small, to rescue your girlfriend in this 1986 brawler by Sega for the Sega Master System, based on the post-apocalyptic martial arts manga and anime series Fist of the North Star.

Title: Blood Will Tell: Tezuka Osamu's Dororo
Description: Blood Will Tell is an action game that borrows themes from a Japanese manga called Dororo, created by Osamu Tezuka. Its main protagonist is a young samurai, Hyakkimaru who is on a quest to recover his 48 body parts from the fiends that haunt feudal Japan.

Title: Metal Slug 6
Description: Sixth installment of the Metal Slug franchise and the first to leave the Neo-Geo hardware. Introduces two new characters from the Ikari Warriors/King of Fighters franchises.

Title: NeoGeo Battle Coliseum
Description: Various SNK series, from Fatal Fury to Metal Slug, collide in this 2-on-2 tag-team crossover fighting game from SNK Playmore.

Title: The King of Fighters XI
Description: Continuing the tag-team mechanics of King of Fighters 2003, The King of Fighters XI is the eleventh main entry in the long-running fighting game series and the second in the Ash Saga.

Title: Arcana Heart
Description: Made by the team that developed Samurai Shodown V, Arcana Heart features a hand-drawn anime aesthetic, an all-girl fighter roster, and a unique assist character system known as "Arcana".

Title: All-Star Fighters
Description: Known in Japan as "The All*Star Kakutou Matsuri". All-Star Fighters is the 91st entry in the Simple 2000 budget game series for the PS2, bringing together characters and locales from many different Simple 2000 games in a bizarre fighting tournament.

Title: Crisis Zone
Description: Time Crisis series spin off.

Title: Technic Beat
Description: A rhythm action game for the PS2. You can play a platypus on it.

Title: Sly 3: Honor Among Thieves
Description: The size of the Cooper Gang expands in Sly 3: Honor Among Thieves as they attempt their biggest heist yet: gaining access to the heavily guarded Cooper Vault, which houses all the treasure the Cooper family line has collected over throughout their history.

Title: Sly Cooper and the Thievius Raccoonus
Description: Sly Cooper and the Thievius Raccoonus is a platformer that sees Sly Cooper and his gang on a mission to defeat the five criminals that killed Sly's family and reclaim the pages of the Thievius Raccoonus, a book of family thieving techniques compiled by generations of the Cooper family.

Title: God of War II
Description: God of War II continues the story of Kratos as he wields his newly-bestowed god-like powers, much to the dismay and fear of the other gods.

Title: Prince of Persia: Warrior Within
Description: Prince of Persia: Warrior Within is the the second game in the Sands of Time series. Adopting a much darker tone, Warrior Within follows the Prince to the Island of Time as he attempts to change the past in order to end the Dahaka's relentless pursuit.

Title: Zone of the Enders: The 2nd Runner
Description: Zone of the Enders: The 2nd Runner is a sci-fi action-adventure game produced by Hideo Kojima. The game features fast-paced mech battles and a very elaborate story.

Title: Zone of the Enders
Description: Zone of the Enders is a fast-paced action game in which you play as Leo Stenbuck, the reluctant pilot of the orbital frame Jehuty.  With Jehuty you must protect the Jupiter space colony known as Antilla from an invading force known as Bahram.

Title: Shin Megami Tensei: Persona 3 FES
Description: This expanded edition of Persona 3 adds additional content and a continuation of the original game's storyline.

Title: Shin Megami Tensei: Persona 3
Description: Persona 3 is the fourth main entry in the Persona series. Introducing the "Social Link" system and removing several Shin Megami Tensei staples including the post-apocalyptic setting, Persona 3 greatly expanded the popularity of the series, particularly in the west. It also established the balance of traditional role-playing combat and social simulation that would define the series going forward.

Title: Red Dead Revolver
Description: A third-person shooter that tells the story of bounty hunter Red Harlow and his bloody quest for vengeance across America's Wild West.

Title: God Hand
Description: God Hand is a 3D third-person beat-'em-up game featuring Resident Evil-style "tank controls", irreverent humor, and over-the-top action.

Title: Silent Hill 2: Restless Dreams
Description: Silent Hill 2: Restless Dreams is an updated version of the original Silent Hill 2 released a month after the original version.

Title: 007: Agent Under Fire
Description: Agent Under Fire is a game released by EA under the James Bond license. It was the first James Bond game released for the then new generation of consoles.

Title: VM Japan: Vantage Master - Mystic Far East
Description: A hexagonal turn-based tactical RPG set in feudal Japan by Nihon Falcom that supports both single-player and multiplayer.

Title: Shinseiki Evangelion: Koutetsu no Girlfriend
Description: Shinseiki Evangelion: Koutetsu no Girlfriend, also known as Neon Genesis Evangelion: Girlfriend of Steel, is a Japanese-style text-heavy adventure game, which follows the characters from the Evangelion anime in a side story that takes place roughly around the time of the early 'teens episodes.

Title: Ribbit King
Description: Have you Frolfed today? Send frogs careening around bizarre courses littered with power-ups, danger, and distractions to rack up points or go for the elusive and high-scoring Frog-in-One!

Title: Sonic the Hedgehog 2
Description: Run, jump and spin through levels as Sonic and Tails, in order to thwart the plans of the nefarious Dr. Robotnik and free the kidnapped animals! Released by Sega in 1992, Sonic the Hedgehog 2 is often considered one of the greatest platformers of all time.

Title: Asterix and Obelix: Kick Buttix
Description: Asterix and Obelix: Kick Buttix (also known as Astérix & Obélix XXL in Europe) is a Beat-Em-Up and platforming title for PS2, PC and Gamecube, released November 21, 2003 in France. It was published by Atari and developed by Etranges Libellules

Title: 10 Pin: Champions Alley
Description: A bowling game released for PlayStation 2 (and later as a PS2 Classic, for PlayStation 3) only in Europe.

Title: Sanyo Pachinko Paradise 7: Edokko Gen-san
Description: A collection of two digital recreations of real world pachinko machines.

Title: Miami Vice
Description: 3rd person shooter for PS2 and Xbox (PAL only). Based on 80s hit TV-series.

Title: Gungriffon Blaze
Description: Gungriffon Blaze was a Playstation 2 launch title. Set in a devastated post World War III world, the player plays as a mech equipped UN soldier who must maintain peace.

Title: Smarties Meltdown
Description: Smarties Meltdown is a third person game featuring Nestlé Smarties.

Title: MX Unleashed
Description: MX Unleashed is a dirt-bike game that features races, a free-roam freestyle mode, and the ability to drive other vehicles.

Title: SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.1: Phantasy Star - Generation:1
Description: The first SEGA AGES 2500 is a complete remake of the original Phantasy Star on the Sega Master System.

Title: SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.17: Phantasy Star - Generation:2
Description: Phantasy Star - Generation:2 is a graphical upgrade of the 16-bit game Phantasy Star II.  It includes enhanced cutscenes and character designs.

Title: Rogue Hearts Dungeon
Description: Japanese reimagining of the genre defining computer RPG Rogue.

Title: Ultimate Board Game Collection
Description: A collection of digitized board games for the PS2, PSP, and Wii.

Title: Shinseiki Evangelion: Koutetsu no Girlfriend 2
Description: Another visual novel set in the alternate universe seen in episode 26 of Neon Genesis Evangelion.

Title: Bravo Music: Christmas Edition
Description: Christmas themed edition of the rhythm game Mad Maestro. Japan only.

Title: Unison: Rebels of Rhythm & Dance
Description: A rhythm game exclusive to the PlayStation 2.

Title: Soukou Kihei Votoms
Description: Votoms is an action game based on the '80s anime series of the same name. The player assumes the role of Chirico Cuvie and fights using mecha known as "Armored Troopers."

Title: Driven to Destruction
Description: PS2 racing game Driven to Destruction.

Title: Front Mission 5: Scars of the War
Description: The 5th game, taking place between 2070 to 2121, with a narative that spans across every game in the series.

Title: Yoake no Mariko
Description: This PlayStation 2 release is a voice acting simulator that allows you to play with a microphone or with a controller, which turns the gameplay into a more rhythm-game-like experience.

Title: Crash Twinsanity
Description: Crash Twinsanity is a Title in the Crash Bandicoot series in which you play as Crash and his Arch-Enemy Neo Cortex. The game features free-roaming levels and is less about collecting crystals, as in the previous games, and more about completing levels.

Title: Crash Bandicoot: The Wrath of Cortex
Description: Crash Bandicoot: The Wrath of Cortex brings the fight to the sixth generation consoles while retaining a lot of the original concepts and ideas of the previously Playstation-focused franchise.

Title: True Love Story: Summer Days, and yet...
Description: The fourth and final game in the visual novel series.

Title: True Love Story 3
Description: The third game in the Japanese exclusive visual novel series.

Title: Grandia II
Description: Born of different worlds, woven together by fate, each shall rise to face their destiny.

Title: Grand Tour Racing: GT-R 400
Description: A racing game released on the PS2

Title: Fu-un Bakumatsuden
Description: Sequel to Fu-un Shinsengumi released on the PS2.

Title: Sekirei: Mirai Kara no Okurimono
Description: An adventure game by Alchemist based on the 2008 anime/manga Sekirei.

Title: Zero no Tsukaima: Muma ga Tsumugu Yokaze no Gensoukyoku
Description: The second visual novel based on the Zero no Tsukaima anime.

Title: Monster Eggs
Description: Released on the PC and PS2 in Europe.

Title: England International Football
Description: The official video game of the England International football team, fully endorsed by the Football Association.

Title: Eagle Eye Golf
Description: A Playstation2 golf title.

Title: Aria the Origination: Aoi Wakusei no El Cielo
Description: The second Ps2 game based on the ARIA anime. This one beeing based on the final part of the anime going by the same name.

Title: Furry Tales
Description: A real time strategy which pits sheep vs. wolves. Time to get wooly or wolfy!

Title: A Visual Mix: Ayumi Hamasaki Dome Tour 2001 A
Description: A Visual Mix: Ayumi Hamasaki Dome Tour 2001 A is a concert simulator where you man cameras for a concert for Japanese performer Ayumi Hamasaki.

Title: Drag Racer USA
Description: A street racing game for the PlayStation 2.

Title: Code Age Commanders
Description: An action RPG from Square-Enix released only in Japan.

Title: Tetsujin 28-Go
Description: A game set in the Tetsujin/Gigantor universe where you control gigantic robots with a remote control.

Title: Gun
Description: GUN is a third person action/adventure game setting you loose into 1800s America, where law is lost and crime runs rampant.

Title: Ridge Racer V
Description: Launching alongside the Playstation 2, this is the 5th console entry of Namco's flagship racer. An arcade port, titled Ridge Racer V: Arcade Battle, was released in 2001 and is to date the last Ridge Racer to be released for arcades.

Title: Sonic R
Description: Sonic R is a 3D racing game. It features characters from the Sonic series and puts them in races against each other.

Title: Sphinx and the Cursed Mummy
Description: Starring the demi-god Sphinx, and the undead corpse of Tutankhamen, this action-adventure game is filled with Ancient Egyptian mythology.

Title: Shadow of the Colossus
Description: Explore the Forbidden Land as Wander, a young warrior who must slay sixteen Colossi in order to restore the life of a sacrificed maiden.

Title: Tenshou Gakuen Gensouroku
Description: A hybrid adventure game with strategy battle segements that is very similar to the Tokyo Majin Gakuen franchise in terms of setting and gameplay but is otherwise completely unrelated.

Title: Tenshou Gakuen Gekkouroku
Description: The sequel to Tenshou Gakuen Gensouroku, taking place 5 years after the previous game.

Title: Tokyo Majin Gakuen Gehouchou: Keppuuroku
Description: A remake of Tokyo Majin Gakuen Gehoujou released for the PlayStation 2.

Title: Activision Anthology
Description: Activision Anthology is a compilation that includes over 45 of the company's biggest games for the Atari 2600.

Title: X2: Wolverine's Revenge
Description: Take control of Wolverine as he uncovers his own dark past and tries to find the cure to the deadly Shiva virus.

Title: Gadget Racers
Description: Known in Japan as "Choro Q HG 3". A version for North America was planned, but was cancelled.

Title: ChoroQ
Description: Known in Japan as "Choro Q HG 4", ChoroQ is the fourth in the "High Grade" sub-series and the only entry to be released worldwide with the Choro Q name.

Title: Seek and Destroy
Description: Known in Japan as "Shin Combat Choro Q", Seek and Destroy is a tank combat game in which the world of "Quewar" is populated not by people, but by tanks.

Title: Road Trip
Description: Known in Japan as "Choro Q HG 2" and in Europe as "Road Trip Adventure", Road Trip combines the series' traditional racing and customization of miniature cars with a new open-world experience and numerous game modes.

Title: Gadget Racers
Description: Known in Japan as "Choro Q HG" and in Europe as "Penny Racers", Gadget Racers is the series' first PlayStation 2 entry.

Title: Speed Challenge: Jacques Villeneuve's Racing Vision
International Superstar Soccer 3
Description: The final game released under the ISS branding.

Title: Medal of Honor: Frontline
Description: Frontline follows the European Theater, starting with the Normandy Beach landings.

Title: Yo-Jin-Bo: The Bodyguards
Description: A  visual novel otome game set in feudal Japan.

Title: TNA iMPACT!
Description: Enter the six-sided ring and wrestle in Midway's first wrestling game from the Orlando-based TNA wrestling promotion.

Title: Simple 2000 Series Vol. 70: The Kanshikikan
Description: The first installment of what would later become a sub-series of its own, Simple 2000 Series Vol. 70: The Kanshikikan is an adventure title where players take on the role of a forensic investigator.

Title: Tantei Jinguuji Saburo: Kind of Blue
Description: The direct sequel to Innocent Black where Junguuji returns to work after a long dry period in order to investigate a certain person for the Kanto mafia.

Title: Tantei Jinguuji Saburo: Innocent Black
Description: The first Tantei Jinguuji Saburo title to be developed by WorkJam where Jinguuji is asked to search for the missing daughter of a hospital director that helped him in the past.

Title: Simple 2000 Series Vol. 43: The Saiban - Shinmai Shihoukan Momota Tsukasa no 10 no Saiban File
Description: An adventure game about a rookie female lawyer solving 10 different cases.

Title: Simple 2000 Series Vol.067: The Suiri - Soshite Daremo Inakunatta
Description: The third entry in the Suiri detective adventure game series within D3's Simple franchise.

Title: World Destruction League: Thunder Tanks
Description: A spin-off of the BattleTanx series, bringing its fast-paced tank combat to a new post-apocalyptic motorsport.

Title: Chobits: Chii Dake no Hito
Description: Playstation 2 game based on the manga and anime series Chobits.

Title: Earache: Extreme Metal Racing
Description: Use ten different vehicles to race and battle through different courses while listening to the games Death Metal soundtrack.

Title: Galaxy Angel
Description: A dating simulation / strategy game for the PS2 and PCs. There are additional games, an anime and manga and they all follow the Angel Troupe in their adventures.

Title: Okage: Shadow King
Description: Okage: Shadow King is an offbeat Japanese RPG visually inspired by the works of Henry Selick. It follows a boy and the evil king that lives in his shadow as they attempt to take over the world.

Title: Constantine
Description: Follow John Constantine as he fights to save humanity, save the earth and save his own soul.

Title: Lumines Plus
Description: Lumines Plus is the home console port of Lumines: Puzzle Fusion and Lumines II. This release brings puzzles from both games into one package.

Title: Ys V: Lost Kefin, Kingdom of Sand
Description: 3D re-imagining of Falcom's Ys V by Taito, exclusively available for the PS2.

Title: Sonic Unleashed
Description: Sonic Unleashed is two different Sonic titles released in 2008 across four consoles. Both titles feature high-speed Sonic stages, slower-paced "Werehog" levels, and town hubs where players must progress through the story.

Title: Madagascar: Escape 2 Africa
Description: Return as Alex, Marty, Melman and Gloria as they crash and they make themselves at home in Africa in Madagascar: Escape 2 Africa

Title: Up
Description: THQ's youth-oriented adaptation of the Disney/Pixar film of the same name.

Title: Shining Wind
Description: Shining Wind is the 18th game in the Shining series from SEGA.

Title: ADK Damashii
Description: ADK Tamashii is a compilation of five ADK games.

Title: Dora the Explorer: Dora Saves the Snow Princess
Description: Platformer featuring Dora the explorer.

Title: Dora the Explorer: Dora Saves the Mermaids
Description: Dora the Explorer ventures over land and sea to help save the mermaid kingdom from a mean, garbage-dumping octopus.  Meet tons of Dora's pals along the way and platform your way through this kid-friendly adventure.

Title: Medal of Honor: Rising Sun
Description: Medal of Honor Rising Sun moves away from Europe and into Asia where the enemy changes from the Nazis to the Japanese.

Title: Galerians: Ash
Description: Galerians: Ash is the sequel to Galerians that is an horror-survival game.

Title: Kenran Butou Sai: The Mars Daybreak
Description: An Alfa System and Sony Computer Entertainment PlayStation 2 exclusive simulation game.

Title: Destroy All Humans!
Description: An open-world game spoofing 1950s sci-fi films. The player is an alien named Crypto who comes to Earth with the express purpose of wiping out the human race.

Title: Bully
Description: Rockstar swaps gangsters for delinquents in their open-world formula, giving players control of a new student at a rough-and-tumble private school.

Title: Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer
Description: Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer follows a closer look into the movie, including chases with the Silver Surfer and fights with Dr. Doom. It also contains extra missions including finding scientists to save the world. It allows four player to each control a member of the Fantastic Four.

Title: Tear Ring Saga: Berwick Saga
Description: The second and last entry in the Tear Ring Saga strategy RPG franchise.

Title: Hanjuku Eiyuu 4
Description: The 4th installment of the Hanjuku Eiyuu series.

Title: Hanjuku Eiyuu Tai 3D
Description: The 3rd installment of the Hanjuku Eiyuu series.

Title: SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.6: Puzzle & Action + Bonanza Bros.
Description: A remastering of two Sega classics starring Mobo & Robo.

Title: Tokimeki Memorial Girl's Side
Description: The first game in the series of otome dating sims that brought many new fans to the genre.

Title: LEGO Indiana Jones: The Original Adventures
Description: Take control of Indiana Jones and play through the first three original films, Lego style!

Title: Toy Story 3: The Video Game
Description: Players take control of Buzz, Woody, and Jessie as they explore the world of Toy Story and much more.

Title: Cue Club
Description: A pool/snooker game.

Title: LEGO Star Wars: The Video Game
Description: A family-friendly video game adaptation of the Star Wars prequel trilogy, styled in the LEGO Star Wars line of toys.

Title: Sakura Taisen 3: Pari wa Moete iru ka?
Description: The third entry in the venerable series ventures to a new city, a new console, and a new dimension.

Title: Hardware: Online Arena
Description: A multiplayer vehicular-combat game for the PS2. It was featured as a free pack-in game with the Playstation 2 network adapter.

Title: Tokyo Xtreme Racer 3
Description: Tokyo Xtreme Racer 3 is the fourth installment of this Japan-based street racing series.

Title: Aggressive Inline
Description: Aggressive Inline takes the gameplay of the Tony Hawk series and applies it to inline skating, adding in an innovative skill progression system for good measure.

Title: SpongeBob SquarePants: Lights, Camera, Pants!
Description: SpongeBob and friends compete for the role of the villain in the new Mermaid Man and Barnacle Boy movie.

Title: The King of Fighters 2000
Description: The seventh installment of SNK's King of Fighters series and the last game they developed before their bankruptcy. It features an expansion of the "Striker" system, including numerous Striker-only characters for additional options.

Title: The King of Fighters '99
Description: The King of Fighters '99 is the sixth installment of the King of Fighters series, introducing new gameplay mechanics such as the "Striker" system. It also introduces a new protagonist, K', as well as a new, darker story arc involving the mysterious cartel called NESTS.

Title: Hyper Street Fighter II: The Anniversary Edition
Description: Mix-and-match your favorite versions of the Street Fighter II cast to create new dream matches in this special 15th anniversary edition of the arcade classic.

Title: Tony Hawk's Project 8
Description: Tony Hawk's Project 8 was the first game in the Tony Hawk series built from the ground up for 7th generation of consoles. The game introduced the Nail-The-Trick mechanic and added graphical details like Bloom HDR lighting and ragdoll physics.

Title: Fatal Frame
Description: Although not actually based on a true story, as the misleading packaging claims, Fatal Frame is still a beloved horror game in which a camera is the player's only weapon against malevolent spirits.

Title: The King of Fighters '97
Description: The fourth installment in SNK's tag-team fighting game series, bringing the "Orochi Saga" to its climax. It's known for introducing the short-lived "Command Mode" system, allowing players to choose from two distinct playstyles.

Title: The King of Fighters '95
Description: The second installment in SNK's tag-team fighting game series, introducing the ability for players to customize their own three-fighter team from the overall roster.

Title: The King of Fighters '96
Description: The third installment in SNK's tag-team fighting game series, further revamping the gameplay while completely redrawing all characters in a newer style.

Title: Star Wars: The Clone Wars
Description: Take control of numerous vehicles from the Star Wars prequel trilogy and aid the Galactic Republic during the Clone Wars era of Star Wars.

Title: RTL Biathlon 2009
Description: Winter biathlon game

Title: Sakura Wars: So Long, My Love
Description: The fifth game in the Sakura Taisen franchise and the first to receive an official North American localization, courtesy of NIS America.

Title: Curse: The Eye of Isis
Description: A survival horror game set in the British Museum. You play as either Dr. Darien Dane or his assistant Victoria Sutton on a search to retrieve a cursed Egyptian artifact recently stolen from the museum.

Title: Hisshou Pachinko * Pachi-Slot Kouryoku Series Vol. 3: CR Marilyn Monroe
Description: The popular sex symbol actress adorns a marine-themed pachi-slot game.

Title: The Backyardigans: Mission to Mars
Description: Calling all astronauts! When Tyrone and Tasha receive a strange signal at Mission Control, Commander Uniqua needs you to suit up with her, Science Officer Pablo, and Equipment Specialist Austin for their mission to Mars! Help pilot the shuttle, race through a meteor shower, explore underground Martian caves, collect space gems, and more in an out-of-this-world adventure with The Backyardigans!

Title: Melty Blood: Actress Again
Description: The third installment of the Melty Blood series.

Title: Langrisser III
Description: The third entry in the Langrisser strategy RPG series which drastically changed its battle system from previous entries.

Title: Jaws: Unleashed
Description: Just like you always wanted, Jaws Unleashed grants you the opportunity to play as a shark in an open-world game.

Title: Lemmings
Description: Sony Computer Entertainment Europe and Team 17 are responsible for this PSP installment of Lemmings.

Title: Syberia II
Description: Finding the eccentric Hans Voralberg was just the beginning. Having left her old life behind, Kate Walker follows Hans on an incredible journey full of peril and wonder in this sequel to Syberia, acclaimed game by Benoît Sokal.

Title: Forty 4 Party
Description: A party game with anthropomorphic animals.

Title: Pocket Fighter
Description: A casual fighting game spin-off of the versus puzzle game Super Puzzle Fighter II Turbo, featuring super-deformed versions of numerous fighters from the Street Fighter and Darkstalkers series.

Title: Legend of Kay
Description: A Zelda-like adventure in which an anthropomorphic cat named Kay must defend his peaceful home from a vicious invading army.

Title: The Lord of the Rings: The Third Age
Description: The Lord of the Rings: The Third Age is a role-playing game depicting the adventures of the "Shadow Fellowship," a group of unknowns following in the footsteps of the Fellowship of the Ring.

Title: Hōshin Engi 2
Description: The sequel to Koei's PlayStation tactical RPG Hōshin Engi.

Title: Mystic Heroes
Description: A Koei hack and slasher with superdeformed characters.  Characters can augment their powers with elemental forces in one player, or two player simultaneous co-op.

Title: Postman Pat
Description: Postman Pat for PS2 and DS

Title: Club Football 2005
Description: Club Football 2005 is the most recent release of Codemaster's Club Football series and was released in 16 different versions

Title: Brunswick Pro Bowling
Description: Join three friends in 10 real bowling locations and journey from amateur to tour pro.

Title: The Mini-Skirt Police
Description: Japan only game starring a female mini skirt wearing police officer.

Title: Arcana Heart 2
Description: The full-fledged sequel to the all-girl fighting game Arcana Heart, featuring revamped gameplay and new fighters and Arcanas to choose from.

Title: Amagami
Description: Amagami is a Japan-only dating sim developed by Enterbrain that was initially released for the PlayStation 2 in 2009 and subsequently ported to the PSP and Vita. Taking place over the course of six weeks, players are tasked with strategically managing their schedules to attain one of more than two dozen endings with the game's six main heroines.

Title: Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell: Double Agent
Description: One of two versions of Splinter Cell: Double Agent.  While both generally follow the same story, the two have vital differences in gameplay and overall structure.

Title: Conflict: Desert Storm II: Back to Baghdad
Description: This strategic action game follows a four-man squad of SAS or Delta Force troops on missions through Iraq during the Gulf war.

Title: Freestyle MetalX
Description: Freestyle MetalX is a Free Roaming, Trick Based MotoCross Game.

Title: Kingdom Hearts II
Description: The third installment in the Kingdom Hearts franchise following after Kingdom Hearts: Chain of Memories, known for its successful combination of Disney and Final Fantasy franchises into a believable plot.

Title: Astérix & Obélix XXL 2: Mission: Las Vegum
Description: Asterix & Obelix XXL 2: Mission: Las Vegum takes the cultural references and self-referential themes of the comics and applies them to video games. Dozens of familiar franchises, characters, sights and sounds appear as players explore Julius Caesar's Las Vegum resort. See it for yourself before the copyright lawyers do!

Title: Titeuf Mega Party
Description: A party game based on the license of a Swiss comic book. Released initially in 2004, a remastered port also saw light in 2019.

Title: The Godfather: The Game
Description: Become the Don by extorting businesses, racketeering, whacking rivals and starting gang wars across the whole of New York City. Welcome to the family.

Title: Sakura Taisen: Atsuki Chishio Ni
Description: A Playstation 2 remake of the first entry in the Sakura Taisen series, using updated game mechanics introduced in 3 and 4.

Title: Trizeal
Description: A 2004 vertical-scrolling shoot-'em-up featuring aircraft that can be transformed on-the-fly for different abilities.

Title: Scooby-Doo: Mystery Mayhem
Description: Mystery Mayhem is a multi-platform release featuring the cartoon detectives and their favorite canine coward.

Title: Gallop Racer Inbreed
Description: Racing inbred horses!?! idk

Title: Gallop Racer 2006
Description: The 2006 iteration of Tecmo's longstanding horse racing simulation.

Title: Gallop Racer 2004
Description: The 2004 entry in Tecmo's longstanding Horse Racing Simulation series.

Title: Gallop Racer 2003: A New Breed
Description: Tecmo's horse racing franchise brings over 2500 new steeds and 30 tracks to this installment.

Title: Shellshock: Nam '67
Description: Shellshock: Nam '67 is a third-person shooter set during the Vietnam War from the developers of Killzone.

Title: Driven
Description: Race CART cars just like Sly Stallone in the film of the same name.

Title: Secret Game: Killer Queen
Description: A enhanced remake of a doujin game called Killer Queen where a group of 13 people have been trapped inside an abandoned building and must participate in a game in order to survive.

Title: Missing Blue
Description: Masamura Kouji leads a normal live until one day a transfer student arrives at his high school and hands him a mysterious crystal.

Title: Wave Rally
Description: Wave Rally is a Jet Ski racing game for the PS2.

Title: ESPN Winter X-Games Snowboarding 2002
Description: A direct response to the first X-Games snowboarding game, 2002 tries to straddle a pick up and play feel with some simulation mechanics built on top.

Title: Space Channel 5: Part 2
