Description: This sequel to the Dreamcast cult classic delivers 60s sci-fi style in spades. Funky space reporter Ulala delivers her trademark dance grooves while saving the galaxy from the dastardly Rhythm Rogues!

Title: Ai Yori Aoshi
Description: A visual novel based on the anime of the same name. The name Ai Yori Aoshi comes from the quote "Blue comes from indigo, yet is bluer than indigo", meaning that people surpass their teachers through their own efforts.

Title: Fukakutei Sekai no Tantei Shinshi: Akugyou Futaasa no Jiken File
Description: PlayStation 2 port of Fukakutei Sekai no Tantei Shinshi featuring an additional scenario.

Title: TransWorld SURF
Description: Transworld Surf is a surfing game comparable to the Tony Hawk's Pro Skater series, but for surfing. The player can choose from a number of surfers and various spots around the world to test their surfing skills.

Title: Top Gun: Combat Zones
Description: Top Gun: Combat Zones is an arcade flight simulator released on the PS2, PC and later GameCube by Titus.

Title: Test Drive: Le Mans
Description: Test Drive: Le Mans puts you behind the wheel of real-life racing machines and lets you tackle the legendary "24 Hours of Le Mans" race.

Title: Robin Hood: Defender of the Crown
Warhammer 40,000: Fire Warrior
Description: A first-person shooter set in the Warhammer 40,000 universe. Follow a Tau Fire Warrior named Kais during a 24 hour period as he battles Imperial and Chaos forces to rescue the kidnapped Ethereal.

Title: Freaky Flyers
Description: Freaky Flyers is a mascot-style racing game that puts characters into tiny, cartoonish planes with power-ups that can help turn the tide of a race.

Title: Party Carnival
Description: Party game for PS2. Sequel of Forty 4 Party.

Title: Final Fantasy X-2
Description: Journey back to Spira two years later to rescue the missing Tidus in this first direct sequel to a Final Fantasy title.

Title: Syberia
Description: Kate Walker, a successful lawyer, travels to find Hans, the sole heir to a factory and eventually ends up on a journey to find him and the once thought to be extinct Mammoths.

Title: Grand Theft Auto: Liberty City Stories
Description: Grand Theft Auto: Liberty City Stories is the first of the "Stories" series where you play in Liberty City as Toni Cipriani. It was originally released exclusively on the PlayStation Portable (PSP), but was ported to the PlayStation 2 in the following year.

Title: Zero4 Champ Series: Drift Champ
Description: The final installment in the Zero4 Champ franchise which focuses more on drifting rather than drag racing.

Title: Dr. Seuss' The Cat in the Hat
Description: A video game based on the 2003 film adaptation of Dr. Seuss's The Cat in the Hat.

Title: Disney's Stitch: Experiment 626
Description: A video game tie-in (and prequel) to the 2002 film Lilo & Stitch, Experiment 626 follows the blue creature of the same name as he causes rampant destruction throughout the galaxy.

Title: Project: Snowblind
Description: Originally developed as a third game in the Deus Ex series. Project: Snowblind is a futuristic sci-fi first person shooter featuring numerous futuristic weapons and abilities.

Title: Hermina to Culus: Lillie no Atelier Mou Hitotsu no Monogatari
Description: A visual novel set in Atelier universe.

Title: .hack//OUTBREAK - Part 3
Description: .hack//OUTBREAK is a role-playing game that simulates being an MMORPG. It is the third game in the .hack series.

Title: Rez
Description: Rez is a musical on-rails shooter that blurs the line between user input and audio/visual feedback, creating a unique sensory experience.

Title: Derby Stallion 04
Description: Derby Stallion 04 is the first Derby Stallion and only game on PlayStation 2.

Title: Bass Landing 3
Description: The final installment of the Bass Landing series on Playstation 2.

Title: Fushigi no Umi no Nadia - Inherit the Blue Water
Description: Fushigi no Umi no Nadia - Inherit the Blue Water is a visual novel based on the Nadia: The Secret of Blue Water anime series.

Title: Kao the Kangaroo Round 2
Description: Sequel to KAO the Kangaroo on the Dreamcast, Kao the Kangaroo Round 2 features familiar 3D platforming, charming visuals and soundtrack

Title: Shifters
Description: Shifters is a third-person action-adventure game from 3DO for the PlayStation 2.

Title: Jade Cocoon 2
Description: Jade Cocoon 2 is the PS2 sequel to the original on the PS1. Collect and raise monsters to battle alongside you, the player, in the hopes of stopping the Kalma invasion.

Title: Keroro Gunsou: MeroMero Battle Royale
Description: Characters from the Keroro Gunsou anime/manga franchise battle it out in this 4-player PlayStation 2 game published by Bandai in 2004.

Title: Extermination
Description: Extermination attempted to take the more ardent concepts of previous survival-horror titles and fuse them with the boiled direction of an action movie.

Title: Legacy of Kain: Defiance
Description: The final chapter in the Legacy of Kain series, this game follows the adventures of Kain and Raziel in their struggles to save Nosgoth from an ancient enemy.

Title: Metal Gear 2: Solid Snake
Description: Originally released for the Japan-exclusive MSX2 in 1990, this sequel is set four years after the Outer Heaven incident. New FOXHOUND commander, Roy Campbell, brings a shell-shocked Solid Snake back from early retirement to infiltrate the military nation Zanzibar Land.

Title: Final Fantasy XII
Description: The last Final Fantasy game released on the PS2, Final Fantasy XII is distinguished by its condition-driven "gambit" battle system, its Monster Hunter-like open environments and side quests, and its setting in the existing fictional universe of Ivalice.

Title: Heavy Metal Thunder
Description: The game pits futuristic robots against one another in wrestling matches. The player controls a robot during battles using a four-icon menu. Three actions—strike, guard and grapple—can be executed at any time and augments the player's "beat meter".

Title: Pro Yakyū Team o Tsukurou! 3
Description: The final PS2 entry in the Pro Yakyū Team o Tsukurou! series.

Title: Pro Yakyū Team o Tsukurou! 2003
Description: An updated roster game in the PS2 Pro Yakyū Team o Tsukurou! entries.

Title: Pro Yakyū Team o Tsukurou! 2
Description: The first proper sequel to Pro Yakyū Team o Tsukurou!

Title: V8 Supercars 2
Description: V8 Supercars 2 is a derivative of the TOCA Race Driver 2 game that was released in Australia and New Zealand. It contains all of the tracks from the 2004 V8 Supercars championship including Bathurst and Surfers Paradise.

Title: Taikō Risshiden IV
Description: Yet another feudal Japan tactics game from Koei.

Title: SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.15: Decathlete Collection
Description:
Remake of three titles in one: Decathlete, Winter Heat, and Virtua Athlete 2K.
Part of the Sega Ages 2500 series for the PS2

Title: SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.32: Phantasy Star Complete Collection
Description: The Sega Ages compilation of all the pre-PSO Phantasy Star games.

Title: Sega Ages 2500 Series Vol. 33: Fantasy Zone Complete Collection
Description: Sega Ages 2500 Series Vol. 33: Fantasy Zone Complete Collection collects the entire Fantasy Zone series into one place.

Title: Generation of Chaos
Description: The first in the Generation of Chaos series.

Title: Generation of Chaos Next
Description: The second game in the Generation of Chaos series.

Title: Generation of Chaos III
Description: Generation of Chaos III is the sequel to Generation of Chaos Next.

Title: Shinten Makai: Generation of Chaos V
Description: Generation of Chaos' numbered entries return to the PlayStation 2 for the fifth installment.

Title: Generation of Chaos: Desire
Description: Generation of Chaos: Desire is a 2007 release in the Generation of Chaos series for PlayStation 2.

Title: XGRA: Extreme G Racing Association
Description: XGRA: Extreme G Racing Association is a futuristic, weapon-based racing game, similar to F-Zero and the WipEout franchises.

Title: Starsky & Hutch
Description: Starsky & Hutch is a driving and shooting game based upon the legendary television show of the 1970's.

Title: Real Madrid: The Game
Description: Real Madrid: The Game is the official game of Real Madrid football club.

Title: Let's Ride: Silver Buckle Stables
Description: Train horses and compete in competitions in this horse riding simulation.

Title: SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.20: Space Harrier 2 - Space Harrier Complete Collection
Description: A compilation of various versions of Space Harrier, as well as Space Harrier 3D (Master System) and Space Harrier II (Sega Genesis/Mega Drive).

Title: Gofungo no Sekai: Five Minutes from nowhere
Description: A sound novel developed by Media Factory based off the book of the same name written by Ryu Murakami.

Title: ESPN International Winter Sports 2002
Description: ESPN International Winter Sports 2002 is an ESPN-branded winter multi-sports game. In Japan, it was branded with Konami's Hyper Sports name.

Title: SuperLite 2000: Mahjong
Description: Success' SuperLite mahjong game.

Title: Mahjong Haoh: Shinken Battle
Description: The fourth Mahjong Haoh release.

Title: Mahjong Haoh: Taikai Battle
Description: The third Mahjong Haoh title.

Title: Mana Khemia: Alchemists of Al-Revis
Description: Mana Khemia is the 9th entry in the Atelier series. The game is a quest based RPG where players adventure on various missions to complete the game. Unlike the ordinary classic style RPG, alchemy is the main focus of the game, meaning players will discover and create items and weapons.

Title: Manhunt 2
Description: The ruthless, stealth-action series returns for a second installment.

Title: Sega Genesis Collection
Description: This collection includes 28 Sega Genesis / Mega Drive games on one budget-priced disc.

Title: Silent Hill: 0rigins
Description: Enter Silent Hill for the first time, as redneck trucker Travis Grady explores the haunted town and discovers how true evil began.

Title: SNK Arcade Classics V.1
Description: A handful of SNK's Neo-Geo games comprise this new collection for PlayStation 2, PSP, and Wii.

Title: Growlanser: Wayfarer of Time
Description: The fourth game in the Growlanser series which takes place in a separate world with a stand-alone story.

Title: Namco x Capcom
Description: A strategic role-playing game that features characters from various Namco and Capcom games, such as Tekken, Soul Calibur, Ghosts 'n Goblins, and Mega Man Legends.

Title: Sky Odyssey
Description: Sky Odyssey is an action/adventure flight simulator developed by Cross and published by Activision for the Playstation 2. In the game, players fly through the levels in multiple types of aircraft collecting different items and performing certain challenges.

Title: Shaman King: Funbari Spirits
Description: A cel-shaded fighter based in the Shaman King universe.

Title: Capcom Classics Collection: Volume 2
Description: Another set of classic Capcom games for the PlayStation 2 and Xbox.

Title: Xena  Warrior Princess
Description: 3D action game based on the fantasy TV-series. Xena's best friend Gabrielle must be rescued from the magic citadel. Released only as PAL version for the PS2.

Title: Planetarian: The Reverie of a Little Planet
Description: Planetarian is a Japanese post-apocalyptic visual novel developed by Key and released for PC over the internet on November 29, 2004.

Title: Kuon no Kizuna: Sairinshou
Description: An enhanced port of Kuon no Kizuna initially released for the Dreamcast and later other platforms.

Title: Shirachuu Tankenbu
Description: An adventure game about a group of friends that return to their favorite summer vacation spot as they recall their past.

Title: Onimusha 2: Samurai's Destiny
Description: Return to Sengoku-era Japan and battle the demon forces of Nobunaga Oda as new warrior Jubei in this expanded sequel, which also adds a friendship system that can unlock extra story scenes and playable characters.

Title: Sakura Taisen Monogatari: Mysterious Paris
Description: An adventure game spin-off to the Sakura Taisen series staring a Japanese detective that comes to Paris to visit his sister but becomes involved in a mystery with the cast of Sakura Taisen 3.

Title: Rebel Raiders: Operation Nighthawk
Description: Rebel Raiders: Operation Nighthawk is a futuristic aerial combat game.  The game takes place in the distant future where human beings have conquered the solar system.

Title: Fuuraiki 2
Description: The sequel to Fuuraiki for the PlayStation 2 about a photographer on assignment in Okinawa.

Title: Rim Runners
Description: A sci-fi adventure game developed by FOG about the comedic misadventures of a novices space pilot trying to do his job at an intergalactic shipping company on the verge of bankruptcy.

Title: Naraku no Shiro Ichiyanagi Nagomu, Nidome no Junan
Description: The sequel to Amagoushi no Yakata.

Title: Call of Duty: World at War
Description: The fifth installment of the Call of Duty series, bringing most of the gameplay and graphical improvements of Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare back to World War II conflict. It is also the first Call of Duty game set in the Pacific Theater.

Title: Amagoushi no Yakata
Description: Amagoushi no Yakata is an adventure game by Fog.

Title: Taiko no Tatsujin: Atsumare! Matsuri da!! Yondaime
Description: Released on July 22, 2004, this is the fifth entry in the Taiko no Tatsujin series for PlayStation 2. It features 40 songs, an updated graphics engine, and the introduction of the Don Point system for unlockables.

Title: Taiko no Tatsujin: Go! Go! Godaime
Description: Released on December 9, 2004, this is the sixth release in the Taiko no Tatsujin series for PlayStation 2. This version includes 45 songs, new gameplay modifiers, as well as the new Go-Go Mode featured in certain songs.

Title: Taiko no Tatsujin: Wai Wai Happy! Rokudaime
Description: Released on December 8, 2005, this is the ninth release in the Taiko no Tatsujin series on PlayStation 2. The track list includes an impressive 48 songs along with brand new note speed and sudden death modifiers.

Title: Taiko no Tatsujin: Doka! to Oomori Nanadaime
Description: Released on December 7, 2006, this is the tenth and final release for PlayStation 2 in the Taiko no Tatsujin series. It features an expansive track list of 48 songs, adds the Reverse modifier, and includes the brand new Waku Waku Bouken Land adventure mode.

Title: Taiko no Tatsujin: Appare Sandaime
Description: Released on October 30, 2003, this is the third home console release in the Taiko no Tatsujin series. It features 39 songs, three new mini-games, and is the last version to include the traditional Arcade Mode.

Title: Taiko no Tatsujin: Doki! Shinkyoku Darake no Haru Matsuri
Description: Released on March 27, 2003, this is the second home console release in the Taiko no Tatsujin series. It features an arcade mode with 34 songs, as well as new mini-games and an improved Safari Mode.

Title: Taiko no Tatsujin: Tobikkiri! Anime Special
Description: Released on August 4, 2005, this is the second anime compilation of the PlayStation 2 Taiko no Tatsujin games, and the eighth PlayStation 2 release in the series overall. It features a track list of 40 songs with gameplay similar to that of the rest of the series.

Title: Taiko no Tatsujin: Waku Waku Anime Matsuri
Description: Released on December 18, 2003, this is the first of two anime compilations among the PlayStation 2 Taiko no Tatsujin games, and the fourth PlayStation 2 release in the series overall. It features a track list of 19 songs with gameplay similar to that of the rest of the series.

Title: Taiko no Tatsujin: Tatacon de Dodon ga Don
Description: Released on October 24, 2002, this is the first ever home console release in the Taiko no Tatsujin series, coming bundled with a Tatacon drum controller to replicate the arcade experience. It features an arcade mode with 30 songs, and introduces many console-exclusive features that would be included and expanded upon in later titles, including mini-games, custom drum sounds, and auto-play.

Title: Blood: The Last Vampire - First Volume
Description: The first volume of a two part full motion adventure game based off Blood: The Last Vampire. Both parts are the 6th installment of the Yarudora series.

Title: Kingdom Hearts
Description: A unique mix of Disney and Square Enix characters join spiky-haired hero Sora on his epic journey to save multiple worlds from the evil of the Heartless and find his lost friends Riku and Kairi.

Title: Realize
Description: A visual novel developed by Takahashi Tatsuya and Minazuki Tooru, two key figures that created the Leaf Visual Novel Series.

Title: TimeSplitters
Description: A launch title for the PS2, TimeSplitters is a fast-paced time-traveling first-person shooter from the team behind Rare's GoldenEye 007.

Title: The Last Blade
Description: SNK's spiritual successor to their Samurai Shodown series, taking place during mid-19th century Japan.

Title: Lara Croft Tomb Raider: The Angel of Darkness
Description: The Angel of Darkness is the sixth game in the Tomb Raider series, and the first for the PlayStation 2. It features a lot of design differences and is widely considered the weakest game in the series.

Title: Jak 3
Description: Jak is left stranded in the desert by the last counciller of Haven City and is now on a quest for revenge and redemption.

Title: Armored Core: Formula Front - Extreme Battle
Description: An Armored Core architecture and team management game for PlayStation 2 and PSP.

Title: Winning Post 5
Description: Winning Post 5 is a horse racing simulator for Koei, developed for the PlayStation 2.

Title: Baldr Force
Description: Baldr Force is a visual novel with 2D action gameplay set in a cyberpunk future.

Title: Otona no Gal Jan 2
Description: Second entry in a series of mahjong titles where the player versus various idols in a game of mahjong

Title: D.N.A.: Dark Native Apostle
Description: 3D action adventure game for the PS2, inspired by Bomberman and heavily influenced by comic books

Title: Reveal Fantasia
Description: A fantasy role-playing game developed by Infinity and released for the PlayStation 2.

Title: Brave: The Search for Spirit Dancer
beatmania IIDX 12 HAPPY SKY
Description: The 12th game in the IIDX series.

Title: Yamasa Digi World 3
Description: Yamasa's digital slot machine compilation series continues with a third installment.

Title: Psikyo Shooting Collection Vol. 3: Sol Divide & Dragon Blaze
Description: A Japanese compilation of a top-down bullet hell shooter and an adventure game.

Title: SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.21: SDI & Quartet -SEGA SYSTEM 16 COLLECTION-
Description: Three arcade classics from Sega on one PlayStation 2 release.

Title: SEGA AGES 2500 Vol. 25: Gunstar Heroes Treasure Box
Description: A compilation of three Treasure-developed Sega classics.

Title: SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.23: SEGA Memorial Selection
Description: A compilation of five Sega arcade classics for PlayStation 2, with remakes included.

Title: Metal Slug Anthology
Description: Blast your way through jungle infested, nazi-esque worlds in this compilation of the Metal Slug franchise.  Includes every arcade Metal Slug game, which makes this game Metal Slug 6's Western debut.

Title: Gunvari Collection + Time Crisis
Description: Gunvari Collection + Time Crisis pairs the full Point Blank trilogy with the original Time Crisis.

Title: Rockman: Power Battle Fighters
Description: Ports of the arcade versions of Mega Man: The Power Battle and The Power Fighters.

Title: Growlanser Generations
Description: A compilation by Working Designs of Growlanser II and III for the PS2.

Title: PopCap Hits! Vol 2
Description: A second disc of PopCap classics for PlayStation 2.

Title: PopCap Hits! Vol 1
Description: Two of PopCap's classics on PlayStation 2.

Title: Tecmo Hit Parade
Description: A collection of seven Tecmo arcade classics for PlayStation 2.

Title: Jissen Pachi-Slot Hisshouhou! Selection
Description: A virtual slots game for the PlayStation 2 that simulates three pachi-slot machines: Salaryman Kintarou, Slotter Kintarou, and Ore no Sora.

Title: Biker Mice from Mars
Description: A 2006 PlayStation 2 game developed by Creat Studios.

Title: Disgaea: Hour of Darkness
Description: Disgaea: Hour of Darkness is a tactical role-playing game for the PlayStation 2, which focuses on the story of Prince Laharl as he aims to become the Overlord of the Netherworld.

Title: Taisen Hot Gimmick: Cosplay-Jan
Description: The first Taisen Hot Gimmick game to hit consoles (outside of the Capcom crossover Taisen Net Gimmick).

Title: Fantasy Zone II: The Tears of Opa-Opa
Description: The sequel to the cartoonish Sega Arcade shoot-em-up Fantasy Zone.

Title: Ace Combat 5: The Unsung War
Description: Ace Combat 5: The Unsung War is an arcade flight combat game. Escalating hostilities between the nation of Osea and its neighbor across the Pacific Ocean, Yuktobania, culminate in all out war between the two nations. The pilots of Wardog Squadron fight to restore peace between the embattled nations.

Title: The Nightmare of Druaga: Fushigino dungeon
The Bible Game
Description: A Christian-themed quiz game and minigame collection.

Title: The Italian Job
Description: A racing game which follows the 2003 film.

Title: DrumMania
Description: The first game which made it's debut along with GuitarFreaks 2ndMIX in 1999. It started with 12 songs, plus eleven more songs via Session Link, a new mode to play between GuitarFreaks 2ndMIX.

Title: Hayarigami: Toshi Densetsu Kaii Jiken
Description: The first game in Nippon Ichi's series of urban legend themed visual novel adventure games, where the player steps into the role of a young police detective who must solve a series of mysterious cases.

Title: Higanbana
Description: A sound novel developed by Sammy for the PlayStation 2.

Title: Kaerazu no Mori
Description: Horror sound novel only released in Japan.

Title: Critical Bullet: 7th Target
Description: Critical Bullet: 7th Target is a 2002 action/adventure game developed by Flagship and published by Capcom released only in Japan. The game is the sequel to Bounty Hunter Sara (which was also only released in Japan).

Title: Akagawa Jirou Mystery: Tsuki no Hikari - Shizumeru Kane no Satsujin
Description: A sound novel based off Akagawa Jirou's book called Shizumeru Kane no Satsujin.

Title: Mega Man X Collection
Description: A collection of the first six games of the Mega Man X series, as well as Megaman: Battle and Chase, which had never previously been released in North America.

Title: Saishuu Densha
Description: A sound novel developed by Break about a business man that boards the last train for the night but soon finds that the train isn't making any stops and that a mysterious monster is aboard. He must now work together with a female teacher and a young boy to survive the night.

Title: Shin Master of Monsters Final EX
Description: Final installment of the series Master of Monsters.

Title: Michigan: Report from Hell
Description: Take the role of a cameraman in a news team set out to investigate a horrific monster invasion in Chicago.

Title: Tomb Raider: Underworld
Description: With an improved graphics engine, Lara Croft is back and is looking better than ever. This time around she'll be going on an adventure to find the sacred Mayan underworld of Xibalba in Southern Mexico.

Title: Dead or Alive 2
Description: The first sequel to Tecmo's signature 3D fighting game series, Dead or Alive 2 features an improved visual style and new multi-tiered environments (filled with their own unique hazards and sizes).

Title: DJ Hero
Description: FreeStyleGames' DJ Hero uses a turntable controller to bring Guitar Hero-like gameplay to more genres and styles of music.

Title: The Mice Police
Description: It's got mice in it? I don't know.

Title: Raw Danger
Description: In 2010, catastrophe strikes the city of Del Ray as the levees that protect the municipality fail and the Cascade Lake begins to drown the city.

Title: WWE SmackDown! vs. RAW 2006
Description: With the introduction of new features and the refinement of older ones, SvR '06 still stands as one of the most enjoyable games in the series.

Title: The War of Genesis Side Story: Rhapsody of Zephyr
Tokimeki Memorial Girl's Side: 2nd Kiss
Description: The second game in Konami's popular franchise of otome dating sims. It was originally released for PS2 as "2nd Kiss," and later received an enhanced release on the DS as "2nd Season."

Title: Shin Gouketsuji Ichizoku: Bonnou no Kaihou
Description: An updated Japan-exclusive version of Matrimelee for the PlayStation 2.

Title: Tokimeki Memorial 2: Music Video Clips: Circus de Ai Imashou
Description: A mini-game collection themed around circus events that can be played to unlock video clips featuring girls from Tokimeki Memorial 2.

Title: Daemon Summoner
Description: A rush-job first person shooter for the PS2 in which you play a vampire hunter, published by Midas Interactive. It was made in three months.

Title: Monsters, Inc. Scream Team
Description: A 3D plaformer that is a prequel to the Disney/Pixar movie.

Title: Shinjuku no Okami
Description: A crime-fighting action game for the Playstation 2, exclusive to Japan.

Title: Ar tonelico II: Melody of Metafalica
Description: Ar Tonelico II: Melody of Metafalica is the sequel to Ar tonelico: Melody of Elemia and takes place around one and a half years after the original.

Title: Panzer Dragoon
Description: The player is called by a mysterious dragon to destroy an empire that is unlocking ancient powers it cannot comprehend.

Title: Gadget & the Gadgetinis
Description: An Europe-exclusive PS2 game based on the animated show of the same name (itself a spin-off of the mid-'80s Inspector Gadget series).

Title: Ape Escape 3
Description: In Ape Escape 3, you can try to stop another attempt by Specter and his evil monkeys to rule the world. Use nets and other weapons to capture  monkeys.

Title: Superman Returns
Description: Superman Returns is an open world tie-in to the film. It features story missions based on saving the city of Metropolis, and 80 square miles of free roaming goodness. Also, the final boss battle is a tornado.

Title: Jeopardy!
Description: Quiz game based on the popular quiz show Jeopardy! Hosted by Alex Trebek

Title: The King of Fighters Collection: The Orochi Saga
Description: This compilation contains The King of fighters '94 through '98.

Title: Wild Arms 5
Description: The fifth entry of the Wild Arms franchise developed by Media Vision for the PlayStation 2.

Title: Kikou Souhei Armodyne
Description: A late generation Sony Computer Entertainment published PlayStation 2 mech based strategy game

Title: The Simpsons: Hit & Run
Description: It's up to the Simpsons cast to save Springfield in this open-world driving game.

Title: Boku no Natsuyasumi 2: Umi no Dai Bouken
Description: An adventure game following the summer vacation of 9 year old Boku that is the second game in the Boku no Natsuyasumi franchise.

Title: Suikoden V
Description: The fifth game in the Suikoden series. Set six years before Suikoden I, the game follows the Prince of the Queendom of Falena, as he struggles to unite the 108 Stars of Destiny and end a civil war that threatens to tear the realm apart.

Title: DICE - DNA Intergrated Cybernetic Enterprises
Description: Game based off the DICE TV show.  DICE is ready for action!

Title: SEGA SuperStars
Description: Sega Superstars is an Eyetoy game for PlayStation 2 featuring 12 games to play and many popular Sega franchises including Sonic, Super Monkey Ball and Samba de Amigo.

Title: Di Gi Charat Fantasy
Description: Visual novel style game based on the manga series.

Title: Fight Club
Description: The first rule of Fight Club is: you do not talk about Fight Club.

Title: True Crime: Streets of LA
Description: Activision's open world adventure game puts players in the role of an undercover Los Angeles Cop.

Title: Mafia
Description: Mafia is a sandbox style, third-person action game set in the fictional city of Lost Heaven. The player assumes the role of Tommy Angelo as he rises through the ranks of the Mafia in Depression-era America. The game was developed by Czech developer Illusion Softworks.

Title: 4x4 Evo 2
Description: The sequel to 4x4 Evolution, 4x4 Evo 2 is an offroad racing game developed by Terminal Reality.

Title: Mahou Tsukai Kurohime
Description: Action game based on the 2002 manga series Kurohime (Magic User Kurohime).

Title: Space Harrier II
Description: The sequel to the original Space Harrier. It was also a launch title for the Mega Drive.

Title: Disaster Report
Description: Disaster Report (or SOS The Final Escape) is a survival action/adventure game where you play Keith, a newspaper editor, trying to escape a city hit by an earthquake.

Title: Red Faction II
Description: The sequel to the Geomod charged first-person shooter Red Faction, Red Faction II focuses on a military-driven storyline instead of the uprise of a lowly miner.

Title: Pinball Hall of Fame: The Gottlieb Collection
Description: Official virtual recreations of pinball machines from famed pinball table manufacturer Gottlieb.

Title: Pinball Hall of Fame: The Williams Collection
Description: Official virtual recreations of '80s-'90s pinball machines from famed pinball table manufacturer Williams.

Title: Nurse Witch Komugi-Chan Magical te
Description: Adventure game based on the original video animation.

Title: Pizzicato Polka: Ensa Genya
Description: Pizzicato Polka: Ensa Genya is an adventure game for the Sega Dreamcast. It is the sequel to the original PC release.

Title: Monster Hunter
Description: Monster Hunter is an action-RPG for the PlayStation 2 in which you play as a Hunter who hunts reptilian monsters.

Title: Gaelic Games: Football 2
Description: Gaelic Games: Football 2 is the second game in the Gaelic Games franchise. It was launched on November 7th 2007. It was launched beside Gaelic Games: Hurling

Title: Gaelic Games: Football
Description: Gaelic Games: Football was the first Gaelic Football game released. It was released in November 2005.

Title: Bad Boys: Miami Takedown
Description: Bad Boys: Miami Takedown is a game based on the popular movie starring Will Smith and Martin Lawrence.

Title: Princess Maker 5
Description: Play as a mother or a father as you care for an adopted princess until she reaches her 18th birthday.

Title: Terra Cresta
Description: A vertical-scrolling shoot-em-up from Nihon Bussan, created originally for the Arcades and later ported to various home systems. It features a power-up system that causes the player's ship to change its appearance.

Title: Tak and the Power of Juju
Description: Tak and the Power of Juju was the flagship title in the Tak franchise.  As Tak, the player embarks on a whimsical platforming adventure to bring peace to the Pupanunu people.

Title: High Heat Major League Baseball 2003
Description: The 2003 season game in the High Heat series.

Title: B-Boy
Description: Players aim to establish themselves as a world-renowned b-boy or b-girl in this breakdancing game for PlayStation platforms.

Title: Sea World: Shamu's Deep Sea Adventures
Description: Based around the lovable Shamu from SeaWorld.

Title: FIFA Soccer 2004
Description: Fifa 2004 lets you "Create Brilliance" with its exclusive "Off the Ball" Control System.

Title: Eighteen Wheeler: American Pro Trucker
Description: An arcade semi-truck racing game, 18 Wheeler's success brought console ports and an eventual spiritual successor.

Title: WTA Tour Tennis
Description: A game from Konami with licensing from the Women's Tennis Association.

Title: Lotus Challenge
Description: Multi-platform Lotus licensed racing game from Kuju interactive, most notable for it's attempt at an innovative control system.

Title: Top Angler: Real Bass Fishing
Description: A fishing game for the GameCube and PlatStation 2

Title: Captain Tsubasa
Description: The only Captain Tsubasa game released for the PlayStation 2.

Title: NHL 2003
Description: NHL 2003 didn't introduce many new features, unlike its successor NHL 2004. However, it did introduce the new GameBreaker mode which allowed a player to build up momentum by winning fights, scoring goals or by landing a big hit.

Title: Whirl Tour
Description: In Whirl Tour, players play as Wasa B; A roadie on the search for the members of the band "Flipside."

Title: Monopoly Party
Description: Monopoly Party is a revamp of the classic board game that allows up to four players to play simultaneously. It has support for the classic turn-based play-style as well as a party mode where all players take turns at the same time.

Title: Choro Q Works
Description: The final Chroro Q game on the PlayStation 2.

Title: Black & Bruised
Description: Black & Bruised is a cartoon boxing game made for the Gamecube and PS2.

Title: Dokapon DX
Description: Dokapon DX is a Japan-only RPG/Board game hybrid, the first of these in the Dokapon series and appeared on the Nintendo Gamecube and Sony Playstation 2.

Title: Dokapon the World
Description: The sixth entry in the Dokapon series of RPG styled boardgames.

Title: The Baseball 2003
Description: Konami-published 2003 baseball game with the Nippon Professional Baseball license.

Title: F1 Career Challenge
Description: The EA Sports-published follow up to F1 Racing 2002. It was the last F1 game released by EA Sports.

Title: City Racer
Description: A racing game for the GameCube. All of the racing tracks are in suburbs and cities.

Title: Lupin III: Columbus no Isan wa Ake ni Somaru
Description: A Lupin III action-adventure game for PlayStation 2.

Title: Lupin III: Lupin Is Dead, Zenigata Is In Love
Description: A Lupin III action-adventure game for PS2. While game was released in Italy, it never saw a release in North America.

Title: Buffy the Vampire Slayer: Chaos Bleeds
Description: Buffy the Vampire Slayer: Chaos Bleeds is a third-person action game, released for several consoles in 2003. Chaos Bleeds lets you play as several characters from the show, in an all-new adventure written specifically for the game. Among others, Eliza Dushku and James Marsters voice their TV-characters in the game.

Title: Jimmy Neutron: Jet Fusion
Description: Platform game based on the Jet Fusion episodes of the Jimmy Neutron animated TV show.

Title: Tensai Bit-Kun: Gramon Battle
Description: Tensai Bit-Kun: Gramon Battle is a tactical role-playing video game released in 2003 only in Japan.

Title: Wallace & Gromit: The Curse of the Were Rabbit
Description: A Tie-in game to the popular Wallace & Gromit feature Film, The Curse of the Were Rabbit is a Platforming game for the PS2 and Xbox with open world elements starring the popular British claymation Characters Wallace and Gromit.

Title: Wallace & Gromit in Project Zoo
Description: Wallace & Gromit face off against Feathers McGraw, the villainous penguin, who has escaped from the penguin enclosure and taken over the Zoo.

Title: Disney's The Haunted Mansion
Description: A platform adventure based on the ride at Disneyland, and thankfully, has nothing to do with the movie starring Eddie Murphy.

Title: Monster 4x4: Masters of Metal
Description: Monster 4x4: Masters of Metal is a Monster Jam licensed monster truck game.

Title: Strike Force Bowling
Description: Strike Force Bowling is a budget bowling title for Xbox, PS2, and GameCube.

Title: Pool Paradise
Description: Archer Maclean Presents: Pool Paradise is a pool game with Jimmy White.

Title: BoBoBo~Bo Bo~BoBo: Hajike Matsuri!
Description: This is a Bo-bobo game that was released for the PS2 in 2003 by Hudson Soft.

Title: Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo: Atsumare! Taikan Bo-bobo
Description: This is a Bo-bobo game for the PS2 which uses the Eye-Toy accessory.

Title: Carmen Sandiego: The Secret of the Stolen Drums
Description: A non-educational Carmen Sandiego game, featuring stealth, platforming, and action.

Title: The Adventures of Jimmy Neutron: Boy Genius - Attack of the Twonkies
Description: This platform adventure game sees players assuming the role of Jimmy Neutron, who returns to Earth from space with a dangerous alien stowaway.

Title: Trigger Man
Description: A third-person action game that has players assuming the role of an underworld hit man caught in a war between two crime families.

Title: World Championship Poker Featuring Howard Lederer ALL IN
Description: World Championship Poker: All In (Ft. Howard Lederer) is the third installment in the World Championship Poker series.

Title: World Championship Poker 2 featuring Howard Lederer
Lemony Snicket's A Series of Unfortunate Events
Description: A platformer released across multiple platforms to accompany the release of the 2004 movie of the same name

Title: Cocoto Kart Racer
Description: Cocoto and his friends go racing through five different worlds.

Title: Zatch Bell! Mamodo Fury
Description: Zatch Bell!: Mamodo fury is a fighting game based off the popular anime Zatch Bell!

Title: Zatch Bell! Mamodo Battles
Description: A game based off the popular manga and anime series.

Title: World Series of Poker
Description: The official game of the 2005 World Series of Poker.

Title: Ed, Edd n Eddy: The Mis-Edventures
Description: Manic 3D action-adventure game based on the Cartoon Network animated series of the same name.

Title: Karaoke Revolution Party
Description: A karaoke game made to play with a group of friends.

Title: Cocoto Magic Circus
Description: Cocoto stars in a wacky shooting gallery game.

Title: Bratz: Forever Diamondz
Description: A game featuring Bratz and diamondz.

Title: Super Monkey Ball Adventure
Description: A departure from the usual obstacle courses, Super Monkey Ball Adventure has the monkeys explore a traditional 3D platformer world in their spheres.

Title: The Super Dimension Fortress Macross
Description: This action game, based on the Macross franchise, allows players to relive both the 1982 anime series and the Do You Remember Love? movie.

Title: Aero Elite: Combat Academy
Description: Fourth game in the AeroWings / Aero Dancing series.

Title: The King of Route 66
Description: The King of Route 66 is the sequel to Sega's 18 Wheeler: American Pro Trucker.

Title: Def Jam: Vendetta
Description: In Def Jam: Vendetta you fight your way through the underground street fighting world to earn money and respect.

Title: Star Wars: Super Bombad Racing
Description: Cart Racing meets Star Wars: Episode I in a merger small franchise vehicles and big franchise heads.

Title: The Secret Saturdays: Beasts of the 5th Sun
Description: Secret Saturdays: Beasts of the 5th Sun is a video game based on the Cartoon Network Series the Secret Saturdays.

Title: Yu-Gi-Oh! The Duelists of the Roses
Description: In this departure from the core gameplay aspects of the traditional Yu-Gi-Oh card game, players battle on a 7x7 grid each having a designated "Deck Leader" which is the representation of their Life Points. Players then attempt to destroy the opposing "Deck Leader" with monsters from their respective decks.

Title: Hisshō Pachinko * Pachi-Slot Kōryoku Series Vol. 9: CR Fever Captain Harlock
Description: A Captain Harlock-themed pachinko game

Title: Age of Empires II: The Age of Kings
Description: Control medieval armies and develop a bolstering economy in this genre defining strategy game.

Title: Powershot Pinball
Description: A pinball game for PlayStation 2.

Title: Perfect Ace 2: The Championships
Description: The sequel to Perfect Ace: Pro Tournament Tennis.

Title: Fruit Machine Mania
Description: A slot machine simulator for PlayStation 2.

Title: Full House Kiss
Description: An otome game from Capcom. Based on the manga.

Title: Dora's Big Birthday Adventure
Description: Help Dora find her way home in time for her birthday party.

Title: Gunbird: Special Edition
Description: Compilation disc of the two Gunbird games. Only released in Japan and Europe.

Title: Inuyasha: The Secret of the Cursed Mask
Description: A role-playing game based around anime and manga Inuyasha.

Title: InuYasha: Feudal Combat
Description: A cel-shaded team based fighting game featuring characters from the popular manga and TV show.

Title: Get Backers Dakkanoku: Ura Shinjuku Saikyou Battle
Description: A PS2 brawler based on the Get Backers anime/manga series.

Title: The King of Fighters: Maximum Impact Regulation A
Description: The final entry in the Maximum Impact sub-series brings the 3D action to arcades while adding the original series's traditional 3-on-3 gameplay.

Title: Mercenaries: Playground of Destruction
Description: Mercenaries: Playground of Destruction is a sandbox game set in a fictional North Korea which has been torn apart by a massive multinational war.

Title: Shakugan no Shana
Description: A visual novel with RPG elements based on the lightnovel/anime/manga of the same name.

Title: Garfield Lasagna World Tour
Description: The sequel to Garfield: Saving Arlene, Lasagna World Tour throws the fat, lazy tabby cat throughout the world on a treasure hunt (just so that he can get a lifetime's worth of lasagna).

Title: Sakura Taisen V Episode 0: Arano no Samurai Musume
Description: Sakura Taisen V Episode 0 is a prequel to Sakura Wars: So Long, My Love. However, unlike the other entries in the Sakura Wars series, Episode 0 is an action-adventure game, pitting players in the role of Gemini Sunrise as she and her horse Larry combat evil.

Title: CR Nettou Power Pro-kun: Pachitte Chonmage Tatsujin
Description: The first Pachitte Chonmage Tatsujin game is based on Konami's Power Pro-kun baseball series.

Title: Pachitte Chonmage Tatsujin 2: CR Jurassic Park
Description: The second Pachitte Chonmage Tatsujin game is based on the film Jurassic Park.

Title: Pachitte Chonmage Tatsujin 5: CR Kamen Rider
Description: Another pachi-slot game starring Kamen Rider.

Title: Pachitte Chonmage Tatsujin 12: Pachinko Ultraman
Description: Pachinko game featuring Ultraman.

Title: Hissatsu Pachinko Station V5: Pink Lady
Description: The fifth PS2 Hissatsu Pachinko game.

Title: Hissatsu Pachinko Station V2
Description: The second Hissatsu Pachinko game on PlayStation 2.

Title: WWF SmackDown! Just Bring It
Description: WWF SmackDown! makes the jump to the PlayStation 2 with WWF SmackDown! Just Bring It.

Title: Mark Davis Pro Bass Challenge
Description: Arcade style fishing comes to the PS2.

Title: Metropolismania
Description: Metropolismania is a city-building / tycoon title that is comparable to games like RollerCoaster Tycoon in that it requires you to build your play area from scratch.

Title: Metropolismania 2
Description: Metropolismania 2 is the sequel to the original Metropolismania, and continues in the city-building / tycoon genre by asking players to create metropolitan cities one building at a time.

Title: Reel Fishing III
Description: A 3d fishing simulator

Title: Kiwame Mahjong DX II
Description: Mahjong game for Gamecube and PlayStation 2.

Title: Pro-Mahjong Kiwame Next
Description: Pro-Mahjong Kiwame's debut on PlayStation 2

Title: FIFA Soccer 09
Description: EA Sports returns with the '09 edition of FIFA, a soccer simulation video game series. FIFA 09 features gameplay and graphic improvements from its predecessor, FIFA 08, as well as increased amount of players, leagues, and stadiums, and you have more control overall in the game.

Title: Jet de Go! 2: Let's Go by Airliner
Description: The sequel to Jet de Go!

Title: Carwash Tycoon
Description: Wash cars and build up a reputation in the carwashing business.

Title: EverQuest Online Adventures: Frontiers
Description: Frontiers is the first and only expansion to EverQuest Online Adventures. It adds a new continent, Odus, as well as a new level cap, many new quests, creatures, and items.

Title: EverQuest Online Adventures
Description: EverQuest Online Adventures was the first MMORPG for the PlayStation 2. The setting takes place 500 years prior to its PC counterpart. After over nine years of sustained support, the game was shut down on March 29, 2012.

Title: Thunderstrike: Operation Phoenix
Description: Thunderstrike: Operation Phoenix is a helicopter action game for the PlayStation 2.

Title: Army Men: Green Rogue
Description: Grab your rifle and lock 'n load as you play as a modified green plastic soldier and return to the plastic warfare.

Title: Tour de France
Description: Based on the famous race around France, Tour de France is a cycling game for PS2 and Xbox from Konami.

Title: Gitaroo Man
Description: Gitaroo Man is a rhythm game that tells the extraordinary tale of a boy as he is joined by his talking dog to do battle against space sharks, smooth talking reggae bees, UFO's and others to defeat the evil Gravillian Empire and to ultimately impress the girl.

Title: Mace Griffin: Bounty Hunter
Description: Mace Griffin Bounty Hunter is a futuristic sci-fi shooter that follows in the footsteps of previous futuristic sci-fi shooters.

Title: Cinderella
Description: Cinderella is a fantasy game from Phoenix Games

Title: Dark Cloud
Description: Released early in the life of the PlayStation 2, Dark Cloud is an RPG with traditional hack & slash gameplay, mixed with the Georama world construction system, and weapon development mechanics.

Title: WWE SmackDown! vs. RAW 2008
Description: WWE Smackdown vs. Raw 2008 is an iteration in the Smackdown vs Raw series. This version included Fighting Styles and a new struggle submission system as well as the ECW brand.

Title: Bakumatsu Roman: Gekka no Kenshi 1+2
Description: Last of Blade compilation containing Last Blade 1 and 2.

Title: Ty the Tasmanian Tiger 3: Night of the Quinkan
Description: Ty the Tasmanian Tiger 3 revolves around saving the outback from the Quinkan invaders. The third game in the Ty the Tasmanian Tiger series was also the first to be published by a company other than EA Games.

Title: Rayman 3: Hoodlum Havoc
Description: Hoodlum Havoc is a 3-D platformer from Ubisoft starring limbless hero Rayman. A hilarious story takes a few twists as Rayman sets out to stop the evil black lum Andre and his army of hoodlums.

Title: Dragon Ball Z: Budokai Tenkaichi 3
Description: The last game in the original "Budokai Tenkaichi" trilogy of fighting games based on the Dragon Ball manga and anime series, bringing the total character roster to over 140.

Title: Dragon Ball Z: Budokai Tenkaichi 2
Description: The second in the "Budokai Tenkaichi" trilogy of Dragon Ball fighting games, adding dozens of new characters and transformations (for a total roster of 120).

Title: WRC 4: The Official Game of the FIA World Rally Championship
Description: The official game of the 2004 FIA World Rally Championship

Title: WRC 3: The Official Game of the FIA World Rally Championship
Description: The official game of the 2003 FIA World Rally Championship.

Title: MotoGP '07
Description: Fifth game of the MotoGP series for the Playstation 2.

Title: Dragon Ball Z: Infinite World
Description: Marking the last appearance of the Dragon Ball Z franchise on the PlayStation 2, Infinite World builds upon the formula used in Dragon Ball Z: Budokai 3 by revamping the game engine, adding a new story mode, and updating the roster (including more Dragon Ball GT characters).

Title: Super Dragon Ball Z
Description: A cel-shaded arcade fighting game adaptation of the Dragon Ball manga and anime. Led by some of the team behind some of Capcom's finest fighting game franchises, Super Dragon Ball Z brings a more traditional fighting game aesthetic in an era better known for the "Budokai" and "Budokai Tenkaichi" series.

Title: Dragon Ball Z: Budokai 3
Description: The third game in the original Budokai trilogy of fighting games set in the Dragon Ball universe. Along with numerous gameplay changes, it features characters and settings from both Dragon Ball GT and some of the series' animated films.

Title: Dragon Ball Z: Budokai 2
Description: The second game in the Budokai sub-series of fighting games based on the Dragon Ball manga and animated series adds a new single-player campaign (similar to board games) and the rest of the Dragon Ball Z story arc.

Title: Backyard Wrestling: Don't Try This at Home
Description: Backyard Wrestling: Don't Try This At Home is a wrestling game where you have to defeat your enemy in the bloodiest way possible.

Title: AFL Premiership 2007
Description: AFL Premiership 2007 is based on the popular sport of Australian Rules Football.  It features all 16 AFL teams as well as their stadiums.

Title: Dog's Life
Description: A third-person action-adventure game where players don the role of a typical dog as he travels through the rural United States to rescue his love interest from mysterious dogcatchers.

Title: Adiboo and the Energy Thieves
Description: Adiboo and the Energy Thieves was an Educational Action game created by Coktel Vision.

Title: Chandragupta: Warrior Prince
Description: A 2D action beat em up developed by Immersive Games exclusively for the PlayStation 2 and PlayStation Portable in Europe

Title: A-Ressha de Ikou 2001
Description: PlayStation 2 incarnation of the A-Ressha de Ikou ("A-Train") series.

Title: G-Force
Description: Based on the movie of the same name, G-Force follows a team of guinea pigs who have secret lives as spies....IN 3-D!!!

Title: Disney Move
Description: An EyeToy Disney game released only in Europe.

Title: Jissen Pachi-Slot Hisshouhou! Hokuto no Ken Plus
Description: This is the 2nd Pachi-Slot game for the PS2.

Title: Jissen Pachi-Slot Hisshouhou! Hokuto no Ken SE
Description: A virtual slots game for the PlayStation 2 that simulates the 2006 pachi-slot machine Hokuto no Ken SE (itself based on the '80s anime adaptation of the manga series Fist of the North Star). It also received handheld ports for the PSP and DS.

Title: Jissen Pachi-Slot Hisshouhou! Hokuto no Ken 2 Ransei Haou Den Tenha No Shou
Description: A virtual slots game for the PlayStation 2 that simulates the 2007 pachi-slot machine Hokuto no Ken 2: Ransei Haou-den Tenha no Shou (itself based on the '80s anime adaptation of the manga series Fist of the North Star).

Title: Gegege no Kitarou: Ibun Youkai Kitan
Description: This is an RPG game that was devolped for the PS2.

Title: One Piece: Round the Land
Description: One Piece: Round the Land! is a game developed by Bandai for the PS2. It was released in Japan on July 29, 2004 and in Europe on December 10 of the same year.

Title: FIFA 14
Description: The 2014 installment in EA Canada's soccer simulation franchise. This was the first in the franchise to bridge the 360/PS3 to Xbox One/PS4 gap.

Title: Hunter X Hunter: Ryumyaku no Saidan
Description: Hunter X Hunter is a Japanese adventure game for the PS2. Many characters from the Hunter X Hunter universe are playable in this sidecrolling beat-em-up.

Title: Melbourne Cup Challenge
Description: Horse simulator game based on the Melbourne cup.

Title: Secret of Evangelion
Description: Secret of Evangelion is an investigative adventure game in the Shinseiki Evangelion universe. Players control of take NERV intelligence agent Kenzaki Kyouya as he unravels mysteries and flirts with Dummy Plug pilots.

Title: Hyakko: Yorozuya Jikenbo!
Description: A visual novel-style game developed and published by 5pb. for Playstation 2 based on the Hyakko anime series.

Title: Gakuen Utopia Manabi Straight! Kira Kira Happy Festa!
Description: A visual novel game developed by Marvelous Interactive based on the Manabi Straight! anime series.

Title: Hajime no Ippo: The Fighting! 2: Victorious Road
Description: Victorious Road is the sequel to Victorious Boxers. Unlike its predecessor and successor, this installment did not see release outside of Japan.

Title: Recca no Honoo: Flame of Recca - Final Burning
Description: A PlayStation 2 game based on the Flame of Recca anime.

Title: Love Com: Punch de Konto
Description: A PS2 visual novel game based on the Love*Com romantic comedy manga series, developed by AQ Interactive.

Title: Nana
Description: PS2 game released in 2005 based on the manga/anime of the same name.

Title: Keroro Gunsou: MeroMero Battle Royale Z
Description: Follow-up to Keroro Gunsou: MeroMero Battle Royale.

Title: Strawberry Panic! Girls' School in Fullbloom
Description: A PS2 visual novel from Media Works based on the light novel/anime series.

Title: Prince of Tennis: Form the Strongest Team
Description: Based on the Prince of Tennis series. This game allows you to recruit players for your tennis team, train them to build up their statistics, join team building exercises like bowling and participate in tennis tournaments.

Title: DearS
Description: A visual novel based on the DearS manga by Peach-Pit.

Title: Girls Bravo Romance15's
Description: A visual novel based on the Girls Bravo anime and manga franchise.

Title: Hard Rock Casino
Description: A casino game featuring the Hard Rock license.

Title: Ashita no Joe 2: The Anime Super Remix
Description: A video game based on the Ashita no Joe anime.

Title: Harley-Davidson: Race to the Rally
Description: Motorcycle racing game

Title: Disney Sing It! - High School Musical 3: Senior Year
Description: High School Musical 3 edition of the Disney Sing It! series

Title: Mahou Sensei Negima! 1-Jikanme: Okochama Sensei wa Mahoutsukai!
Description: The first game based on the Mahou Sensei Negima anime.

Title: Mahou Sensei Negima! 2 Jikanme: Tatakau Otometachi! Mahora Daiundokai SP
Description: The second PlayStation 2 release for the Mahou Sensei Negima series.

Title: Katekyo Hitman Reborn! Dream Hyper Battle!
Description: A PlayStation 2 fighting game in the Katekyo Hitman Reborn! series.

Title: Dragon Ball Z: Budokai
Description: The first in a long-line of 2.5D fighting games based on the Dragon Ball Z manga and anime series comes, and the first adaptation of the series to be released onto sixth-generation consoles.

Title: Eyeshield 21: AmeFoot Yarouze! Ya! Ha!
Description: A PlayStation 2 game based on the football anime Eyeshield 21.

Title: Aim for the Top! Gunbuster
Description: A Japanese only PlayStation 2 adventure game which follows the story of the classic Gainax 1988 anime OVA.

Title: Fullmetal Alchemist 3: Kami o Tsugu Shojo
Description: The third PlayStation 2 action/RPG in the Fullmetal Alchemist series. Unlike the previous two, this one did not release outside of Japan.

Title: Zoids Struggle
Description: A one-on-one fighting game based on the Zoids toy series.

Title: Top Gun
Description: Top Gun for the PS2 is a simulation game that got an Europe-only release by Blast! Entertainment in 2007.

Title: Shinkon Gattai Godannar!!
Description: 3D Fighting game based on the anime TV series.

Title: Meitantei Conan: Daieiteikoku no Isan
Description: The only Detective Conan game developed by Bandai for the PlayStation 2. It was the final Detective Conan game to be released on a PlayStation system for a span 8 years and as of 2017 it is also the final one to be a Sony exclusive.

Title: Lassie
Description: An Europe-exclusive game based on the 2005 film of the same name (as well as the 1940's novel and its subsequent films and television series).

Title: Rahxephon
Description: Science-fiction Action-adventure game based on the TV series.

Title: Steamboy
Description: Action game based off the 2004 film by Katsuhiro Otomo.

Title: Star Wars: Episode III - Revenge of the Sith
Description: An action-adventure adaptation of the final film in the Star Wars prequel trilogy, detailing both the fall of the Separatist movement and the rise of Anakin's betrayal into Darth Vader.

Title: Noddy and the Magic Book
Description: A open world PS2 childrens game

Title: Star Wars: Starfighter
Description: Three brave starfighter pilots. Three unique starfighters. One mission: Save Naboo.

Title: Aa Megami-sama
Description: An Adventure Puzzle game based on the manga and anime of the same name. Developed by Marvelous Entertainment.

Title: The Flintstones: Bedrock Racing
Description: A European-only racing game for the PS2 set in the world of The Flintstones.

Title: Captain Scarlet
Description: An Europe-exclusive racing game based on the 1960s marionette-based sci-fi series Captain Scarlet and the Mysterons.

Title: Action Man A.T.O.M.: Alpha Teens on Machines
Description: A Europe-exclusive 2007 game based on the 2005-2007 animated spin-off of the Action Man action figure toyline.

Title: Thunderbirds
Description: An Europe-exclusive game based on the 1960's marionette-based TV series of the same name.

Title: Thomas & Friends: A Day at the Races
Description: An Europe-exclusive PlayStation 2 game based on the children's TV series Thomas & Friends. Uses the system's EyeToy camera peripheral.

Title: Bob the Builder
Description: An Europe-exclusive game for the PlayStation 2 based on the children's TV series of the same name. Uses the system's EyeToy camera peripheral.

Title: Strawberry Shortcake: The Sweet Dreams Game
Description: Known in Europe as "Strawberry Shortcake: Adventures in the Land of Dreams". Tie-in with the CGI children's film Strawberry Shortcake: The Sweet Dreams Movie

Title: Jissen Pachi-Slot Hisshouhou! Salaryman Kintarou
Description: A virtual slots game for the PlayStation 2 that simulates the 2003 Rodeo pachi-slot machine Salaryman Kintarou (itself based on the '90s comedy-drama manga of the same name).

Title: DJ: Decks & FX House Edition
Description: A music creation game exclusive to the PlayStation 2.

Title: Jissen Pachi-Slot Hisshouhou! Sammy's Collection 2
Description: A virtual slots game for the PlayStation 2 that simulates two 2003 Rodeo pachi-slot machines: Senpuu no Youjinbou R (itself based on the 2001-2002 animated series Senpuu no Youjinbou) and Slotter Kintarou RX.

Title: Jissen Pachi-Slot Hisshouhou! Ultraman Club ST
Description: A virtual slots game for the PlayStation 2 that simulates the 2005 pachi-slot machine Ultraman Club ST (itself based on the Ultraman Club video game adaptations of the '60s tokusatsu television series Ultraman).

Title: Jissen Pachi-Slot Hisshouhou! Ore no Sora
Description: A virtual slots game for the PlayStation 2 that simulates the 2006 Rodeo pachi-slot machine Ore no Sora (itself based on the '70s manga of the same name).

Title: Jissen Pachinko Hisshouhou! CR Salaryman Kintarou
Description: A virtual pachinko game for the PlayStation 2 that simulates the 2006 pachinko machine CR Salaryman Kintarou (itself based on the 2001 anime adaptation of the '90s comedy-drama manga Salaryman Kintarou).

Title: Jissen Pachinko Hisshouhou! CR Hokuto no Ken
Description: A virtual pachinko game for the PlayStation 2 that simulates the 2005 pachinko machine CR Hokuto no Ken (itself based on the '80s anime adaptation of the manga Fist of the North Star).

Title: NASCAR 07
Description: The 2007 season of NASCAR.

Title: 120 En no Haru
Description: A visual novel from NekoNeko Soft.

Title: WinBack: Covert Operations
Description: Play the role of Jean-Luc Couger, a special operative for a government agency known as S.C.A.T.

Title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
Description: Take control of the world's most famous wizard as he enters the school of Hogwarts.

Title: Hype: The Time Quest
Description: A fantasy game with a world that consists entirely of Playmobil toys. Players act as Hype, a knight who must journey through time to save his kingdom from an evil, renegade god.

Title: Zwei: The Arges Adventure
Description: A puzzle action RPG developed by Falcom.

Title: Shin Megami Tensei: Persona 4
Description: Shin Megami Tensei: Persona 4 is a role-playing game developed and published by Atlus for the PlayStation 2.  It is chronologically the fifth installment in the Shin Megami Tensei: Persona series.  Like its predecessor, its gameplay combines a traditional role-playing game with elements of a social simulation.  Its critical and commercial success spawned a sizable media empire, including several spinoff titles.

Title: Pro Yakyuu Spirits 2004
Description: The first entry in Konami's longrunning series of Nippon Professional Baseball league games.

Title: Pro Yakyuu Spirits 2
Description: The 2005 edition of the popular Nippon Professional Baseball league simulation.

Title: Pro Yakyuu Spirits 3
Description: Konami's Spirits series was one of the first baseball games available for the Xbox 360.

Title: Pro Yakyuu Spirits 4
Description: The 2007 edition of the popular Nippon Professional Baseball league simulation. This version marks the series' first appearance on the Playstation 3.

Title: Pro Yakyuu Spirits 5
Description: The 2008 edition of the popular Nippon Professional Baseball league simulation.

Title: Pro Yakyuu Spirits 6
Description: The 2009 edition of Konami's longrunning Nippon Professional Baseball simulation.

Title: Pro Yakyuu Spirits 2010
Description: The 2010 edition of the very popular (in Japan) Nippon Professional League (NPB) baseball game. This year marks the series' last appearance on PlayStation 2 and first on PSP.

Title: Jikkyou Powerful Pro Yakyuu 7
Description: The seventh iteration in the main Power Pro series, and the first on the PlayStation 2.

Title: Jikkyou Powerful Pro Yakyuu 8
Description: The eighth iteration in the main Power Pro series.

Title: Jikkyou Powerful Pro Yakyuu 9
Description: The ninth iteration in the main Power Pro series.

Title: Jikkyou Powerful Pro Yakyuu 10
Description: The tenth iteration in the main Power Pro series.

Title: Jikkyou Powerful Pro Yakyuu 12
Description: The twelfth iteration in the main Power Pro series.

Title: Jikkyou Powerful Pro Yakyuu 11
Description: The eleventh iteration in the main Power Pro series.

Title: Jikkyou Powerful Major League
Description: This is the first game in an western offshoot from the main Power Pro series, featuring Major League Baseball (American) players.

Title: Jikkyou Powerful Pro Yakyuu 13
Description: The thirteenth iteration in the main Power Pro series.

Title: Jikkyou Powerful Pro Yakyuu 14
Description: The fourteenth iteration in the main Power Pro series.

Title: Jikkyou Powerful Pro Yakyuu 15
Description: The fifteenth iteration in the main Power Pro series.

Title: Jikkyou Powerful Major League 2009
Description: The 2009 edition of Konami's major league baseball franchise.

Title: Walt Disney's The Jungle Book: Rhythm n' Groove
Disney's Winnie the Pooh's Rumbly Tumbly Adventure
Description: Join Winnie the Pooh and his friends for a splendiferous bithday party in the Hundred Acre Wood!

Title: Disney Sing It
Description: Disney Sing It is a new video-based karaoke game featuring the hottest new Disney talents.

Title: Disney Th!nk Fast
Description: A four player family trivia game for Wii and PlayStation 2. Developed by Magenta Software, the game offers both multiple-choice questions and mini-game challenges.

Title: Disney Princess: Enchanted Journey
Description: Create your own princess and set forth on a journey to restore order to the Disney kingdoms.

Title: Violet no Atelier: Gramnad no Renkinjutsushi 2
Description: The fifth game in the Atelier series.

Title: Judie no Atelier: Gramnad no Renkinjutsushi
Description: The fourth game in the Atelier series.

Title: Lilie no Atelier: Salburg no Renkinjutsushi 3
Description: The third game in the Atelier series.

For the first time ever you can pick your favourite Action Girl and take to the roads to race around fairy-tale castles, holiday resorts and even through school corridors while the teachers aren’t looking!

In either single player, time trial or tournament modes, you compete in a racing game that involves eight drivers, eight vehicles, a multitude of tracks and a variety of special power-ups for use against your AI opponents.

Title: Pipo Saru 2001

Title: Paddington Bear

Description: Talk to ailing animals and help them.

Title: Babe
Description: PlayStation 2 game loosely based on the family film.

Title: The Flintstones in Viva Rock Vegas
Reservoir Dogs

This game was Europe release only.

Title: MLB 2005

Description: The 2006 iteration of 989 Studio's MLB series.

Description: No info.

Title: Sled Storm

Title: Shirogane no Torikago: The Angels with Strange Wings

Title: Gecko Blaster

Title: New Roommania: Porori Seishun
Description: The sequel to Roommania #203

Title: Vegas Casino 2

Title: Pimp My Ride Street Racing

Title: Kengo 3

Title: The Dukes of Hazzard: Return of the General Lee
James Cameron's Dark Angel
Description: A action game based on the TV series.

Title: Juiced

Title: Outlaw Golf 2
Description: A golf game for Xbox and PlayStation 2.

Title: Future Tactics: The Uprising

Title: Legends of Wrestling

Title: Ford Racing 2

Title: Ford Racing 3

Title: IHRA Drag Racing: Sportsman Edition

Title: GrooveRider:  Slot Car Thunder

Title: RoadKill

Title: World Racing

Title: Delta Force: Black Hawk Down - Team Sabre

Title: Dakar 2: The World's Ultimate Rally

Title: WWII: Tank Battles
Description: WWII: Tank Battles

Title: Radirgy

Title: Duel Savior Destiny

Title: Bleach: Hanatareshi Yabou
Description: An RPG and the second Bleach game to be released for the PS2.

Title: Combat Queen

Title: Neppachi Gold: CR Monster Mansion
Description: A comedic horror-themed pachislot game for PlayStation 2.

Title: Street Fighter: Anniversary Collection
Description: Street Fighter Anniversary Collection combines SFIII: 3rd Strike and Hyper Street Fighter II: Anniversary Edition onto one disc.

Title: D.C. Da Capo
Description: A visual novel by Circus.

Title: Ys IV: Mask of the Sun - A New Theory
Description: A remake of Ys IV: Mask of the Sun published by Taito for the PlayStation 2.

Title: Ruff Trigger: The Vanocore Conspiracy

Title: Zapper: One Wicked Cricket!
Description: Playing similar to an earlier 3D reboot of the Frogger series, Zapper stars the cricket of the same name as he hops around to rescue his little brother from a thieving bird.

Title: Rozen Maiden: duellwalzer
Description: Rozen Maiden: Duellwalzer is a visual novel game, based on the Rozen Maiden anime / manga.

Title: Street Fighter Alpha Anthology
Description: Street Fighter Alpha Anthology is a PS2 compilation of the Street Fighter Alpha series. It includes the original game, the original and Gold editions of Street Fighter Alpha 2, Street Fighter Alpha 3, and the bonus title Super Gem Fighter: Mini Mix.

Title: Operation Air Assault
Description: Operation Air Assault on PS2 is an action game that puts the player in command of a combat helicopter.

Title: Cel Damage
Description: A cel-shaded vehicular combat game.

Title: The Tale of Despereaux
Description: A poorly-received tie-in to Universal Picture's animated film.

Title: Jackass: The Game
Description: This minigame collection let's you play as cast members from Jackass, as they do crazy stunts.

Title: Frogger: The Great Quest
Description: Everybody's favorite arcade frog returns as a bipedal redneck frog, on a quest to find a princess to turn him into a prince.

Title: Phase Paradox
Description: Phase Paradox is set in the same universe as Philosoma, but it is an entirely different type of game.

Title: R: Racing Evolution
Description: Racing Simulator part of the Ridge Racer series.

Title: Dave Mirra Freestyle BMX 2
Description: The sequel to Dave Mirra's previous BMX stunt riding game, built-up for sixth-generation consoles.

Title: The Simpsons Skateboarding
Description: The city of Springfield is turned into one giant skate park in this skateboarding game based off of the immensely popular animated TV series.

Title: Endgame
Description: Endgame is a light gun game for the PS2.

Title: Batman Begins
Description: Ascend from a billionaire playboy to a feared superhero in the third-person adventure game tie-in to the 2005 feature film of the same name. It is the only game to be based on The Dark Knight Trilogy.

Title: Gravity Games Bike: Street Vert Dirt
Description: A third-person BMX stunt riding game similar to the Dave Mirra Freestyle BMX and Mat Hoffman's Pro BMX series, and the only game to use the short-lived Gravity Games license.

Title: Army Men: Sarge's War
Description: The final 3DO-developed title in the Army Men series, Sarge's War ends Sgt. Hawk's tale of shooting down fellow plastic army men with a more grimdark tone.

Title: GoDai: Elemental Force
Description: Prepare to embark on a mystical journey through the eyes of Hiro, a young man seeking the truth of his path and the sacred magic of the elements.

Title: Star Wars The Clone Wars: Republic Heroes
Description: Star Wars: The Clone Wars -- Republic Heroes takes place during the first and second seasons of the TV cartoon Star Wars: The Clone Wars. It features the art style of the cartoon and was released on Xbox 360, Wii, PC, Nintendo DS and Playstation.

Title: Obscure
Description: Obscure is a survival horror game set in an American high school with such notable features as two player co-op and the ability to combine items.

Title: Hot Wheels: Velocity X
Description: A Hot Wheels racing game.

Title: Transformers: The Game
Description: Transform and roll out with many of the characters from the live-action movie in this epic action game.

Title: Time Crisis 3
Description: Time is running out once again in Time Crisis 3 as the VSSE must neutralise the terrorist threat in this on-rails lightgun game.

Title: Hot Wheels: World Race
Description: A racing game using the Hot Wheels license.

Title: Heatseeker
Description:
Fight to win. Fight to survive!
Use the Wii Remote to fly a variety of aircraft throughout different scenarios.

Title: Transformers Tatakai
Description: Transformers Tatakai is an action game based on the popular cartoon Transformers released in Japan.

Title: Dragon Quest Characters: Torneko no Daibouken 3 - Fushigi no Dungeon
Die Hard: Vendetta
Description: A 2002 Gamecube exclusive (later released for PS2 and XBOX) FPS. It takes place five years after the Die Hard trilogy.

Title: SuperLite 2000: Othello
Description: An Othello game in Success Corp.'s SuperLite 2000 line.

Title: Resident Evil: Outbreak
Description: A multiplayer-focused spin-off of the Resident Evil series, Outbreak challenges a group of survivors (either with computer-controlled companions or with other online players) against the T-Virus outbreak in Raccoon City.

Title: Suikoden Tactics
Description: Suikoden Tactics is a tactical role-playing game developed and published by Konami for the PlayStation 2 console as part of their Suikoden series.  It is the first game of the series that falls under the strategy role-playing genre.

Title: Mortal Kombat: Armageddon
Description: The seventh installment in the violent fighting game franchise, featuring the most complete Mortal Kombat roster to date.

Title: Tsugunai: Atonement
Description: RPG featuring a cursed mercenary who possesses the bodies of others in order to help them and atone for his offenses against the gods

Title: Friends: The One with All the Trivia
Description: Friends: The One With All The Trivia does exactly what it says on the tin, offering up questions related to one of the most successful sit-coms of all time.

Title: Gintama Gin-San to Issho! Boku no Kabuki Machi Nikki
Description: A video game based on the Gintama anime series.

Title: Gungrave
Description: Gungrave is a third-person shooter revolving around an undead man named Beyond the Grave. Wielding two custom handguns and a coffin that transforms into a variety of heavy weapons, he fights to take revenge on those who wronged him.

Title: G1 Jockey
Description: The first G1 Jockey game released outside of Japan. Known as G1 Jockey 2 2001 in its native homeland.

Title: G1 Jockey 2
Description: G1 Jockey moves to the PlayStation 2 with its first numbered sequel.

Title: Rayman: Raving Rabbids
Description: A minigame collection that puts more emphasis on the Rabbids, rather than Rayman himself.

Title: Falling Stars
Description: Falling stars is a role playing videogame, developed by Ivolgamus and published by Agetec.

Title: Buzz! Junior: Monster Rumble
Description: Game page for a game in te Buzz! Junior series. It's a collection of Buzz minigames.

Title: Tennis 2K2
Description: Arcade tennis game known as Virtua Tennis 2 in Europe.

Title: Rampage: Total Destruction
Description: The latest game in the Rampage series, where you take control of a giant creature and proceed to destroy cities, building by building. You battle against the evil Dr. Vector, the man responsible for turning you and other humans into these giant monsters.

Title: PachiPara 14: Kaze to Kumo to Super Umi in Okinawa
Description: PachiPara 14: Kaze to Kumo to Super Umi in Okinawa is the last of Irem's Japan-only pachinko simulators to appear on the PS2. It also features the last open world RPG iteration of the PachiPro Fūunroku subseries to date prior to transitioning into the visual novel genre.

Title: Cricket 2002
Description: Cricket 2002 is an EA Sports title featuring commentary by veteran commentators Richie Benaud and Jim Maxwell.

Title: Cricket 2005
Description: The 2005 release of EA Sport's Cricket franchise.

Title: Inaka Kurashi: Nan no Shima no Monogatari
Description: An adventure game in the same vein as the Boku No Natsuyasumi series, released exclusively in Japan.

Title: Sonic 3D Blast
Description: Sonic 3D Blast, also known as Sonic 3D: Flickies' Island, is a 2D isometric action-adventure game in which Sonic the Hedgehog must traverse pseudo-3D environments to collect flickies, tiny little birds born out of the Sega arcade game, Flicky.

Title: World Fighting "The Ishu Kakatou Waza"
Description: The game features 10 different martial artists from around the world representing their own disciplines  competing in round-based bouts under vale tudo rules.  Released in Japan in 2003.

Title: The Getaway
Description: The Getaway is a sandbox crime game set in London.

Title: Eternal Ring
Description: Eternal Ring is a first-person RPG developed by From Software and published by Agetec, released on the PlayStation 2 in 2000.

Title: LEGO Batman: The Videogame
Description: LEGO Batman: The Video Game is an action adventure platformer focused on the combination of the popular Batman universe and the continued licensing of Lego-styled video games.

Title: Soldier of Fortune
Description: Soldier of Fortune is a violent first-person shooter where you take on the role of John Mullins, a mercenary tasked with retrieving stolen nuclear weapons.

Title: Barbie as the Island Princess
Description: Based on the movie of the same title, the game is an adventure game from Activision.

Title: Shrek's Carnival Craze
Description: Play through 28 carnival minigames with your favorite Shrek character.

Title: MLB 11: The Show
Description: Sony's MLB franchise returns for the 2011 baseball season, with PlayStation Move and 3D support.

Title: Harvest Moon: Save the Homeland
Description: Rescue your family's farm and the surrounding village from being turned into a resort. Remember... it's up to you to save the homeland.

Title: Mister Mosquito
Description: Mister Mosquito is a quirky third-person "fly"ing game published by FreshGames and Eidos. Winter is coming and Mr. Mosquito needs to store enough blood to survive! Pester the hapless Yamada family and suck enough of their blood to survive the winter ahead!

Title: Jelly Belly: Ballistic Beans
Description: A game based on the Jelly Belly brand of jelly beans.

Title: Pacific Warriors II: Dogfight
Description: Take to the Skies during the Pacific conflict of World War II.

Title: WWII: Battle Over The Pacific
Description:
WWII: Battle Over The Pacific is a flight combat that that was developed by Midas Interactive Entertainment.
It was released on the PS2, PSP, and PC.

Title: Snoopy vs. the Red Baron
Description: An arcade flying game, pitting Snoopy against his mortal enemy, the Red Baron...

Title: X-Men Origins: Wolverine
Description: X-Men Origins: Wolverine is a game based upon the movie of the same name that tells the early story of Wolverine.

Title: Shrek 2
Description: Shrek 2 is a video game based off the film of the same name. Players compete with four characters throughout eleven levels.

Title: Agent Hugo: RoboRumble
Description: A game in the Hugo series.

Title: Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six: Lockdown
Description: The fourth mainline game in the Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six series.

Title: Tiger Woods PGA Tour 07
Description: Tiger Woods PGA Tour 07 is an iteration in the popular EA sports golf series. Starring Tiger himself, the game includes improved visuals over previous games and a large cast of superstar golfers such as Phil Mickelson and Vijay Singh.

Title: Zill O'll Infinite
Description: A PlayStation 2 remake of the PS1 original that contains new endings and story lines.

Title: Harvest Moon: A Wonderful Life
Description: Harvest Moon: A Wonderful Life is the first iteration of the popular series to appear on the Nintendo Gamecube. It was later released for the PlayStation 2 as well.

Title: NRL Rugby League
Description: A Rugby League game whose title changed to accommodate each region's league (NRL for Australia, Super League for the UK). It contained Club teams from both Australia and Britain, as well as international teams.

Title: Fatal Fury: Battle Archives Volume 2
Description: A collection of all the Real Bout Fatal Fury games.

Title: Namco Museum
Description: A compilation of twelve classic Namco arcade games. This edition of Namco Museum was released only in North America for PS2, GameCube and Xbox.

Title: Daito Giken Koushiki Pachi-Slot Simulator: Yoshimune
Description: A release in the Daito Giken Koushiki Pachi-Slot series

Title: Dai Senryaku VII Exceed
Description: Enhanced, upgraded and expanded version of Dai Senryaku VII published by Valcon Games.

Title: Suikoden IV
Description: The fourth installment of Konami's long-running RPG series Suikoden. In this game, set 150 years prior to the original Suikoden, players will begin an adventure through the rough seas of the Suikoden universe's Island Nations.

Title: Ace Lightning
Description: A game based on the BBC television show Ace Lightning.

Title: 007: Everything or Nothing
Description: 007: Everything or Nothing is a 3rd-person action game from Electronic Arts in the James Bond franchise. The game features Pierce Brosnan's likeness and voice as Bond, Willem Dafoe as the chief antagonist and other notable actors as new and recurring characters in an original movie-style adventure.

Title: Drakengard 2
Description: Set eighteen years after the original Drakengard, the young warrior Nowe and Legna, the dragon that raised him, are pulled into a conflict when a group of rebels threaten the seals that hold the world's balance in check.

Title: Crimson Empire: Circumstances to Serve a Noble
Description: A QuinRose otome game for PlayStation 2 and PlayStation Portable

Title: Rogue Trooper
Description: The lone survivor of the Quartz Zone Massacre, the Rogue Trooper hunts for the traitor general in a mission of revenge.

Title: Ultimate Pro Pinball
Description: Ultimate Pro Pinball is a pinball game, offering the player a choice of three different tables.  Released on Xbox, PS2 and PC.  The game was never given a US release on any platform.

Title: Princess Maker
Description: The first game in the Princess Maker series was released in 1991.

Title: Cid the Dummy
Description: CID is a crash test dummy, take part in his adventures across wacky platforming stages to save a damsel in distress.

Title: Firefighter F.D. 18
Description: Rescue citizens trapped in burning buildings in this third-person firefighting game.

Title: Buzz!: Brain of the UK
