Description: The Buzz! franchise continues with question specific to the United Kingdom, including bands, cities, sports, television, wildlife, food and more.

Title: Bonk's Adventure
Description: As meat-loving caveman Bonk, the player battles egg-headed enemies and dastardly dinosaurs on their quest to rescue Princess Za from the clutches of the villainous and tyrannosaurus King Drool.

Title: Armen Noir
Description: Armen Noir is a Japanese PS2/PSP game by Idea Factory.

Title: Aces Of War
Description: Aces Of War is a PSP/PS2 game by Marionette.

Title: Arcobaleno!
Description: Arcobaleno! is an Idea Factory developed visual novel released only in Japan on both PlayStation 2 and PlayStation Portable.

Title: All Star Pro-Wrestling III
Description: All Star Pro-Wrestling III is a professional wrestling video game published by Square in 2003 for the PlayStation 2

Title: NFL Head Coach
Description: NFL Head Coach is the first game in EA's very in-depth football simulation series.

Title: SingStar Kent
Description: SingStar game featuring one of Sweden's biggest pop bands, Kent.

Title: Little Aid
Description: Little Aid is a Japanese PS2/PSP/PC game.

Title: ChainDive
Description: Avoid the ground by freezing and grappling onto your enemies, using momentum and physics to stylishly save the day in 2.5D action!

Title: Kiniro no Corda: La Corda d'Oro
Description: The first entry in the Kiniro no Corda role-playing series

Title: Legend of the Dragon
Description: Legend of the Dragon is a fighting game from The Game Factory for the Wii, PlayStation 2, and PSP based on the animated series of the same name. Characters can use Ki to transform into more powerful forms.

Title: Mobile Suit Gundam: Giren no Yabou - Axis No Kyoui V
Description: Mobile Suit Gundam: Giren no Yabou - Axis No Kyoui V is a Japanese PS2/PSP game.

Title: Pachi-Slot Kanzen Kōryaku: Onihama Bakusō Gurentai - Gekitō-hen
Description: A Pachi-Slot simulation on the PlayStation 2.

Title: Pachi-Slot Aruze Ōkoku 7
Description: The seventh game in the Pachi-Slot Aruze Ōkoku series.

Title: Pachi-Slot Aruze Ōkoku 6
Description: The sixth entry in the Pachi-Slot Aruze Ōkoku series. This is the first entry on the PlayStation 2.

Title: Mobile Suit Gundam SEED: Rengou vs. Z.A.F.T.
Description: Gundam SEED: Rengou (Alliance) vs Z.A.F.T. is the fourth game of the "Gundam vs" series. It covers the plot of Gundam SEED.

Title: Kiniro no Corda 2: Encore
Description: A direct follow-up to Kiniro no Corda 2.

Title: Onimusha 3: Demon Siege
Description: Samanosuke returns to battle Nobunaga, but this time in present day Paris.

Title: For Symphony: With All One's Heart Portable
Description: For Symphony: With All One's Heart Portable is a Japanese adventure game for the PSP.

Title: Buzz! Junior: Jungle Party
Description: Use Buzz! controllers to play mini games as a group of Jungle Monkeys. Great fun with simple controls for youngsters to play.

Title: Disgaea 2: Cursed Memories
Description: The Hellish Tactical Strategy RPG Disgaea: Hour of Darkness has a sequel, and Disgaea 2: Cursed Memories is here, expanding on nearly everything that made the first one great; complete with even more Prism Ranger antics! Adell must break the curse on the land and turn everyone back into Humans.

Title: Happy Feet
Description: Based on the animated movie of the same name following the story of a penguin trying to find his rhythm

Title: Phantasy Star Universe: Ambition of the Illuminous
Description: Phantasy Star Universe: Ambition of the Illuminous is the expansion pack for Phantasy Star Universe.  It was released as DLC for Xbox 360, and as a standalone disc on PC and PS2.

Title: Soul Eater: Battle Resonance
Description: A fighting game based around the manga and anime series Soul Eater. It came out on both the PS2 and PSP.

Title: Shinseiki GPX Cyber Formula: Road to the Infinity
Description: A PlayStation 2 racing game which began the Shinseiki GPX Cyber Formula: Road to the Infinity series

Title: Sakigake!! Otokojuku
Description: A fighting game based on the anime of the same name, for PlayStation 2.

Title: Bust-A-Bloc
Description: A 3D block-breaking game.

Title: ATV Offroad Fury 4
Description: ATV Offroad Fury 4 is the 4th game in the ATV Offroad Fury franchise preceding ATV Offroad Fury 3.

Title: Paparazzi
Description: Take photographs of models in one of the few Simple 2000 games that got a release outside of Japan where it is known as The Camera Kozou.

Title: Motorbike King
Description: Motorbiking game for PlayStation 2.

Title: Houkago no Love Beat
Description: Otome game where the player's romantic options are the members of a j-pop band.

Title: Car Racing Challenge
Description: A race against the clock to clear the name of a woman framed by a corrupt politician. Developed as an entry in D3's Simple 2000 budget game series.

Title: Akagi: Yami ni Furitatta Tensai
Description: Mahjong game based on a long-running manga.

Title: J-League Pro Soccer Club o Tsukurou! 5
Description: Released in 2007 for the PlayStation 2.

Title: Backyard Basketball
Description: The first installment of backyard basketball series, where you can play as cartoon versions of real NBA and WNBA players.

Title: Fitness Fun
Description: An exercising motivation game for PlayStation 2

Title: Eternal Quest
Description: Eternal Quest is a roguelike game where you navigate a warrior through a series of danger-filled floors.

Title: Bowling Xciting
Description: A bowling game from Tamsoft and D3 Publisher (Japan)/Agetec (UK)

Title: Baseball Mania
Description: A baseball game for PlayStation 2, released as part of the Simple 2000 series in Japan.

Title: Azumi
Description: Azumi is a Beat-'Em Up game created by ESP Software.

Title: Zombie Virus
Description: A Simple Series action driving game where the player must rescue survivors of a zombie plague in an ambulance and get them to the hospital for treatment before they turn.

Title: Simple 2000 Series Vol. 40: The Touyou Sandai Uranjustsu
Description: The 40th installment of the Simple 2000 series.

Title: The Rugby
Description: A rugby team management game. Part of the Simple 2000 series.

Title: Simple 2000 Series Vol. 114: The Onna Okappichi Torimonochou - Oharuchan Go Go Go!
Description: A hack-and-slash for the PlayStation 2 starring Oharuchan, a lass with a jitte.

Title: SingStar Bollywood
Description: The SingStar series takes on some Bollywood hits.

Title: Simple 2000 Series Vol. 25: The Menkyo Shutoku Simulation
Description: A driver's education simulator.

Title: Simple 2000 Series 2-in-1 Vol. 2: The Bass Fishing & The Bowling Hyper
Description: Two previously released Simple 2000 games released together for an MSRP of only 100 Yen more than one of the single releases.

Title: Runabout 3: Neo Age
Description: Bringing the Runabout experience to PlayStation 2, Neo Age moves the action to a single location: New York City.

Title: Radio Helicopter
Description: A remote-controlled helicopter simulator for PlayStation 2. The box notably boasts "immediate fun" as one of its qualities.

Title: Global Defence Force Tactics
Description: A hexagonal turn-based strategy game based on the Earth Defense Force series.

Title: Basketball Xciting
Description: A basketball simulation for PlayStation 2.

Title: Yakuza Fury
Description: Yakuza Fury is an action game by Ving-et-un Systems.

Title: Power Fighters
Description: Power Fighters is a beat 'em up that was only released in Europe and Japan.

Title: Zombie Zone
Description: Also known as Simple Series 2000 Vol. 61: The OneeChanbara, the first game in the Oneechanbara series.

Title: Demolition Girl
Description: A supermodel gets turned into an angry giant after being bitten by an alien and it is your job to save the people of Japan from her.

Title: Simple 2000 Series Vol. 38: The Yuujou Adventure: Hotaru Soul
Description: Thirty-eighth installment of the Simple 2000 series.

Title: PaRappa the Rapper 2
Description: PaRappa the Rapper 2 is a PS2 rhythm game that follows PaRappa and his friends on a quest to save the world from  "Noodlization".

Title: SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.26: Dynamite Deka
Description: SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.26: Dynamite Deka is a remake of the arcade game Dynamite Deka (aka Die Hard Arcade) for the Playstation 2.

Title: Ashita no Joe Touch: Typing Namida Hashi
Description: A typing training game based on the Ashita no Joe anime.

Title: SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.11: Hokuto no Ken
Description: A 3D remake of the Sega Mark III/Master System side-scrolling beat em 'up Hokuto no Ken (Fist of the North Star, released in the west as "Black Belt"), based on the manga and anime of the same name.

Title: Mr. Golf
Description: A golf game from Artdink and the first in the Golful Golf series.

Title: Motto Golful Golf
Description: An Artdink developed early PlayStation 2 golf game released in both Japan and Europe

Title: Ratchet: Deadlocked
Description: Ratchet: Deadlocked (releases as Ratchet: Gladiator in Europe and Australia) is the fourth game of the Ratchet & Clank series. Deadlocked places Ratchet's robotic companion, Clank, on the sidelines as a supporting character as Ratchet must survive his time in the Dreadzone to earn everyone's freedom.

Title: Escape from Monkey Island
Description: The fourth Monkey Island game and the first to be in 3D. Escape tells the tale of Guybrush Threepwood's attempts to get Elaine reelected and defeat both LeChuck and his new ally, the evil Australian Ozzie Mandrill.

Title: Shrek SuperSlam
Description: A fighting game based on the Shrek movie franchise. It is similar in structure to the Smash Bros and Power Stone games.

Title: Dr. Muto
Description:
Dr. Muto just blew up his home planet! Help him collect parts for his machine so he can rebuild his home planet.

Dr. Muto is a 3D platformer where the player takes control of Dr.Muto, a mad scientist, who uses gadgets and has the ability to morph into different animals.

Title: Nicktoons Unite!
Description: Take control of some of the many characters from Nick.  Each one has their own special power, can you master them all?

Title: Musashi: Samurai Legend
Description: This action RPG for the PlayStation 2 is the sequel to Square's Brave Fencer Musashi. Musashi is summoned once again to save the world from the growing threat posed by Gandrake Enterprises.

Title: Jurassic Park: Operation Genesis
Description: Jurassic Park: Operation Genesis is a game that allows you to build and manage your own dino-themed park. Building upon basic simulation/tycoon games Jurassic Park: Operation Genesis offers unique innovations that help it define and attach itself to the well known movie franchise.

Title: Rayman 2: The Great Escape
Description: Help to repair the damage done to the world and repel an evil pirate invasion in this critically acclaimed platforming adventure.

Title: Simple 2000 Series 2-in-1 Vol. 4: The Bushido & The Sniper 2
Description: Two Simple 2000 games packed together for even more budget release.

Title: Katana Action
Description: A feudal Japan slash-'em-up for PlayStation 2. Released in Japan as part of the Simple 2000 series.

Title: The Sims 2 Castaway
Description: Your Sims aren't in the neighbourhood anymore, welcome... to the great outdoors. Survive, explore and try to find a way off the Tropical Island that has made itself your home.

Title: SpongeBob SquarePants: Battle for Bikini Bottom
Description: Using the Duplication 3000 machine, Plankton creates an army of robots to invade Bikini Bottom. Help Spongebob, Patrick and Sandy thwart Plankton's evil plans and save the day.

Title: Ratchet & Clank: Going Commando
Description: Ratchet & Clank: Going Commando is the sequel to Ratchet & Clank and the second game in the long-running franchise developed by Insomniac Games.

Title: Marvel vs. Capcom 2: New Age of Heroes
Description: One of the most legendary crossover fighting game series is thrown into high gear with a whopping 56-character roster and new three-on-three tag-team gameplay.

Title: EyeToy: Play 2
Description: EyeToy: Play 2 is a mini-game collection that uses the Playstation 2 camera.

Title: 7 Wonders 2
Description: 7 Wonders 2 is similar to puzzle games such as Tetris or Bejewled, but rather than outright copying these popular games it takes the important aspects of both and combines them to create a game that is both fun and challenging.

Title: Fu'un Super Combo
Description: Fu'un Super Combo is a compilation disc that includes both Savage Reign and Kizuna Encounter, together. Only released in Japan.

Title: NHL 2001
Description: NHL 2001 was a hockey sim released by Electronic Arts in 2000 for the PC, the Playstaion, and the Playstation 2

Title: Stuntman: Ignition
Description: Stuntman: Ignition lets you live out the dream of getting paid to drive recklessly and with no concern for the law as you help film stunts for fictional movies.

Title: Street Fighter EX3
Description: The third and final installment of the Street Fighter EX series adds tag-team fighting, similar to Marvel vs. Capcom, and a new fighter with customizable movesets.

Title: Bloody Roar 4
Description: The fourth and final installment of the Bloody Roar series adds a variety of new gameplay mechanics (such as the revamped Beast Gauge) and game modes (including a "Career Mode" where players can enhance their characters).

Title: Juiced 2: Hot Import Nights
Description: Juiced 2: Hot Import Nights is a racing video game for various platforms.

Title: FlatOut 2
Description: Flatout 2 is a racing game that brings racing and massive destruction to it's players and to the environment as well.

Title: Army Men: Air Attack 2
Description: Army Men: Air Attack 2 is the sequel to Amy Men: Air Attack, developed by 3DO, featuring two new helicopters and a new co-pilot.

Title: Army Men: Sarge's Heroes 2
Description: Sequel to 3D0's Army Men: Sarges Heroes. Sarge and his men (and women) fight the Tans once again.

Title: Frank Herbert's Dune
Description: Frank Herbert's Dune is a 3D action game based on the TV mini-series

Title: Torrente 3: The Protector
Description: A video game based on the Spanish film of the same name by Santiago Segura.

Title: Destroy All Humans! 2
Description: Destroy All Humans! 2 is the sequel to the popular game in which you play an extra-terrestrial destroying human beings.

Title: Silent Hill 4: The Room
Description: Silent Hill 4 is the fourth installment of the Survival-Horror series of the same name. This edition stars Henry Townshend, who is possessed remotely by the town of Silent Hill and forced to face an undead serial killer and multiple hellish dimensions in order to escape from his own apartment.

Title: Ape Escape 2
Description: Ape Escape 2 is the PlayStation 2 sequel to 1999's critically acclaimed Ape Escape. It is an action platformer developed by SCEI that places the player in the shoes of Jimmy, who has to stop an army of monkeys once again led by Specter from taking over the world.

Title: Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell: Chaos Theory
Description: The third outing for Sam Fisher finds him battling against terrorists who want to take control of the world using a simple algorithmic code.

Title: Max Payne 2: The Fall of Max Payne
Description: Max Payne 2 is a film-noir action game in which the player takes control of Max Payne, in search of the murdering group masquerading as cleaners.

Title: Tengai Makyou III: Namida
Description: The third numbered entry in the Tengai Makyou series from Red Company and Hudson.

Title: NARC
Description: Narc is a 3rd person shooter in which you play as two DEA agents trying to trace a new drug called Liquid Soul. You play through gritty urban environments and are able to either become a good or a bad cop through a badge rating system.

Title: Hungry Ghosts
Description: Hungry Ghosts is a first person adventure game released only in Japan for the PlayStation 2. The player guides a guilty soul through the after world in search of redemption.

Title: Code of the Samurai
Description: Code of the Samurai is a hack and slash game featuring the Shinsengumi by Red Entertainment. It was released exclusively for the Playstation 2.

Title: Game Center USA: Midway Arcade Treasures
Description: A collection of 32 games chosen from the first two Midway Arcade Treasure games, released exclusively in Japan for PlayStation 2.

Title: F1 2002
Description: F1 2002 was the second last Formula 1 game released by EA before losing the official license to Sony Computer Entertainment. It featured drivers, tracks and races from the 2002 Formula 1 World Championship. The game also featured an advance telemetry feature that allowed users to view race infomation.

Title: True Crime: New York City
Description: True Crime: New York City is the sequel to True Crime: Streets of L.A., and is universally considered to be significantly inferior to the original game, with a worse framerate, dumber AI, and bugs that weren't present in L.A.

Title: Galactic Wrestling: Featuring Ultimate Muscle
Description: Galactic Wrestling: Featuring Ultimate Muscle is a game based on the animated series Ultimate Muscle.  It was developed by AKI Corp. and published  by Bandai.

Title: Britney's Dance Beat
Description: Britney's Dance Beat is a single player and two player rhythm game featuring the singer's songs and videos where the player's goal is to pass a series of auditions to become a dancer on her tour.

Title: SingStar Pop
Description: Pop edition of the popular SingStar series.

Title: Singstar SuomiHitit
Description: A Singstar game created for Finnish audience.

Title: Karaoke Revolution Presents American Idol Encore
namCollection
Description: A compilation of 5 Namco PS1 games including Ridge Racer, Tekken, Ace Combat 2, Mr. Driller, and Klonoa.

Title: Get on Da Mic
Description: A singing game, but for rappers.

Title: The Suffering
Description: The Suffering is a psychological horror action game set in a prison.

Title: Gradius V
Description: The sixth entry, and first straight-to-console iteration, in the fast-paced sci-fi space shooter series, Gradius V implemented 3D models and backdrops, simultaneous multiplayer, online scoreboards, "revival start," and advanced control schemes.  It is the only Gradius game not developed exclusively by Konami.

Title: Chaos Legion
Description: Chaos Legion puts players in the role of a Knight of the Dark Glyphs, Seig Warheit, who has the power to summon monsters called Legions to aid him battle against hordes of enemies. Sieg's goal is to stop his former best friend Victor Delacroix from destroying the world.

Title: Freekstyle
Description:
Freekstyle is a racing game released by EA Sports BIG in 2002.
As a part of the BIG series, the game focuses on the sport of motocross, and takes it to 
a more extreme level.

Title: Giant Robo: The Animation
Description: A licensed game where you control the Giant Robo character and fight other giant robots.  Similar to other games developed by Sandlot.

Title: WWE SmackDown! vs. RAW 2011
Description: WWE SmackDown! vs. RAW 2011 is the twelfth installment of the popular wrestling series and introduces a brand new physics system to the gameplay as well as a new WWE Universe mode.

Title: Winx Club
Description: The first game based on the popular animated kids show.

Title: Top Trumps Adventures Vol. 1: Horror & Predators
Description: The inaugural installment in the Top Trumps video game adaptations.

Title: Kiniro no Corda 2
Description: The sequel to Kiniro no Corda takes place six months after the first one.

Title: Princess Maker 2
Description: Princess Maker 2 puts you in charge of raising a magical princess who is given to you by the gods.

Title: Nuga-Cel!
Description: An Idea Factory published late generation PlayStation 2 role playing game which was only ever released in Japan

Title: Blitz: The League
Description: An arcade style football game and is a part of the long running Blitz series by Midway.

Title: Powerdrome
Description: Powerdrome is a sport born in the gutters of a universe ripped apart by war, devised as the fastest, most viscerally intense racing experience imaginable. Powerdrome is a budget title similar to F-Zero and Wipeout.

Title: Global Defence Force
Description: Protect the Earth from an onslaught of giant ants and UFOs! Released on the Sony Playstation 2 in Japan and later in Europe.

Title: Edit Racing
Description: A racing game from Yuke's with the unique feature of being able to generate tracks by inserting CDs/DVDs into the PS2. Published in D3 Publisher's Simple 2000 series.

Title: The Tousou Highway 2: Road Warrior 2050
Description: A vehicular combat race against the clock developed by Tamsoft and released under the banner of D3 Publisher's Simple 2000 series.

Title: Hot Shots Tennis
Description: A fun, cute tennis game which is a spin-off to the Hot Shots series.

Title: Tokyo Road Race
Description: Tokyo Road Race, known as Battle Gear 2 in Japan, is the first entry in Taito's arcade racing series to hit the PlayStation 2.

Title: Tokyo Xtreme Racer Zero
Description: Tokyo Xtreme Racer Zero is a street racing game based on the highways of Japan's capital city.

Title: Outlaw Tennis
Description: A comedic tennis game from Hypnotix, Inc., and a spinoff of the "Outlaw Golf" titles.

Title: Simple 2000 Series Ultimate Vol. 1: Love ★ Smash!
Description: Love ★ Smash! is the first volume of the Simple 2000 Ultimate game line.

Title: College Hoops 2K6
Description: A college basketball game from 2K Sports.

Title: War of the Monsters
Description: War of the Monsters is a 3D fighting game styled after old-school 'creature feature' films of the '50s and '60s, with a variety of playable characters inspired by movie monsters from that era.

Title: Primal
Description: Jennifer Tate enters a dark world of magic and demons as she journeys to find her boyfriend. Her companion on this journey is a noble-sounding gargoyle named Scree. Along the way, Jennifer undergoes a myriad of physical and emotional transformations as she ventures from one world to the next.

Title: Kinetica
Description: Kinetica is a futuristic racing game where people wear motorcycle like suits in which they race.

Title: Star Wars: Racer Revenge
Description: Star Wars racing game, sequel to Star Wars Episode I: Racer

Title: Ski Racing 2005 - Featuring Hermann Maier
Description: Downhill skiing game.

Title: Test Drive: Eve of Destruction
Description: Got a bad case of road rage?  Let out your aggression in this smash-em-up racer.

Title: MotoGP 2
Description: MotoGP 2 brings the excitement and energy of the fans and media into the game world like never before. MotoGP 2 is the second game in the critically acclaimed MotoGP:Ultimate Racing Technology series.

Title: Super Fruit Fall
Description: Super Fruit Fall is a puzzle game that was released on the Wii, DS, PSP, and PS2

Title: Metal Arms: Glitch in the System
Description: Metal Arms: Glitch in the System is a third-person action game developed by Swingin' Ape Studios for the GameCube, PS2, and Xbox. As Glitch you must take up arms with the Droids of Iron Star against the evil General Corrosive.

Title: Rocket Power: Beach Bandits
Description: After the sand on the beach mysteriously disappears, the Rocket Power kids must figure out what is going on.

Title: Pac-Man Fever
Description: Pac-man Fever is a mini-game collection that brings together various Namco characters to compete on various board game levels.

Title: Army Men RTS
Description: A real time strategy game set in the Army Men universe. Players collect plastic and electricity to create tiny soldiers and vehicles in the fight against the tan army.

Title: Seaman
Description: Using the Dreamcast microphone, Seaman allows players to raise a witty fish-like creature with some guidance from Leonard Nimoy.

Title: Micro Machines
Description: The 2002 version published and developed by Atari.

Title: Sacred Blaze
Description: Flight-Plan's second self-published turn-based SRPG.

Title: Idol Janshi Suchie-Pai IV
Description: A mahjong game for PlayStation 2 and PSP.

Title: Ghost Vibration
Description: An Artoon developed PlayStation 2 horror title

Title: Front Mission Online
Description: The Oceanic Community Union (OCU) and the United States of the New Continent (USN) fight for control of Huffman Island in this online chapter of the Front Mission series.

Title: _summer
Description: A visual novel from Hooksoft.

Title: Reign of Fire
Description: Based on the unpopular movie of the same name. After fire-breathing dragons awaken and nearly annihilate the human race, players take on the role of a survivor using scavenged military hardware to fight back, or become a dragon themselves and finish off the humans once and for all.

Title: Air Ranger 2: Rescue Helicopter
Description: Air Ranger 2: Rescue Helicopter is a Flight Simulation game created by Garden.

Title: Air Ranger: Rescue Helicopter
Description: Air Ranger: Rescue Helicopter is a Flight Simulation game created by Garden.

Title: Aikagi: Hidamari to Kanojo no Heyagi
Description: A visual novel from F&C FC02.

Title: After...
Description: A visual novel from Ciel.

Title: Tales of Legendia
Description: Tales of Legendia is the second full 3D game of the Tales Series. It follows Senel Coolidge and his sister Shirley, who get into a shipwreck and get stuck on a huge boat called the Legacy. Throughout the game you meet several different characters that will join your party.

Title: 50 Cent: Bulletproof
Description: Bring your bling and live the life of 50 Cent and the G-Unit as they clean up the streets of New York in this ill-regarded third-person shooter.

Title: 3LDK
Description: A visual novel from Deep Blue.

Title: NBA Live 09
Description: NBA Live 09 is the next installment in the popular basketball franchise from Electronic Arts.

Title: Homura
Description: Homura is an arcade style shoot-em-up that was released for the PS2 in Japan and Europe.

Title: Civil War: A Nation Divided
Description: Step into the boots of either a Union soldier or a Confederate soldier and fight in some of the bloodiest battles of the American Civil War

Title: Medal of Honor: European Assault
Description: The follow-up to Medal of Honor: Rising Sun returns the action to the European Theater, along with North Africa and Stalingrad.

Title: Ace Combat 04: Shattered Skies
Description: Ace Combat 4 is an arcade style combat flight game set in a fictional Earth-like universe in which a series of asteroid impacts have destabilized world politics and led to war between the nation of Erusea and the Independent State Allied Forces, or ISAF.

Title: Rogue Galaxy
Description: Join Jaster, a young adventurer, as he is hired by space pirates to search the universe for Planet Eden, a world of untold riches and eternal life.

Title: .hack//QUARANTINE - Part 4
Description: .hack//QUARANTINE is a role-playing game that simulates being an MMORPG. It is the fourth game in the .hack series, and is the conclusion to this part of the storyline.

Title: This is Football 2002
Description: Sony's football (soccer) simulation game developed by Soho Studios. This is the third game in the franchise.

Title: This is Football 2005
Description: Sony's football simulation game. It is the last game currently released in the franchise.

Title: Club Football
Description: Club football is a soccer game that came out in 18 different editions.

Title: The Typing of the Dead
Description: The Typing of the Dead is an educational game that focuses on enhancing one's typing skills through the slaughter of the undead.

Title: Hissatsu Pachi-Slot Evolution: Ninja Hattori-kun V
Description: A Ninja Kattori-kun-based pachi-slot game for Playstation 2.

Title: Hissatsu Pachinko Evolution 2: Osomatsu-kun
Description: An Osomatsu-kun pachinko game for PlayStation 2.

Title: Psi-Ops: The Mindgate Conspiracy
Description: In Psi-Ops: The Mindgate Conspiracy the player assumes the role of Nick Scryer, an amnesiac with latent psychic abilities. Join Nick as he seeks to uncover the motives behind "The Movement" and recover his forgotten memories.

Title: MVP Baseball 2005
Description: MVP Baseball 2005 is a baseball game from EA Sports. This game was EA Sports' last licensed MLB game. The announcers are Duane Kuiper and Mike Krukow.

Title: Judge Dredd: Dredd vs. Death
Description: A licensed first-person shooter created by Rebellion featuring the popular 2000AD comic book character Judge Dredd.

Title: Sonic Riders
Description: Sonic Riders stars Sonic and his friends, and their quest to win in the World Grand Prix. Their new rivals are the Babylon Rogues, a mysterious group that has information about the Chaos Emeralds.

Title: Silent Hill 3
Description: In the third installment of the Silent Hill series, a teenage girl named Heather finds herself drawn into the demonic world of Silent Hill after a strange encounter with a detective in a local shopping mall.

Title: Ratchet & Clank
Description: Ratchet & Clank is a platformer adventure game that follows two heroes, Ratchet and Clank, on their journey to save Ratchet's home planet.

Title: Volleyball Challenge
Description: This was a PS2 volleyball game featuring anime characters, based around a world cup of indoor volleyball.

Title: Snowboard Racer 2
Description: A snowboarding game only released in Europe and Japan.

Title: Maxxed Out Racing Nitro
Description: A follow-up to MaXXed Out Racing.

Title: MaXXed Out Racing
Description: MaXXed Out Racing was released for the PlayStation 2 in Europe. In Japan, it is known as Simple 2000 Series Ultimate Vol. 3: Saisoku! Zokusha King.

Title: Fugitive Hunter: War on Terror
Description: Fugitive Hunter: War on Terror is a first-person shooter, where players must find and apprehend America's ten most wanted fugitives, including Osama bin Laden.

Title: Rugby League 2
Description: Rugby League 2 is a Rugby League Sports game created by Sidhe Interactive. It allows players to play as their favourite NRL or Super Leams in a variety of single player modes and in offline multiplayer.

Title: Agent Hugo: Lemoon Twist
Description: Agent Hugo: Lemoon Twist is a 3D platformer by Coyote Console.

Title: Eye Toy: Play Sports
Description: A game that consists of mini sports games.

Title: NCAA GameBreaker 2001
Description: Gamebreaker 2001 was the first college football game to be brought to the PS2 and featured "new millenium stadium and player models" that were "detailed to perfection." It had 115 Division 1-A teams and stadiums and more than 20 bowl games. Football is a game of Inches!

Title: Climax Tennis: WTA Tour Edition
Description: Konami's WTA follow-up

Title: Formula One 2001
Description: Formula One 2001 was released on the PlayStation and PlayStation 2.

Title: Formula One 04
Description: Formula One 04 was the first game in the series to change the gameplay mechanics and is the first Sony developed Formula 1 game to feature a career mode.

Title: Formula One 2003
Description: Formula One 2003 was the first exclusive Formula 1 licensed game that Sony Computer Entertainment released previously sharing the license with EA.

Title: Sengoku Anthology
Description: Fight through demons with sword and different transformations of ancient warriors in this beat-em-up fighting game compilation of the Sengoku franchise. Includes all three Sengoku games.

Title: Max Payne
Description: Remedy's film-noir action game puts players in the role of grizzled cop Max Payne as he tries to clear his name of murder.

Title: Manhunt
Description: Busted out of death row, inmate James Earl Cash wakes up to find himself in a snuff film directed by a man who calls himself Starkweather.

Title: RA.ONE The Game
Description: The Indian film makes its way onto the PlayStation 2 and 3 with RA.ONE The Game.

Title: Germany's Next Top Model: Das Offizielle Spiel zur Staffel 2009
Description: Germany has another Next Top Model. Only this time in 2009.

Title: League Series Baseball 2
Description: The second baseball title in the Magical Sports series and the only one released outside of Japan.

Title: Dragon Quest V: Hand of the Heavenly Bride
Description: Dragon Quest V is a turn-based RPG released in 1992 and is the fifth installment in the popular Dragon Quest series. It is also the second entry in the Zenithia Trilogy, and one of the most popular games in the franchise.

Title: Koushien: Konpeki no Sora
Description: The final game in the Koushien series

Title: Magical Sports: 2000 Koushien
Description: The first of three baseball games in the Magical Sports series

Title: I/O
Description: A visual novel developed by Takumi Nakazawa's company, Regista, for the PS2 and PC.

Title: Never7: The End of Infinity
Description: The second visual novel in KID Corp's Infinity series.

Title: Surveillance Kanshisha
Description: A sci-fi adventure game developed by Sony and Production I.G for the PS2.

Title: The Saiyuki Saruden
Description: An action game which forms part of D3 Publisher's PlayStation 2 Simple Series

Title: TVDJ
Description: TVDJ is an action/rhythm game that was only released in Japan by SCEI. An impressive early PS2 game, it has cel-shaded graphics and is fully voice acted. Unfortunately, the game is only a a handful of short 5-minute stages that end up feeling more like a mini-game.

Title: Guitar Hero II
Description: Guitar Hero II is the second entry into Harmonix's popular Guitar Hero franchise, adding more songs and several new gameplay features as well as bringing the franchise to the Xbox 360.

Title: Sengoku Tenka Touitsu
Description: A strategy game for PS2/PSP by System Soft.

Title: Super Robot Wars Alpha 3
Description: A popular Japanese turn based strategy game featuring mechs from different anime series. This is the final chapter of the Super Robot Wars Alpha series; the Alpha Numbers set out to defeat the Balmar once and for all.

Title: Urban Reign
Description: Urban Reign is an old-school style 3D beat-em-up game for the Playstation 2.

Title: Kinniku Banzuke: Muscle Wars 21
Description: A Konami developed arcade sports game released exclusively for PlayStation 2 in Japan

Title: Super Robot Wars MX
Description: Super Robot Wars MX is a game in the Super Robot Wars series on the Playstation 2, which is a strategy rpg game series known for its crossovers with famous Japanese anime.  This is a spiritual sequel to Super Robot Wars Impact.

Title: Angel Profile
Description: Angel Profile is an Adventure game created by Jinx.

Title: Dragon Shadow Spell
Description: A fantasy turn-based strategy role-playing game that was released only in Japan.

Title: Spectral Souls
Description: An Idea Factory developed PlayStation 2 exclusive role playing game which was only ever released in Japan

Title: Venus & Braves: Majo to Megami to Horobi no Yogen
Description: Venus & Braves: Majo to Megami to Horobi no Yogen is a fantasy RPG and sequel to the JRPG Seven: The Calvary of Molmoth, Venus & Braves.

Title: Ichigeki Sacchu!! HoiHoi-san
Description: A Japan-only third person action game where you play as a tiny robot doll on a mission to exterminate bugs.

Title: All Star Pro-Wrestlng II
Description: All Star Pro-Wrestling II is a professional wrestling video game published by Square in 2001 for the PlayStation 2

Title: Clover no Kuni no Alice: Wonderful Wonder World
Description: This game takes place in Country of Clover.

Title: Lucian Bee's: Resurrection Supernova
Description: A 5pb developed visual novel released only in Japan

Title: Psyvariar: Complete Edition
Description: Psyvariar: Complete Edition is the PS2 port of the Japanese arcade game Psyvariar. The game includes a leveling system that upgrades your ship and features enduring fights that fill the screen with thousands of bullets.

Title: Little Anchor
Description: Adventure game developed by VRIDGE and published by D3

Title: Dodonpachi Dai-Ou-Jou
Description: The fourth game in the Donpachi series and the first to be ported to the PS2, courtesy of Arika.

Title: Loveroot Zero: Kiss Kiss * Labyrinth
Description: An adventure game for the PS2 developed by Dimple Entertainment.

Title: Mawaza
Description: A very odd 3D puzzle game published by Sony Computer entertainment. Unlike other puzzlers you play as a person in a 3D enviroment.

Title: Buzz!: The Sports Quiz
Description: The third entry in the 'Buzz!' series of quiz games, 'Buzz!: The Sports Game' focuses on the world of sports.

Title: Rozen Maiden: gebetgarten
Description: Rozen Maiden: gebetgarten is a 3D fighting game featuring characters from the Rozen Maiden manga / anime series.

Title: Another Century's Episode 2
Description: From the developers of Super Robot Wars and Armored Core, this is exactly what you'd expect: an Armored Core-style 3D action game featuring robots from a plethora of different anime series.

Title: Coloball 2002
Description: A strategy RPG for the PlayStation 2.

Title: Fairly OddParents: Breakin' Da Rules
Description: A game based on the cartoon that aired on Nickelodeon.

Title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation - 3 Dimensions of Murder
Description: Team up with the CSI Las Vegas crew to solve five murder cases as the newest member of the team. Put your detective skills to test and see if you can crack the case.

Title: Taxi Rider
Description: Taxi Rider (known as The Taxi - Untenshu ha Kimida in Japan) is one of the Simple 2000 series of games in which you drive around a city picking up customers and making money for your boss.

Title: Mana-Khemia 2: Fall of Alchemy
Description: Sequel to Mana Khemia.

Title: Ring of Red
Description: When North Japan infiltrates South Japan and steals their #1 prototype military device, its a race to stop it before it can cause another civil war.

Title: FIFA Street 2
Description: The sequel to Fifa Street, featuring more tricks and gameplay modes than the original.

Title: Romance of the Three Kingdoms VII
Description: Have your own experience in the Three Kingdoms era, while playing as one of 535 available characters ranging from Ronin to Rulers. Exciting drama awaits you no matter which path you may choose.

Title: Zipang
Description: A strategy game based on the manga and anime. A modern Japanese battleship finds itself transported back in time to World War II, and the crew must decide where their allegiances lie in the past.

Title: Hot Shots Golf 3
Description: The first PlayStation 2 entry in the Hot Shots Golf series.

Title: Real Robot Regiment
Description: A Banpresto published mech based action game released exclusively in Japan for the PlayStation 2

Title: High Heat Major League Baseball 2002
Description: 3DO's 2001 entry into their High Heat Major League Baseball series

Title: Ice Age 2: The Meltdown
Description: A game released to coincide with the move of the same name.

Title: FIFA 11
Description: FIFA 11 is the yearly, best selling football (soccer) game by EA Sports. FIFA 11 features 11 v 11 online multiplayer and the ability to play as a goalkeeper.

Title: PachiPara 13: Super Umi to Pachipro Fūunroku
Description: PachiPara 13: Super Umi to Pachipro Fūunroku is a Japanese exclusive PS2 installment in Irem's long-running pachinko simulation franchise. As in other PS2 entries in the series, it also features a story-driven open world RPG mode for those wanting to play more than just pachinko.

Title: Culdcept
Description: Best described as Magic the Gathering meets Monopoly, Culdcept is a card based board game in which you gain property, fight monsters, and battle it out for money and power.

Title: State of Emergency
Description: State of Emergency is a free-roaming action game published by Rockstar Games. It features tons of crazy weapons and fight moves to beat up anyone that comes in your way.

Title: Cold Fear
Description: Cold Fear is a survival horror game by Ubisoft where you play as Tom Hansen, a U.S. Coast Guard sent out to board a drifting Russian whaling ship in the middle of a howling storm on the Bering Sea. Things quickly go sour and Tom must fight to survive.

Title: Aliens Versus Predator: Extinction
Description: A Real Time Strategy game based in the Aliens and Predator universe, the game lets you play three different campaign modes. Predator, Alien, and Marines. The three different campaigns have different gameplay elements.

Title: Star Trek: Conquest
Description: First released on PlayStation 2 as a budget title and later ported to the Wii; Star Trek: Conquest is a strategy game that uses several races from Star Trek as its playable factions, though no specific characters from the universe make an appearance.

Title: WWE All Stars
Description: Legends and current superstars go at it in this over-the-top wrestling game from THQ's San Diego studio.

Title: Dino Stalker
Description: Called Gun Survivor 3: Dino Crisis in Japan, this dinosaur-blasting light gun shooter is the first Gun Survivor game to be released in North America.

Title: SSX
Description: Snowboard Supercross (SSX) is the ground-breaking PS2 launch title from EA Canada. It helped pave the way for many similar "extreme" sports games.

Title: Evolution Skateboarding
Description: Konami's second attempt at a skateboarding game.

Title: WWE Crush Hour
Description: Crush Hour takes the wrestlers of the WWE and inexplicably drops them into a car combat game.

Title: Star Trek: Shattered Universe
Description: Trapped in the Mirror Universe, Captain Sulu must get his ship safely through hostile territory and find a way back home. The player is cast as a fighter pilot defending the ship during sorties.

Title: Star Trek: Voyager - Elite Force
Description: Star Trek: Voyager - Elite Force puts the player in the role of Lt. Munro, a member of the Hazard Team tasked with getting Voyager out of a mysterious "isodimensional rift" trapping it and preventing it from returning to Earth.

Title: Star Trek: Encounters
Description: Star Trek: Encounters is a dual joystick shooter for the PS2, whose missions span across all Star Trek shows.

Title: Kenka Bancho
Description: The first game in the Kenka Bancho series of Japanese brawlers.

Title: Barbie Horse Adventures: Summer Camp
Description: This 3D platformer puts players in the role of Barbie as she explores the wilderness with her horse.

Title: WarJetz
Description: Take to the skis with 3DO's aerial dog-fighting extravaganza for the PlayStation 1 & 2

Title: Frequency
Description: Frequency is a music-rhythm game for the PlayStation 2. It is the predecessor to Amplitude and is Harmonix's first game in their long lineage of console rhythm games.

Title: Yumeria
Description: A visual novel for the PlayStation 2. It went on to spawn an anime series.

Title: Super Galdelic Hour
Description: 4 animals turned into busty women, who then go on to play mini-games.

Title: Dora the Explorer: Journey to the Purple Planet
Description: A Dora the Explorer game aimed at pre-school aged children.

Title: Drastic Killer
Description: A Bandai Namco and Tenky produced adventure game released late in the PlayStation 2's life

Title: Wrestle Kingdom 2: Pro Wrestling Sekai Taisen
Description: A Japanese exclusive Wrestling game from Yuke's.

Title: Armored Core: Last Raven
Description: Armored Core Last Raven is the last game in the PS2 series with a great amount of customization and levels with standardize story. With a large amount parts and millions of designs, leaves players with their own creativity and style of gameplay to approach the game difficult missions

Title: World Poker Tour
Description: Based on the television series on the Travel Channel, World Poker Tour lets you plat Texas Hold 'Em with the professionals in six 3D tour exclusive casinos.

Title: Winning Post World
Description: A Japan only entry into the Winning Post series developed by Koei in 2009

Title: The Incredibles
Description: The Incredibles stars a family of people with superpowers who try to conceal them from the outside world for fear of prejudice. Bob Parr has superhuman strength, Dash has super speed, Violet can turn invisible and project force fields and Elastigirl can stretch.

Title: NHL Hitz 20-02
Description: NHL Hitz 20-02 is an arcade hockey game with an emphasis on fast, high-scoring, hard-hitting gameplay.

Title: Romance of the Three Kingdoms VIII
Description: The eighth installment of the historical turn-based strategy game from Koei based off the novel "Three Kingdoms" by Luo Guanzhong.

Title: Ratchet & Clank: Up Your Arsenal
Description: Ratchet & Clank:  Up Your Arsenal is the third game in the Ratchet and Clank series. It is also the first to include online play.

Title: Cars
Description: A racing game/minigame collection based vaguely on the 2006 Disney/Pixar movie Cars, and features the full movie voice cast. The game varies greatly between platforms, and features infamously blatant rubber banding from AI players.

Title: Cars: Race-O-Rama
Description: Based off the Pixar film, Cars

Title: Taikou Risshiden IV
Description: A Japan only PlayStation Portable strategy game developed by Koei as part of the Taikou Risshiden series

Title: Worms Forts: Under Siege
Description: Worms Forts: Under Siege is a turn based strategy game by Team 17 which worms must destroy the enemy team or their stronghold

Title: SOCOM: U.S. Navy SEALs - Combined Assault
Description: Protect America and freedom from enemy forces in urban and rural warfare in SOCOM: U.S. Navy SEALs Combined Assault.

Title: Singstar Norsk på Norsk
Description: A Singstar game featuring only norwegian songs. The game was only released in Norway.

Title: Simple 2000 Hello Kitty Series Vol. 1: Starlight Puzzle
Description: Simple 2000 Hello Kitty Series Vol. 1: Starlight Puzzle is the first in the Hello Kitty Simple series on the PlayStation 2.

Title: SNK Slot Panic Kyuuji
Description: A Japan exclusive slots game developed by SNK Playmore for the PlayStation 2.

Title: Zero Pilot Zero
Description: The final PlayStation 2 release in the Zero Pilot series.

Title: Zero Pilot: Kosora no Kiseki
Description: Another release in the Japanese fighter plane flight simulator series.

Title: Victory Wings: Zero Pilot Series
Description: An entry in the Zero Pilot series published by Sammy Studios.

Title: Nobunaga's Ambition: Iron Triangle
Description: Nobunaga's Ambition: Iron Triangle is the latest PS2 game in the series.

Title: Richard Burns Rally
Description: Rally racing sim developed by Warthog Plc together with popular rally driver Richard Burns, it was praised for its realistic physics and is often regarded as one of the most demanding racing games on the market.

Title: Who Wants To Be A Millionaire: Second Edition
Description: Be in the hotseat once again! With the next Who wants to be a millionare: Second edition. 15 Questions, 3 lifelines and 1 millions pounds.

Title: Zathura
Description: An action game based on the movie, which is based on the popular children's book.

Title: Another Century's Episode
Description: Another Century's Episode is a Mech Sim created by From Software.

Title: Margot's Word Brain
Description: A collection of word games to challenge your brain.

Title: Obscure: The Aftermath
Description: Obscure: The Aftermath, is a horror survival game sequel to the game "Obscure".

Title: Soul Nomad & the World Eaters
Description: Soul Nomad & the World Eaters is a Strategy-RPG that focuses on fighting with large-scale units to defeat enemies without relying on the main character's overpowered stats.

Title: .hack//G.U. Vol. 2: Reminisce
Description: The second entry in the .hack//G.U. series. Follow Haseo in his search for answers and a cure for doll syndrome.

Title: Ford Bold Moves Street Racing
Description: A racing game with cars from the Ford company.

Title: Torino 2006
Description: Video game tie-in to 2006 Winter Olympic Games in Torino.

Title: Headhunter: Redemption
Description: A Sci-Fi FPS game.

Title: Carol Vorderman's Sudoku
Description: Play Sudoku with Carol Vorderman.

Title: Shining Force EXA
Description: Shining Force EXA, the second game in the Shining Force series to be developed by Neverland, is more of an action RPG akin to Diablo than previous games in the series.

Title: Warriors Orochi 2
Description: The Serpent King returns to take on the combined forces of the mightiest warriors from China and Japan's most turbulent periods.

Title: Naruto: Ultimate Ninja 2
Description: Naruto: Ultimate Ninja 2 is the second game in the Naruto: Ultimate Ninja Franchise. Adding More Characters and stages as well as a more refined combat system.

Title: Buzz!: The Mega Quiz
Description: Buzz! is a trivia game that puts the player in a fictional game show .

Title: Hot Wheels: Stunt Track Challenge
Description: A game based on the small toy cars.

Title: Mountain Bike Adrenaline
Description: A mountain biking game set in four different locations: The Rocky Mountains, The Alps, Hawaii, and The Grand Canyon.

Title: Speed Racer: The Videogame
Description: Speed Racer: The Videogame is a blisteringly fast movie tie-in racing game on courses full of loops and huge jumps, in which you're able to attack the other racers. Two different games were made for the movie, one for Nintendo Wii and Playstation 2, the other for Nintendo DS.

Title: Freedom Fighters
Description: Freedom Fighters is an alternate history squad-based shooter from IO Interactive, critically hailed for its simple yet deep squad mechanics.

Title: TMNT: Mutant Melee
Description: Mutant Melee is a 4-player fighting game set in the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles universe.

Title: Silent Hill: Shattered Memories
Description: An icy re-imagining of the classic Silent Hill, which trades weapons for frantic chase sequences as the player tries desperately to flee pursuing enemies. It takes on more of an adventure game format than traditional survival-horror.

Title: Fur Fighters
Description: Fur Fighters is a third-person shooter video game developed by Bizarre Creations for the SEGA Dreamcast, PlayStation 2 and PC platforms featuring six cuddly animals as the protagonists

Title: Need for Speed Underground
Description: Need for Speed Underground is considered to be one of the best NFS games, and one of the best selling ones, selling 15 million copies world wide.

Title: Mobile Suit Gundam: Gundam vs. Zeta Gundam
Description: An enhanced version of AEUG vs. Titans DX, Gundam vs. Zeta Gundam is the second and last "Gundam vs" game to see a Western release.

Title: Atelier Iris: Eternal Mana
Description: Atelier Iris: Eternal Mana is a console role-playing game developed by GUST for the PlayStation 2. It was published in North America by NIS America and in Europe by KOEI. It is the first game in the Atelier series to get a release outside of Japan.

Title: Airborne Troops: Countdown to D-Day
Description: Airborne Troops: Countdown to D-Day is a Historic Third Person Shooter/Action game by Wide Screen Games.

Title: Stretch Panic
Description: A puzzle-action boss rush game developed by Treasure for the Playstation 2. Linda and her demon-possessed scarf must battle against the vanity demons possessing her twelve older sisters.

Title: Monster Rancher 3
Description: Monster Rancher 3 is the 3rd installment in Namco's Monster Ranchers game series where you regenerate monsters from discs and raise them.

Title: Worms Blast
Description: Worms Blast is a VS. puzzle game that uses characters and settings from the Worms Franchise

Title: Sega Ages 2500 Series Vol. 30: Galaxy Force II - Special Extended Edition
Description: Sega Ages 2500 Series Vol. 30: Galaxy Force II - Special Extended Edition is a Rail Shooting game, developed by M2 and published by Sega

Title: NBA Street V3
Description: NBA Street V3 is the third entry in the popular NBA Street Series. Following in the footsteps of past games in the series, the game allows you to perform over the top dunks and tricks with your favorite NBA players.

Title: Tomak: Save the Earth - Love Story
Description: A Korean developed raising simulation mixed with a dating game where the player takes care of the goddess of love, who is a human head in a flower pot.

Title: NBA 2K12
Description: 2011 edition of the 2K's NBA franchise.

Title: Atari Anthology
Description: Atari Anthology is a collection of over 80 Atari games released in 2003 as Atari - 80 Classic Games in One! for Microsoft Windows, and in 2004 for the Xbox and PlayStation 2

Title: 25 to Life
Description: 25 to Life is a third person shooter video game that allows players to play cops and robbers.

Title: 7 Wonders of the Ancient World
Description: 7 Wonders of the Ancient World is a puzzle game similar to Bejeweled, and was developed by Hot Lava Games.

Title: Cinderella's Fairy Tale
Description: Cinderella's Fairy Tale, or just Cinderella, was a game released by Phoenix Games on the PlayStation 2 and Wii.

Title: Chulip
Description: Chulip tells the story of a young boy, and his quest to kiss a certain charming young girl under an old ancient tree.

Title: Jumper: Griffin's Story
Description: Based on the 2008 movie, players control the anti-hero, Griffin, in his quest to kill Paladins and avenge his parents' deaths.

Title: Spider-Man 2
Description: Spider-Man 2 is a sandbox game based on the movie of the same name.

Title: Flower, Sun and Rain
Description: Flower, Sun and Rain is a PlayStation 2 puzzle adventure game developed by Suda 51. It was also remade on the DS for Europe and the United States.

Title: Cy Girls
Description: Cy Girls is a third-person action game based off of a line of Japanese action figures. The game's story was on two discs, one for each of the two main characters that focus on different types of combat.

Title: Drakan: The Ancients' Gates
Description: Drakan: The Ancients' Gates is the sequel to the PC hit Drakan: Order of the Flame.

Title: The History Channel: Civil War - Great Battles
Description: Players take command of the Union or Confederate army and wage war state to state across a strategic map of the United States, directing troops and generals to seize capitol cities or railway hubs and fighting turn based tactical battles with armies purchased at the strategic level.

Title: Summon Night Ecstasy: Yoake No Tsubasa
Summon Night 4
Description: Strategy RPG in the Summon Night series.

Title: Summon Night 3
Description: The third entry in the mainline Summon Night series developed by Flight-Plan for the PlayStation 2.

Title: NCAA Football 10
Description: NCAA Football 10 is the 13th game in the EA's NCAA Football series. This edition of the heralded college football simulator has added a few new features to the series, such as player lock on offense and defense, higher camera angles, and a create-a-school feature.

Title: Breeders' Cup World Thoroughbred Championships
Description: A horse racing simulation game.

Title: RISK: Global Domination
Description: A digital adaptation of the classic board game.

Title: MLB 08: The Show
Description: 2008's iteration of Sony's first-party exclusive baseball franchise brings the well-regarded gameplay into next-gen with new detailed textures, lifelike player faces, online leagues, weekly roster updates and more on Playstation 3, as well as scaled-back PSP and Playstation 2 versions.

Title: Tony Hawk's Proving Ground
Description: Proving Ground took the Tony Hawk series to the East Coast while breaking skater classes down into three specific styles of play.

Title: George of the Jungle and the Search for the Secret
Description: A game featuring the character George of the cartoons and movie George of the Jungle.

Title: Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon: Advanced Warfighter
Description: The Ghost Recon team must enter Mexico City and prevent a coup d'état led by rebel Mexican forces.

Title: Batman: Rise of Sin Tzu
Description: A new villain begins his reign on Gotham City, and it's up to Batman and his allies to stop him in this brawler based on The New Adventures of Batman and Robin animated TV series.

Title: Disney/Pixar Cars: Mater-National Championship
Description: The second game release from THQ based on Pixar's computer animated movie, Cars.

Title: Whiplash
Description: A platformer following a weasel and rabbit chained together trying to escape from a product testing corporation.

Title: NBA Live 08
Description: NBA Live 08 is another yearly installment in EA's NBA Live series. The Washington Wizards' Gilbert Arenas is featured on the cover.

Title: NBA Live 2002
Description: 2002's version of EA's annual basketball franchise.  Steve Francis of the Houston Rockets was the cover athlete.

Title: NBA Live 2001
Description: This is EA sports yearly release of NBA simulation. Kevin Garnett graces the cover.

Title: NCAA Football 09
Description: 12th NCAA Football game in the NCAA football series and the 1st to have online dynasty mode and the new breakaway engine.

Title: UEFA Challenge
Description: UEFA Challenge is a football video game for PlayStation, PlayStation 2 and Microsoft Windows, developed by Infogrames Entertainment.

Title: Resident Evil: Outbreak - File #2
Description: The second Resident Evil title to feature online multiplayer, Resident Evil: Outbreak File #2 adds a number of new features and five all new scenarios to the familiar formula.

Title: Cartoon Network Racing
Description: A kart racing game featuring characters from various Cartoon Network original shows like Dexter's Laboratory, Powerpuff Girls & Johnny Bravo.

Title: kill.switch
Description: kill.switch is a third-person shooter from Namco, released in 2003, popularly known for pioneering the modern third-person cover system.

Title: Heart no Kuni no Alice
Description: This is the first game in the Alice in the Country of Hearts franchise.

Title: Hello Kitty: Roller Rescue
Description: An action-adventure rollerblading game based on the eponymous popular character and her many Sanrio friends.

Title: Resident Evil: Dead Aim
Description: Resident Evil: Dead Aim is the fourth game in the Gun Survivor series. It features a unique control scheme with exploration performed in the third person perspective while combat takes place in first person.

Title: Ys IV: Mask of the Sun
Description: The canonical fourth game in the Ys franchise. It was published on the Super Famicom by Tonkin House in Japan only and also received a PS2 remake in 2005. It remains one of the few Ys games to have never received an official English localization.

Title: Harvey Birdman: Attorney at Law
Description: Harvey Birdman: Attorney at Law is a game based on Adult Swim's TV show of  the same name.

Title: Silent Hill 2
Description: James Sunderland tries to locate his wife in the eponymous town of Silent Hill in the first sequel to the 1999 PlayStation horror game. It is the first installment of the Silent Hill series on the PlayStation 2.

Title: Totally Spies! Totally Party
Description: Play as Samantha, Clover, and Alexandra as they tackle both assignments from the World Organization Of Human Protection (WOOHP) and high school. Play different types of mini-games on 10 different game boards and become the ultimate spy.

Title: Yoshinoya
Description: Serve hot meals to customers in this Japan-only beef bowl simulator.

Title: SEGA AGES 2500 Vol. 31: Dennou Senki Virtual-On
Description: Remake of the first Virtual On game (Saturn) on PlayStation 2.

Title: SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.24: Last Bronx - Tokyo Bangaichi
SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.13: OutRun
Description: SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.13: OutRun is a remake of the arcade classic as part of the Sega Ages series. This version was included in the Sega Classics Collection when released in America and Europe.

Title: Mega Man X8
Description: When the plan for humans to colonize the Moon goes awry, it's up to Maverick Hunters X, Zero, and Axl to hunt down Mavericks in the eighth (and last) official installment of the Mega Man X series (bringing the gameplay more in-line with the series's roots).

Title: Super Monkey Ball Deluxe
Description: A compilation of the first two Super Monkey Ball games with additional stages and mini-games thrown in, released for the Xbox and PlayStation 2 instead of the GameCube. Contains over 300 stages of ball-rolling puzzle action.

Title: Street Fighter Alpha: Warriors' Dreams
Description: Set years before the World Warrior tournament of Street Fighter II, Street Fighter Alpha explores the backstories of some of the series's familiar faces (while introducing new ones) with a revamped fighting game engine (complete with a new cartoony art style).

Title: Tales of the Abyss
Description: Tales of the Abyss is the eighth main game in the Tales of franchise, telling the story of Luke fon Fabre and his quest to save the world from the sinister Oracle Knights.

Title: Haunting Ground
Description: A survival horror game, starring one Fiona Belli who awakens from a car accident to find herself trapped in a strange castle. Aided by her dog, Hewie, she must escape without falling victim to its twisted occupants.

Title: The King of Fighters: NESTS Hen
Description: Japanese compilation of KoF games '99 Evolution, 2000, and 2001 - arcade and Dreamcast versions.

Title: Motion Gravure Series: Nemoto Harumi
Description: View and navigate photos of the Japanese idol Nemoto Harumi. Released in 2003.

Title: Madden NFL 11
Description: This year's Madden is the 22nd in the annual installment and features the slogan "Simpler, Quicker, Deeper".

Title: NBA Street Vol. 2
Description: NBA Street Vol. 2 is the second game in the NBA Street series. It continues the over-the-top ridiculous style of the first one while adding a few new aspects to the game play.

Title: Madden NFL 2001
Description: Madden's first release on the PS2 system.

Title: Madden NFL 2004
Description: Madden 2004 introduced Playmaker Controls and owner mode to the Madden franchise.

Title: Madden NFL 07
Description: Madden NFL 07 was the first version of Madden to appear on the Wii and the PS3.  It also added lead blocking controls along with numerous other new features.

Title: Madden NFL 08
Description: Madden NFL 08 is the 19th installment in the Madden franchise. While flaunting enhanced graphics, this version also introduced new animations, Hit Stick 2.0, and a player "weapon" mechanic to help distinguish the good from the great.

Title: Madden NFL 09
Description: Twenty years in the making, a new Madden arrives, this gridiron great allows you to showcase your skills in this annual tradition of football Americana.

Title: Madden NFL 10
Description: Madden 10 propels us into the next decade with procedural awareness.  Madden 10 introduces a physics based player interaction engine known as Pro-Tak that features gang tackles, improved OL/DL play, and WR/DB interactions.

Title: Madden NFL 12
Description: EA's long-running NFL series returns with its 2011 release, Madden NFL 12. It features Cleveland Browns running back Peyton Hillis on the cover, who won as a result of fan voting.

Title: Radiata Stories
Description: An action-RPG by tri-Ace that tells the story of Jack Russell, an impudent young man who wants to become a knight and serve the kingdom of Radiata. It is notable for its broad selection of side-quests, and a large cast of characters who follow unique schedules.

Title: EyeToy: AntiGrav
Description: EyeToy: AntiGrav is a airboarding game made by Harmonix for the PS2 EyeToy.

Title: Kaeru Batake DE Tsukamaete: Natsu Chigira Sansen!
Description: A "fandisc" collection of epilogues and what if stories for the Kaeru Batake otome game.

Title: Barbie in the 12 Dancing Princesses
Description: Based on the 2006 direct-to-video film of the same name.

Title: Memories Off: Sorekara
Description: The fourth entry in the main Memories Off series of visual novels.

Title: Deadly Strike
Description: Deadly Strike is a rare European release of the "Simple 2000 Ultimate Series Vol. 16: Sengoku vs. Gendai" Japanese Game for the Playstation 2.

Title: Lifeline
Description: Lifeline is a game for the Playstation 2 in which players use a unique voice command system to help two people survive an alien invasion.

Title: Dance Factory
Description: Dance Factory is a game in which you dance to your own music.

Title: State of Emergency 2
Description: State of Emergency 2 is the sequel to 2002's State of Emergency, however this installment shares no similarities with the first game other than the name, and certain characters.

Title: The Offroad Buggy
Description: Go offroading in an offroad buggy.

Title: High School Musical 3: Senior Year Dance!
Description: Join in the musical with the third title in the franchise.

Title: Kita e. ~Diamond Dust + Kiss is Beginning.~
Description: Kita e. ~Diamond Dust + Kiss is Beginning.~ is a visual novel developed by Hudson Soft & Red Entertainment Corporation, and a sequel to Kita e. ~Diamond Dust~.

Title: Kita e. ~Diamond Dust~
Description: Kita e. ~Diamond Dust~ is a visual novel developed by Red Entertainment Corporation.

Title: Abarenbou Princess
Description: Follow the adventures of the rowdy princess of the Silver Bell Kingdom, Rouge, in this PS2 RPG.

Title: Thunder Force VI
Description: The next installment in the Thunder Force series. The game brings the classic scrolling shooter action to the Playstation 2.

Title: Shin Bakusou Dekotora Densetsu
Description: A PlayStation 2 entry in the Bakusou Dekotora Densetsu semi-truck racing franchise.

Title: Bakusou Dekotora Densetsu: Otoko Hanamichi Yume Roman
Description: The first PlayStation 2 entry in the Bakusou Dekotora Densetsu franchise.

Title: Barbie Horse Adventures: Riding Camp
Description: A horse-training simulation game for the Wii and DS.

Title: Hakuoki Reimeiroku
Description: A prequel to the main Hakuoki game, it tells the story of a young man who falls in with the Rōshigumi and is there for the founding of the Shinsengumi.

Title: Clock Zero: Shuuen no Ichibyou
Description: A twelve-year-old girl is haunted by dreams of her adult self living in a world in ruins.

Title: Special Forces
Description: Special Forces is a tactical shooter where players must take care of various terrorist threats around Japan. Also known as The Nippon Tokushubutai, and is part of the Simple 2000 series of games.

Title: Another Century's Episode 3: The Final
Description: Another Century's Episode 3: The Final, abbreviated as A.C.E.3, is the final game in the A.C.E series of giant robot action games. It features storylines from many different anime series.

Title: Armored Core: Nexus
Description: Armored Core: Nexus is the eighth game in the Armored Core series, adding new content to the game, including a second disc that brings back the original Armored Core game in graphic remake.

Title: Echo Night: Beyond
Description: Explore a seemingly abandoned lunar space station in this unique first-person adventure game.

Title: Armored Core 3
Description: Armored Core 3 takes place centuries after a global nuclear war forced humanity underground.  It is considered a reboot, completely unrelated to the events of the prior Armored Core games.

Title: Armored Core 2: Another Age
Description: The Expansion for the original AC2, this package includes the original game with hundreds of new missions and hundreds of new parts

Title: King's Field: The Ancient City
Description: The fourth game in FromSoftware's first-person RPG series King's Field. It is the third game to be released in the United States, and the first in the series to be featured on the PlayStation 2.

Title: Forever Kingdom
Description: A follow-up to the Action-RPG PS2 launch game Evergrace

Title: Armored Core 2
Description: Armored Core 2 is the second Mecha combat game in the Armored Core series and unlike the future games in the series, stays within the story universe of its predecessor.

Title: Evergrace
Description: A PS2 launch title action RPG by From Software, the creators of the King's Field and Souls franchises.

Title: Primal Image Vol.1
Description: A video game that was created by D's Garage 21 and Racjin. Also published by Atlus and could be regarded as rare due to its scarcity on the internet.

Title: Front Mission 4
Description: Fourth in the Series, First venture onto the Playstation 2, and a welcome addition to the Tactics RPG franchise.

Title: MX vs. ATV Untamed
Description: Race in realistic environments with ATVs or Monster Trucks.

Title: Itadaki Street 3
Description: The third sequential version of the popular Japanese board game from Enix.

Title: NFL 2K2
Description: The last of Sega's NFL 2K series to be released on the Dreamcast, later being ported to other platforms. It was one of the highest rated football games ever released.

Title: Harukanaru Toki no Naka de 4
Description: An otome dating sim.

Title: The Document of Metal Gear Solid 2
Description: The Document of Metal Gear Solid 2 is an interactive developer guide through Metal Gear Solid 2

Title: Gunparade Orchestra: Ao no Shou
Description: The final entry (The Blue Chapter) in the Gunparade Orchestra trilogy of PS2 adventure games.

Title: Gunparade Orchestra: Midori no Shou
Description: The second entry (The Green Chapter) in the Gunparade Orchestra trilogy of PS2 adventure games.

Title: Gunparade Orchestra: Shiro no Shou
Description: The first entry (White Chapter) in the Gunparade Orchestra trilogy of PS2 adventure games.

Title: Conflict Zone
Description: Real time strategy with emphasis on manipulation of media and civilians to achieve victory.

Title: The Bouncer
Description: Squaresoft's first PS2 release, The Bouncer is a beat'em up that features RPG mechanics and a branching story path. It tells the tale of three bouncers that fight to rescue a girl from the clutches of a megalomaniacal CEO. The game was known for its production values, introducing a juggling physics engine and graphical techniques such as bloom lighting and depth-of-field effects.

Title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Smash-Up
Description: A Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles game for Wii and PS2, featuring four-player fighting gameplay similar to the Super Smash Bros. series.

Title: Space Channel 5
Description: In Space Channel 5 the player takes control of Ulala, a TV diva who has to out-dance evil aliens and rescue hostages as she tries to get her TV ratings to soar. The game also features a cameo from Michael Jackson.

Title: Gran Turismo 4
Description: Gran Turismo 4 is the 4th instalment in the PlayStation-exclusive driving simulation series.

Title: Twinkle Star Sprites: La Petite Princesse
Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
Description: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix lets the player control characters from the book and movie of the same name around a recreated Hogwarts castle, using magic and performing tasks along the way.

Title: 4x4 Evolution
Description: 4x4 EVO is a racing game developed by Terminal Reality for the Windows, Macintosh, PlayStation 2 and Dreamcast.

Title: Soccer Life!
Description: Starting as an amateur footballer by training hard and making correct career choices you can gradually become a world famous professional. Apart from the football side of your career you will also be able to manage aspects of your personal life, including friendships and rivalry, dating, marriage and even raising children.

Title: Soccer Life II
Description: This sequel to Soccer Life! once again lets players start a journey as a young professional footballer and become a legend of the game.

Title: Ace Combat Zero: The Belkan War
Description: Ace Combat Zero: The Belkan War is an arcade flight game that chronicles the events 15 years prior to the Circum-Pacific war explored in Ace Combat 5: The Unsung War. The player takes the role of the mercenary Cipher fighting to curb Belkan aggression and restore peace to the continent

Title: Buzz! Junior: Robo Jam
Description: The newest addition to the Buzz! Junior series, the game takes on a space theme.

Title: Premier Manager 2004-2005
Description: Premier Manager 2004-2005 is a football management game.

Title: Road Rage 3
Description: Touge 3 (titled Road Rage 3 outside of Japan) moves the touge street racing franchise from CAVE and Atlus to the PS2.

Title: Cricket 07
Description: Released in the UK in conjunction with the 2006/2007 Ashes series, Cricket 07 is a cricket simulation developed by EA Sports

Title: Eureka Seven Vol. 1: The New Wave
Description: Find out what happened two years before the hit anime series Eureka 7.

Title: WWE SmackDown! vs. RAW
Description: The first game to use the "Smackdown vs. Raw" name brings features to the table that are now an industry standard.

Title: Capcom Classics Collection
Description: 22 Capcom games in one giant collection for the PlayStation 2 and Xbox.

Title: Fire Blade
Description: An arcade-style shooter that puts the player in control of a helicopter, with access to several weapon modes and the ability to cloak.

Title: My Street
Description: My Street puts you in control of your created character as he/she tries to beat kids at their own game, and earn the bullies' respect before the school year stars.

Title: Premier Manager 2005-2006
Description: A Game Boy Advance entry in the popular soccer management series.

Title: Red Ninja: End of Honor
Description: Red Ninja is a stealth action game in the vein of Tenchu. Developed as a collaboration between Tranji Studios and film writer Shinsuke Sato.

Title: F1 Racing Championship
Description: A racing game based around the 1999 season of Formula One.

Title: Motion Gravure Series: Mori Hiroko
Description: View and navigate photos of the Japanese idol Mori Hiroko. Released in 2003.

Title: Virtua Pro Football
Description: Released in 2006 for the European PlayStation 2. Known in Japan as "World Football Climax".

Title: SpinDrive Ping Pong
Description: SpinDrive Ping Pong is a table tennis game released for the PlayStation 2 in Europe in 2005. The original version, Fukuhara Ai no Takkyu Icchokusen, was released in Japan in 2004.

Title: Shining Tears
Description: Shining Tears was co-developed by Amusement Vision and Nextech, published by SEGA for the PlayStation 2 in 2004, and is part of the Shining Force series. It tells the story of Xion, a mysterious boy. An anime adaptation, named Shining Tears X Wind, was adapated by Studio Deen in early 2007.

Title: Remember 11: The Age of Infinity
Description: Remember11 is a visual novel developed by KID and is the 4th entry in the Infinity series.

Title: Rugby
Description: Twenty international teams, 600 players, and tournaments like VI Nation and Tri-nations are included in this sports sim.

Title: Mojib Ribbon
Description: Mojib Ribbon is a Japanese calligraphy-themed rap rhythm game for the PS2 developed by NanaOn-Sha and helmed by Masaya Matsuura of Parappa the Rapper fame. Released only in Japan, players take on the role of several characters who compose rap lyrics in real time with a mystical brush controlled by the right stick on the PS2 controller.

Title: Pryzm Chapter One: The Dark Unicorn
Description: The Black Plague is transforming everyone but unicorns into horrible creatures. Can Pryzm and Karrock, his troll rider solve this huge problem?

Title: 10,000 Bullets
Description: 10,000 Bullets is an action game by Taito. Players control Crow, a gunslinger in a world in which gunslingers fight each other to gain their opponents blood and make themselves stronger. 10,000 Bullets shares elements with games like Max Payne and GunZ.

Title: Choukousoku Reversi
Description: A game created by Success based on the popular board game Reversi.

Title: Tour de France: Centenary Edition
Description: Released by Konami in order to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the Tour de France.

Title: This is Football 2003
Description: Sony's football sim game. It is based on the 2002/2003 season and is the fourth entry in the franchise.

Title: Hakuoki Zuisouroku
Description: Side story that takes place during the original Hakuoki game, expanding on background events not previously shown and detailing Chizuru's daily life with the Shinsengumi.

Title: Shin Megami Tensei: Devil Summoner 2 - Raidou Kuzunoha vs. King Abaddon
Description: Devil Summoner 2: Raidou Kuzunoha vs. King Abaddon chronicles the return of tube-toting Raidou the 14th as he cracks another demon-infested case in this latest Devil Summoner title.

Title: Burnout Dominator
Description: Burnout Dominator is a Burnout title with a strong emphasis on boost chaining. It is possible to boost nonstop so long as the player continues to drive recklessly while boosting.

Title: Resident Evil: Survivor 2 - Code: Veronica
Description: Resident Evil: Survivor 2 - Code: Veronica is the second game in the Gun Survivor Series.  It is a light-gun game that was released in arcades, and on the PlayStation 2 in Japan and PAL regions only.

Title: FIFA Street
Description: Take freestyle football to another level in this trick-filled Fifa Street

Title: Superman: Shadow of Apokolips
Description: The Man of Steel has his hands full as he battles the combined forces of Lex Luthor, Darkseid, and their robot army in this superhero action game.

Title: Cho Aniki: Seinaru Protein Densetsu
Description: The Legend of Holy Protein is the first Cho Aniki game not developed by Masaya. It is also the first polygonal entry in the series.

Title: The Incredible Hulk: Ultimate Destruction
Description: Become the Hulk and turn the world into the ultimate plaything in this superhero action game from Radical.

Title: Ice Age: Dawn of the Dinosaurs
Description: Play as six Ice Age characters as they embark on a rescue mission across melting snow to the mysterious Dinosaur World.

Title: Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon
Description: They are the tip of the spear. They strike... swiftly, silently, and invisibly. They call themselves... "The Ghosts."

Title: SD Gundam G Generation Spirits
Description: SD Gundam G Generation Spirits is a strategy game that is focused on Gundam's "Universal Century" timeline; it covers nearly every UC Gundam series from the original 1979 anime to Victory Gundam, including several manga and videogames never before seen in G Generation.

Title: Kaeru Batake DE Tsukamaete
Description: Otome game about a group of students who end up having to take care of a shrine after angering the frog god it belongs to.

Title: Return to Castle Wolfenstein: Operation Resurrection
Description: Return to Castle Wolfenstein is an occult spin on World War II, as Hitler uses the power of the dead to try and win the war.

Title: ESPN College Hoops
Description: Sega's NCAA basketball game for the 2003 season. It would be 2K4 chronologically. Former Texas Longhorn guard, T.J. Ford was on the cover.

Title: ESPN Major League Baseball
Description: A baseball game.

Title: beatmania IIDX 3rd style
Description: The 3rd title in the beatmania IIDX series. Features the first of several Dance Express High Speed licenses.

Title: Desert Kingdom Portable
Description: PSP port of Otomate's 2010 otome game

Title: Pro Evolution Soccer 2011
Description: Pro Evolution Soccer 2011, also known as Winning Eleven 2011, and usually shortened to PES 2011 or WE 2011, will be the new installment in Konami's strongly followed football (soccer) series. It will be released on September 30th in Europe, and on October 5th in the US.

Title: Golden Age of Racing
Description: A racing sim for the PC and PS2.

Title: Wizardry: Tale of the Forsaken Land
Description: A first-person turn-based RPG developed by Racjin and Atlus. It is inspired by Sir-Tech's venerable Wizardry series and features similar gameplay with a JRPG twist.

Title: Call of Duty: World at War Final Fronts
Description: A Playstation 2 exclusive companion piece to World at War, featuring unique missions, engagements and challenges.

Title: Clock Tower 3
